Reviews.Title: “Perfect service & location”
Reviews.Author: paul_hugill
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, and working in the industry it is certainly something that other hotels can learn from. A great location, only a few minutes walk from the Centraal station. The room was decent although it wasn't really a focus as we weren't there too much. The breakfast was great as it had plenty of options which was great for setting you up for a busy day. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jmhenne
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week in Amsterdam. We stayed 5 nights at the Crowne Plaza. We found the staff at the hotel extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The location couldn't be better if you want to be close to the city center and rail station. A fantastic stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated”
Reviews.Author: WENDYMON
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located, only 5 minutes walk from the train station which is very convenient when you are arriving with the Thalys. As it is in the city center, closed to the red quarter, you can then visit many places only by walking. Lobby is beautiful, decorated in quite a modern style. Staff is very nice and welcoming. Rooms are very comfortable : good litery and nice bathrooms. This was overall a very good experience and we will definitely go back there next time we will visit Amsterdam for a weekend !

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located comfort”
Reviews.Author: petercurran
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful upon arrival to departure. Right in the middle of everything, loads of pubs and restaurants nearby, though the location was a bit of a busy untidy street, the hotel itself didn't reflect the outside environment. had a great time watching people coming in at the end of the night in various stages of drunkeness, very funny. Though generally gave the view of a business hotel, it had plenty of tourists in it. love amsterdam, will come again, but found the hotel slightly above my price range, so will have to go more compact and bijoux next time! thank you staff at crowne plaza, you are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChooMichael
Reviews.Content: This is the best Crowne Plaza i have stayed in. Stayed there for 3 nights. Rooms is excellent, spacious and comfortable. Location is very central, easy for us tourist to get in and out. There is also a long stretch of shops behind the hotel. Excellent choice for holiday makers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: KeepExploring
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here immensely - were able to check in when we arrived at noon. Room was spacious and immaculate, and quiet despite being on a busy street close to the Centraal Station. Staff always helpful and friendly. Our choice for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Top marks all around”
Reviews.Author: inkwave17
Reviews.Content: The best Crowne Plaza I have stayed in! Location is fantastic, 5 mins walk to the train station and easy flat walking or quick tram ride pretty much anywhere in Amsterdam. The hotel itself is very well presented, feels very secure despite the proximity to the station, and is staffed by very professional, service-minded employees. I stayed in a club room and was also given a room with original wooden beams - very cozy and a nice touch in a chain hotel. The room was very large by urban European hotel standards, with plenty of room for a couch, desk, wardrobe, double bed, etc. Everything was spotless and in excellent condition. TV included two BBC channels and a few other English stations. Room was very quiet although the rumble of the trams going past was audible. Bathroom was a tad on the small size, but I attribute that to being under the eaves. My only quibble was that the shower water temperature fluctuated from cold to scalding hot no matter which setting I put it on, making showers a less than relaxing experience in the morning! The Club included free internet and printing as well as the usual comfortable lounge area with international magazines, two TVs, boardgames as well as snacks and drinks all day. The snacks at night were just that, rather than the hot dishes provided at other Clubs I have visited, but were perfectly fine for a drink and a nibble after a long day of sightseeing. Breakfast in the Club was more than enough to fill up for the day - breads, pastries, meats, cheese, yogurt, cereal, fruit, etc. Staff were very prompt in refilling the stations and cleaning up, even during the morning rush. I had one issue with a neighbor banging on his room door at 2am after being locked out, but this was dealt with swiftly and discreetly by the hotel staff and the next day I received a much-appreciated apology note from the manager on duty along with a dessert plate and bottle of wine. This is just one example, but I saw many instances of such attention to service throughout my time at the Crowne Plaza and was very impressed. Overall, this was a hotel I would definitely recommend to fellow travelers and I will stay here again next time I am in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: travelmum415
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the CP for business and also had a three-day meeting in their rooftop meeting space. I cannot thank the hotel staff enough for their hospitality, attention to detail and responsiveness. My hotel room was comfortable, quiet and extremely clean. I was upgraded and enjoyed an in-room espresso machine, a welcome sight to cure early morning jet lag. The lavender aromatherapy amenity items were also a welcome touch --- one of those little things that are fun to try when on the road. The rooftop meeting space was terrific ---- windows let in lots of light and views of the city skyline. We enjoyed excellent snacks during breaks, from fresh juice smoothies to small bites of Dutch pastries, all brought in by a friendly and accommodating hotel staff. The lunches we enjoyed during meeting breaks in the hotel restaurant were also very good. Dishes were light, fresh and served tapas style, which was ideal for ur group. Be sure to check out their Ideation Room ---- a great offering to complement their more traditional meeting space. If you stay here, I also recommend a juice/smoothie bar a few blocks away (go left as you leave the hotel, small green sign just past the cookie shop) for a carrot ginger juice and a homemade waffle. The CP was an excellent hotel choice for this trip and would be the place I would return to on personal travel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kellyMunich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights over Easter. My lasting impression is how incredibly friendly the employees were. We had a room in the quiet zone, on the first floor. The view was non-existent, but that was no problem. We did have some noise coming from the hallway and from the room above (even with ear plugs). They do provide an herbal sleep spray. There was a nice tea/coffee service. Iron and ironing board were provided. Great location. Loads of bars and restaurants nearby. Parking was expensive, 50 euros per day. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: William T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is recommended for American travellers that don't want to gamble on European boutique hotels. How do I know? Because I am that American traveller that doesn't like to gamble on European boutique hotels. The Crowne Plaza City Centre is in a great location. Do NOT make the mistake my wife and I made of taking the bus from the airport (This is especially for those that purchase the Holland pass). PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE take the train to the Central Station. The tickets are quite reasonable and the ride is about 15mins. Once you arrive at the Central Station, you have a pleasant 10min walk to the hotel. If you're feeling tired- you can always hop on the tram. The hotel is modern; the staff is quite hospitable; and last but not least- the hotel is clean! Cleanliness means a great deal to my wife and I. We were both very pleased. Note to fellow American travellers: unlike many European hotels, the Crowne Plaza City Centre has face towels. Face towels (aka as wash cloths) and European hotels don't always go hand and hand. When we visited Prague, they offered hand towels rather than face towels. It's the little things, you know? As for ammenities, the fitness room they have is quite adequate. If memory serves me correctly, there are five cardio machines; a dumbbell rack; a bench; one palates ball; and a three station machine weight centre. The fitness room is of descent size- I didn't feel smothered at all (and I worked out twice in a 3-day stay). The room also has a water cooler w/ cups; and a mens and women's changing room (w/ additional towels available). The fitness room also has a good size flat screen mounted on the wall. The office centre has 3 desktops and a printer for those that need to print directions, passes or plane tickets. Your lodging fee also includes one bottle of Spa sparkling water that housekeeping replaces after each visit. Note: My wife and I don't believe anything is complimentary- YOU PAID FOR IT! The rooms also have easy to use safes. We didnâ€™t have any worries about locking up our passports; jewellery; gadgets; etc. We didnâ€™t eat at the onsite restaurant, or make use of the snack refrigerator in our room. Ice machines are not on every floor. We stayed on the 5th floor, and I had to go to the 6th floor for ice. That was not a big deal at all. Last but not least, the hotel is surrounded by plenty of shops; eateries; cafes, and coffee shops. If you're not one for walking, the closest tram stop is no more than a 3min walk from the hotel. The only gripe I have is the fee associated w/ wifi. There is no reason anyone should have to pay for Internet or wifi. I didnâ€™t allow this one hiccup to jade my overall experience. My wife and I have already made this our hotel of choice if we're ever in Amsterdam. Bottom line: Great location; clean; secure, convenient and a descent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Friendly Staff......Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Mark_Brighton
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a club room over Easter and have to say it is one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in. Check in was efficient and friendly and we were told that if we wanted to use the wi-fi it would be complimentary - not sure if this was because of the room type booked. The room was great with huge king-size bed, Nespresso coffee machine and lovely Rituals toiletries in the bathroom. We used the club lounge most days as it was a quiet retreat where you could enjoy a coffee or glass of wine and have a chat or watch TV. Continental breakfast was available in the club lounge but we took breakfast in the restaurant - a good range of food was on offer. Used the gym a few times and although not huge was adequate to keep up the routine!! The sauna in the changing rooms was a good place to relax for a while. All the staff were very friendly and made you feel welcome. We will definitely visit again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Napoleon61
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights in the beginning of April 2012. Upon arrival our prepaid "standard" room was upgraded to a club room. When requesting a quiet room, we were placed on the fifth floor in the part of the building with a "quiet zone". And yes, quiet it was. The only sound was the slight noise from the trams outside, which did not bother us much. Giant king bed and nespresso coffee maker. Breakfast was not included in our rate of 170-190 euros for the various nights - but hey, 25 euros per person for breakfast, who would think it is worth it? Tons of restaurants within one or two minutes walking. Short walk to all central places, location could not be better. Easy train ride from the airport and 5 minute walk to the hotel. We rented a car from the Avis place close to Leidseplein for a drive to the Keukenhof flower park. Nice outing. All in all, a very good stay at the Crowne Plaza City Centre. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location”
Reviews.Author: Zhilin
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night only at Crown Plaza City Centre Amsterdam. It's location is superb! Everything seems to be within walking distance. The receptionist is very friendly. The room is big and new. It's a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “exelent but not for all”
Reviews.Author: travellerGregory
Reviews.Content: High hotel prices are fully substantiated by high service quality. But the location itself is not good for all purposes: close to the main station the hotel is surrounded by questionable facilities with suspicious people in the evening. Not good for the children.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, supurb location”
Reviews.Author: Aina25
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning and expected to deposited our bags while shopping, but the staff found a room for us right away, which was a pleasant surprise. The hotel is beautifully designed and newly refitted. We booked a superior room which was suprisingly spacious. The location is as good as it gets. The service from the hotel staff was excellent. We would highly recommend this hotell.

Reviews.Title: “centrum crowne plaza is really central!”
Reviews.Author: jeyan09
Reviews.Content: stayed in centrum c.p for business 3 nights,nice staff,small rooms,micro gym however very central and close to most attractions in amsterdam. for business visitors I strongly recommend 6 th floor meeting room,it has a very nice terrace and good sunlight room(ideal for 20 people) ... I believe it is also not a bad long weekend hotel for the visitors who think 150-180 euros per night is a reasonable amount for the sake of being in the centre of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotless and modern”
Reviews.Author: nikendayu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is closed to every attraction in Amsterdam, it's 5 mins walking from central station, 10 minutes to Debijenkorf Mall, another 5 - 10 minutes to red light district. It is surrounded by shops and restaurant, where you can find anything you need. The room is clean, bed is so comfortable with 4 big pillows. Bathroom is spotless and comparable to 5 star hotel. Definitely a hotel that ure looking for if you want a great location with high hygiene standard.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, great service, v nice bar”
Reviews.Author: scdaub
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights. We arrived in Amsterdam at 9 am so it was very nice to find our room already available. Waiting til 3 pm can be such an inconvenience! We didn't eat at the restaurant but did enjoy sitting in the inviting lobby areas after grabbing a beer or coffee from the bar, multiple times. Very helpful staff. Desk clerks were great at helping you find stuff. Room was fine, bathroom nice---only one robe for some reason but we didn't bother to ask for another. Temperature control was not a problem, sounds from outside or next door, no problem. Internet is free in the basement business office, where there are 3 desktop computers. Otherwise the wireless is pricey. We would have like some drawer space into which to lay clothing. We had to live out of our bags. We've stayed in swankier hotels in Amsterdam but this one is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Around the corner from everything”
Reviews.Author: Floppy12
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times, this particular experience was my most recent one. I was travelling for business on my own for 2 nights. At check-in, I was given a disabled room with twin beds, which are the two things I really don't like! I asked for a double room and they said there wasn't one available until tomorrow. I was not happy so asked for them to look again and get back to me. In the end, I was moved to a smaller room but it was a double so I was happy. The hotel is in a really good location, you can sneak through the small streets to reach the main Damrak area and the Centraal station is just down & across the road, 2-3 minute walk. Wi-fi internet is not inclusive and costs 19.95 EUR per 24 hours. You can pick up a train ticket to Schiphol airport at concierge on your way out for the same price as at the station.

Reviews.Title: “A high quality stay”
Reviews.Author: System38
Reviews.Content: I have been considering the Crowne Plaza for a while so was more than happy to book when a 2-4-1 offer came along, using loyalty points I extended my stay to three nights. I cannot praise enough the high levels of service and accommodation I experienced during my stay. A flawless 'early' check-in set the tone, it really is good to see that some hotels are flexible when guests arrive early, especially when it is done without any fuss whatsoever. My room was spotless and the bed oh so comfortable, in fact for the bed alone I wished my stay had been for longer. Throughout my stay the staff I encountered were polite and efficient, especially the night porter who very 'bravely' dealt with a lost room card situation in the early hours, thank you! Also,there must be room cleaning staff somewhere in the hotel as my room was serviced to a high standard every day, but did I see or hear them at all? No, now that's good!! The Crowne Plaza must be considered when looking to stay in Amsterdam, the location is as good as it gets, the staff and hotel facilities exceeded my expectations. Take note of all of the positive reviews, trust your best judgement, as so many people cannot be wrong, and you won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay for our group!”
Reviews.Author: Micmac85
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 celebrating my friends 50th. We felt like every member of staff knew us personally as the service we received was so personal and friendly. Check in staff and the bar staff were chatty and knowledgable. In particular, Emi and the lovely chap on the bar while we there, made it a special stay for us. Breakfast was a generous selection of the usual items found in big hotel chains. Eggs to order were available too. 25 euros is a little steep but luckily ours was included in the room tariff. We had a tasty meal in the Dorius restaurant also. Happy hour from 4-5 and 11-12 makes the 4 euro rose even more of a bargain. My only niggle is the stuffy rooms and my group felt bunged up every morning. I think we fell victim to air conditioning though, not the hotels fault. Overall, a wonderful stay in a fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, good refit”
Reviews.Author: PlantmanLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, clean, newly refitted hotel with helpful staff, in a great central location will return again.

Reviews.Title: “A very Happy Birthday”
Reviews.Author: William P
Reviews.Content: On a visit to Amsterdam on the 19th March to celebrate my 50th Birthday on the 21st March, my wife and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza City Centre Hotel. I chose this particular hotel because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor..I was NOT disappointed!! Upon arrival, during the check in process we were asked to present our passports to verify our identity. The helpful and friendly young lady behind the desk noticed, without any prompting that it was my birthday in a couple of days and asked if this was the reason for the trip? Yes I replied, as I signed the necessary form to release the key card and then off we went to our Superior non smoking room. Our first impressions are that The Hotel looks and smells like new, The staff are warm and friendly. The room was well appointed and very clean, and the bed was crisp and comfortable. As for the location it could not be better. Only a stones throw away from Central station and just a few minutes walk from Dam square. Perfect! The next day after a morning stroll, we returned to our room to find a birthday card had been left for me, along with a bottle of wine!! What a nice suprise!! On our last day, after a good nights sleep, we checked out of the hotel at 12:00 noon on the 21st March and another member of staff presented me with a box of biscuits and wished me a Happy Birthday!! Unbelievable!! I love the Dutch!! The whole experience of staying at this hotel was a pleasure from start to finish and they made me feel like a VIP on my special day!! I would like to extend a Thank you to all the warm and friendly staff at the Crowne Plaza City Centre Hotel in Amsterdam and look forward to seeing them again in the not too distant future..... WMP.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: dizzyrascaldj
Reviews.Content: I would not normally book a chain hotel however the choice of hotel was not down to me so our group of ten were booked in. The service of the reception staff and the concierge was spot on and the rooms were exceptionally clean and had everything you needed. I especially liked the sleep sound pack, a nice touch. The bar staff were a little hit and miss but overall they were helpful. The location of the hotel was absolutely spot on, convenient for sightseeing and nightlife. We all thoroughly enjoyed Amsterdam and our stay.

Reviews.Title: “supurb location and excellent quality”
Reviews.Author: debcox
Reviews.Content: We only stopped here for two nights but were very impressed with the high level of service and rooms, its ideally located as its states on the web site, we had a car which we were able to park in their underground car park. the breakfast was wonderful with a great selection to keep anybody going. usual high standard crown plaza,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: rjsluman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in January 2012, and have been meaning to write a review. This hotel is located a stone's throw from Centraal Station, has tram stops all around, and it was never difficult to find a taxi if you prefer. It is also an easy, short walk to either of the RLD's, shopping, restaurants, coffee shops, and Dam Square. The rooms were clean and modern. The staff was very helpful, and assisted me without delay the few times I had a need or question. Room service was fantastic.....food was great and service was fast. Overall, everything was fantastic, and I will be staying here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GraemeShanghai
Reviews.Content: This property has been renovated to a high standard since my last visit - great location - friendly staff. I arrived at 6am and it was refreshing to be given a room immediately rather than "sorry sir check in time is 3pm" which a lot of hotels adopt. All in all a great stay. My review of the restaurant is seperate but worth reading!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, brand spanking new”
Reviews.Author: C_and_MH
Reviews.Content: Right outside of the central station the hotel is very convenient. The rooms are large and very clean and new. The staff is also friendly and engaging. Only down side wifi is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Just keeps getting better and better”
Reviews.Author: lfcmad2002
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd review now on this hotel. Just come back from a weekend that i had booked as a reward night.I was checked in as normal by the most friendliest hotel staff i have ever come across,I was explained that as a Platinum member they had upgraded me from a superior Twin bedded room to an executive room with the following benefits: 2 free drinks complimentary wifi (you have to charge to room,but automatically comes off after midnight) 50% discount off breakfast (never managed to get up for breakfast haha,but sure it would of been first class) 25% discount on calls 25% discount on valet parking At first i was a little disappointed that my room only had 2 single beds,where as i was used to he twin bedded rooms previously as the beds were huge,but to be honest they were perfect anyway and the most comfiest mattress we have both slept on (where do you get them as i want one for my house) The room also had a huge work station and a coffee machine As we never made it up till past 1400pm one day we had a letter posted to room saying our room would not be made up,but to contact them if we require anything,so i asked for the bathroom to be cleaned and towels replaced and was done straight away(amazing service) I managed to knock over a vodka in the mini bar so had that on my bill,but a simple visit to front desk got that swiftly adjusted(again perfect service) We were on the 4th floor and there was not a whisper anywhere in the hotel,so nice not to have loads of banging doors (only banging headaches haha) We had room service on Sat and had the cheese and ham toastie with chips,the service was amazing and the food great quality at only 6.50 euro each plus a overall 2.50 surcharge (great value that so please keep up the good work) The only thing i don't like about the room is the location of plug sockets 1 under the desk (had to crawl around floor) 2 beside coffee machine,but hard to get in about for the coffee machine and 1 on floor for a light,but the phone charger would not fit as too close to floor,so overall the locations of plugs not great as they are not near where you would like them (for me that would be beside bedside cabinet) Loved the new entry system for the rooms,very easy to use just hold you card against it and it opens Next time i stay i would love to try out the club lounge,but cant work out what room i would need to qualify for this? Can`t wait till i visit again,still the best hotel in Europe with the best customer care levels throughout the hotel i have stayed in (Front desk staff,bar staff,late duty staff,housekeeping all deserve praise)

Reviews.Title: “Go on...treat yourself”
Reviews.Author: vermeer
Reviews.Content: All right the Crowne Plaza is part of a huge chain of hotels, but staying here you would not know it. Really well located within walking distance of Amsterdam Railway Station and handily placed for the Jordaan and the shops. The staff here are unfailingly polite and helpful. If you are a Priority Club Platinum member by virtue of lots of stays you should get certain recognition such as a complimentary upgrade. Members will know that lots of hotels in the chain ignore this. Certainly not at the CP. I was iimmediately upgraded, given free internet, two free drinks in the bar and a half price breakfast. The room was large and comfortable and our whole three night stay was a delight. Our only minor quibble was the poor internet reception in the room. Wireless is essential. We can't complain too much as we were given the service free. However if you want to pay it is â‚¬20 for 24 hours. Way too much

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kvyas
Reviews.Content: It's a short walk from the Centraal station. Very convenient to the center city and easy to walk anywhere. The hotel is clean and well organized. The rooms are nice and the overall experience was very positive. A bit on the pricey side, but that is expected with at this location. Will defiantly come back

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but luxurious”
Reviews.Author: FloppyCopy
Reviews.Content: This is primary a business hotel. So if you plan to stay in an inexpensive hotel, this is not it. Stayed in 504. No noise from other rooms. Expensive internett 20 euros a day. Expensive breakfast 20 euros. Great interior and accessories in room, even a bathtub. Friendly staff! Had some issues with check out, when lots of room service where charged to the room, that had not been used at all. But the staff where very helpful at all times, so it was never a big issue. Will recommend it to people traveling on business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_AGM
Reviews.Content: The staff was so helpful and friendly. I was really impressed by how they went out of their way to make sure my stay was great. The room was very clean and comfortable. The thermostat was easily controlled by me which is not always the case. I was perfectly comfortable in the room. The location is great for this hotel, just a few minutes from Central Station. There are a lot of great places (sights, restaurants, shopping, etc) within walking distance. There is a tram stop right in front of the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room, shame about the sheets”
Reviews.Author: winterson66
Reviews.Content: Good central location, clean and up to date hotel, small but decent gym with weights, nice room. The only problem for me is I don't like the plastic undersheets some hotels use. No problem, I just slept on the duvet...

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant vibe in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KayDude
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this nice Crowne Plaza back in September when I capped of an amazing two week Eurotrip where me and a couple of friends toured the continent. We were all in a pretty bad physical shape and needed a nice relaxing hotel to help us rejuvenate and enjoy the great city that is Amsterdam. Luckily the place was amazing, as soon as we walked in the lobby we knew we were in for a treat. The staff were extremely professional and got us our room in a matter of minutes. The room was pretty small, what you would expect from Amsterdam, but very clean and had a nicely homely feel to it. I've been to many Crowne Plazas before and non were this intimate, even the lobby had a room that looked like a living room with books and a fire place, really cozy! Location-wise the hotel was smack in the middle of Amsterdam, 5 minutes away from Schipol and 5 minutes away from Dam square, cant ask for more. Where this hotel fell short was the lack of "extra" services, and the fact that there was no free wifi in the rooms. They did have a small computer room in the basement which was open 24 hours, but it wasnt convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: FussyTraveller34
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few minutes walk away from Central Station, extremely convenient. We were greeted straight away and check-in took only a couple of minutes. Our room on the 4th floor was immaculate and very quiet. The bed, linen, and pillows were wonderfully comfortable and the quality of sleep was amazing! The hotel (whilst not in the most attractive of areas) is great for seeing all the sights and we walked everywhere. We didn't eat in the hotel but there are a number of eateries close by. We had a couple of drinks in the bar area which was very relaxing. All in all a very pleasant stay and one to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LE21
Reviews.Content: It took 20 minutes by train to get to the Centraal station from the airport, a single ticket is only 4.30 euros. The hotel is in a very good location. We went on foot everywhere, but it is still away from all the noise, so we had a good night's sleep (I am missing the pillows!) Fantastic service from all staff. The concierges were very helpful and knowlegable, buy the canal tour tickets from them, they are a bit cheaper than in the ticket office.

Reviews.Title: “Great improvement after their renovation”
Reviews.Author: garyinternational
Reviews.Content: Great service, great rooms, great club lounge. In the middle of all action; great place to stay (a bit noisy but not that bad)

Reviews.Title: “The poor service does not bring the big name of Crown Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: RamiaAdnyana
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in many of Int'l brand including Crown Plaza. my last stay in Crown Plaza Amsterdam is the worst. The check in process take more than 45 minutes after our long journey from ASIA. We are shocked by the service provided by the unwell trainined receptionist. We are repeated guest and always stay in Crown Plaza every time I am in Amsterrdam. the poor concierge provide lousy information, every time we ask some information always wrong and looks not very interest and not willing to serve us. we asked what time is the Soup Kitchen open? Small rest just in front of the hotel, the answer is 11:00 - 11 pm in fact they open at 8 AM. We asked what time is the holland casino open and easily the concierge responses that they open at 2 PM. In fact they open 12:00. Last year I left Sony Camera Charge in my room and expect that they will keep it and notify myself either by email or fax but never happen. I just remind Crown Plaza and as a wake up there is something missing here. your service is below our expectation! If you want to keep your brand exist! Please ca of the small details. I wish to one back with a better service improvement!

Reviews.Title: “Always reliable. Good service. Comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: JamieW
Reviews.Content: Stay here relatively often in Amsterdam on business and it's become a no brainer/safe bet. Close to Central Station. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms a decent size and very comfy. Love fhe pillows. Food in restauranf is great and staff efficienf and friendly (compared to service in many Dutch restaurants it's exceptional).

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: eggyhewitt
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Cowne Plaza-Amsterdam and had a good time. It is only approx 10 mins walk from Central Station and all the main attractions. All the staff were very friendly, the room was lovely and very clean with everything you would expect. The hotel restaurant was of a very high standard with tasty meals. We would have no problems recommending the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: sverkhovsky
Reviews.Content: I spent one night there after when I had an 18 hour layover in Amsterdam. The hotel was very nice. The room wasn't huge, but big enough. Nice large bed. Good shower. Good tv and minibar. The location is fantastic - 5 minute walk from Central station. Also, the staff was great; Very friendly and helpful. Also, the common facilities (lounge, lobby, business center, etc) are great. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Michealdoody
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 17th to 20th february. It was an easy 5 minute walk from Centraal Station after getting the train from Schipol. The hotel itself is very modern inside and is spotlessly clean throughout. The room had everthing you would want- comfortable bed, large flat screen tv, tea and coffee facilities, a safe and a very well appointed bathroom. The hotel also has an excellent bar and restaurant as well as a concierge. The Location of the hotel is brilliant, on only a 10 min walk to Dam square. The hotel is located close enough to all the hustle and bustle but far enough away to not be bothered by noise. One final point, as i was celebrating my birthday 1 of the days i stayed here, the hotel sent a card and a bottle of wine to my room. A lovely touch. Book this hotel, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Skull
Reviews.Content: Close to everything, Amsterdam city is relatively small, but I always personally enjoy staying near the Centraal Station, which I learned this weekend was built on 8000 wood pilings. Booked a club level room, on the 4th floor, but the club lounge is located on the main level, so I may think the hotel offers club rooms on different floors. Club lounge offerings were very good, for jet lagged travelers however, the fact it wasn't open 24 hours was a bit disappointing, but not entirely unexpected. Plenty of late night food options in Amsterdam, or even in the minibar are snacks, and the hotel has a limited 24 hour room service offering. Pizza I think and maybe some other simple items. The auto bill mini bar is a pain however. Staff is excellent, our corner room, luckily assigned, I might add, was the largest hotel room I've ever had in Europe. Small mishap on my bill was addressed and a bottle of wine delivered to our room to offer apologies and a note of correction. 'New' restaurant in lobby was offering 2 for 1 drinks between 1700-1800 and 2300-2400. Decent deal for a drink before and after dinner. Our trip was a romantic week in Europe, Valentine's Day in Paris and a long weekend at this great hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Asthenia_12
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for the weekend, and what a wonderful choice it turned out to be. The hotel is an easy five minutes walk from the station. Despite looking fairly ordinary from the outside, this hotel is beautifully decorated inside in a sleek and modern style. It is spotlessly clean throughout. Our room was spacious, with an enormous and very comfortable bed. The room had everything you could hope for, from a safe to complimentary slippers. Every member of the hotel staff we encountered was cheerful and friendly and they seemed delighted to be of service, going over and above their duties. We had booked a "Club Room", which gives you access to the hotel Club Room. This is a comfortable private lounge equipped with complimentary wine, beer, tea, coffee and soft drinks. A variety of snacks was also provided free - peanuts, biscuits, sweets, fruit, pastries and desserts. Frankly, this must have saved us a fortune. Free internet access and a printer is also available in the Club Room. Breakfast was delicious. There was a vast array of food - whatever you like to eat for breakfast, you will find it here, even if that includes a glass of champagne! There was no noise at night and the hotel is well-placed for walking to the Dam Square area. We couldn't fault it. Look no further - book this one!

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Littleeire23
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the crowne plaza over valentines and to arrive late on a Monday night after a long day of travelling to the welcome we received was excellent. A special thank you to Maurice Janssen for everything you made our stay extra special we will never forget valentines 2012. Spoilt to say the least. The hotel is fantastic, rooms very modern, clean and spacious and staff are very professional and polite they could not do enough for us. If you are thinking on staying at this hotel you will not be disappointed. Every inch was luxury to us. We are already thinking on our next trip with our baby boy at Xmas!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Crowne Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: HT-Birmingham
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review of a 2 night stay with friends. Firstly the location is fantastic! It is a 5 minute walk from Central station and we found it really easily. Check in was quick and all the staff greeted us with a nice friendly smile. Rooms were very comfortable and had all the facilities you would need, safe, ironing board, hairdryer, tea and coffee. One really good feature was the room had 3-pin UK plugs, as well as 2-pin European plugs. Although Wifi was chargeable, you can goto the Business Centre on the -1 level and use the internet and printer there if you do need to check in online for your flight. Which was free of charge!! On our last day , we checked out but we were still able to store our luggage free, which was great! Overall, no problems or issues! Would definately book here if I ever need to stay in Amsterdam again!

Reviews.Title: “excellant tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracey n
Reviews.Content: Firstly i would like to say that the actual hotel is in an ideal location and the decor makes you feel so comfortable as soon as you enter. But in saying that it is a very classy hotel with loads of extras . We had been told in error when checking in our rate included breakfast,so when we went to the restaurant the next morning we were informed that we were not on the list.The receptionist said that we now couldnt have the reduced rate now has we would have had to book it on check in?Obviously had we not been told our rate included breakfast we would have done so,i was a bit upset about that but we left the hotel that day and ate elsewhere. But this was totally rectified by the manager who on our return to the hotel that night had left us a card with an apoplogy asking us to contact him. My Husband did so the next morning and he gave us breakfast on the house.Which we were not expecting atall.Also i had woken in the morning in need of tampons and not able to find any in the hotel bathroom i asked at reception.Within 5 minutes a whole box was delivered to my door. Also i must mention the increible conciege desk who are always there to offer fantastic advice. In conclusion i would totally recommend this hotel to all my friends superb hotel ,superb room staff amazing ,even though we had that slight problem it was delt with so professionally that we left very happy. Thankyou Amsterdam Crowne Plaza

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike0210
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business Trip February 2012 and the Crowne Plaza fulfilled all of our expectations. The check in was easy, quick and courteous, and the room was immaculately cleaned with a good range of facilities. There is a pleasant lounge area, and the bar is bright and popular with guests. The prices may seem a little steep at almost 6 Euros for a beer, but the dingy looking pub a couple of doors away charges 5. The hotel is just across the road from Amsterdam Central station, and a few minutes from Dam Square and other attractions. In the immediate vicinity there are a number of bars, steakhouses, kebab shops and cafes, and right across the road you will find Resin, one of Amsterdam's famous coffee shops. Checkout was as smooth as check in, and I will definitely consider the Crown Plaza for my next stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: reetburk
Reviews.Content: Clean,quiet,well located to all amenities. we travelled in a large group and the hotel couldnt do enough for us. I get very upset if the hotel i stay in is not 100% perfect-my holiday is totally wrecked. The Crown plaza ticked all the boxes and made this the best stay ever. You will not be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tlmassey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Amsterdam on two different occaisions. I find the hotel to be a great "safe haven" or "home base" in the midst of the delightful chaos that is Amsterdam. if you can manage to avoid being run down by the miriad bicycles, trains, buses, cars and other pedestrians, the hotel is an easy 5 minute walk from the Amsterdam Central Train Station. This station is easily reached from Amsterdam Schiphol Airport via an 18 minute ride with no change of trains. Cost was about EU$4.50 one way. As others have mentioned, the hotel is within easy walking distance of many of Amsterdam's famous tourist attractions, restaurants, bars, coffee shops and a thousand other diversions that will not be soon forgotten. Also, catching a bus, train or canal boat virtually right outside the hotel is convenient and a highly recommended way to explore the city. The concierge can provide assistance with tickets, directions and advice. The hotel itself is very nice with modern furnishings in the lobby and the guest rooms. The rooms have more of an American feel to them than most hotels that I know in Europe and are very clean and comfortable. The only notable exception was the shower controls (good luck!). There is a steep charge for high speed internet access: EU$20 per day or EU$15 per day for Priority Club members. Overall, this is a typical Crowne Plaza and will not disappoint frequent guests of that chain.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bikiniamber
Reviews.Content: Best thing about the hotel is the location - very close to the train station (and therefore very convenient for the airport) and a short walk to most sites in central Amsterdam. Hotel itself is very average: - small but comfortable rooms with plain decor - service was acceptable but not special - bar/restaurant service was below average (asking for a drink in the bar/lounge area seemed to be a great inconvenience to the staff) Overall, a good option if you want to be near the train station and can get it at a good price but just don't expect anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Rice_Goddess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days and 4 nights in late January 2012. The hotel is conveniently located about 5 minutes walk from the Central Station. If you are travelling from the Airport (Schiphol), this will be an easy 25-30 minutes train ride without having to stop and change to a different train line. Once you are in the central station, there is a machine (right next to the ATM by the entrance/ exit door) where you can get a printable local map. The Crowne Plaza is listed as one of the hotels nearby the station; and you can get a printable map on how to get the hotel from that machine. There are plenty of restaurants and souvenir shops within walking distance. The closest tram stop is literally right in front of the hotel (one minute walk, and yes I timed it!). The front desk staffs were very friendly and helpful. The concierge also sells the 24/48/72/96 hours tram cards along with the Rijksmuseum tickets. It was super convenient because they can just charge them to your room; and for the museum ticket, this means that you can skip the ticket queue. I think they also sell both Van Gogh and Anne Frank museum tickets (for the same prices if you were to you buy them at the museums). When I was there, they did not have the tickets in stock for these two locations. One thing to mention is that this hotel is located in a very touristy and commercialized area. The plus is rather obvious: central location and close to all major public transportations. The downside is that for folks who are more into local and non-touristy places, this hotel is probably not for you. You may want to venture by the museum district or outside of Amsterdam altogether (Haarlem). I personally love the hotelâ€™s location. Traveling solo with 2 rolling bags, I could appreciate the short walk from the central station; and the short proximity to eating places and local transportation. Overall, this is a solid Crowne Plaza hotel with good location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: conrad1402
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Crowne Plaza City Centre Amsterdam for two nights starting 27 January 2012. The hotel is ideally located only a few minutes walk from Centraal Station (where the train arrives direct from Schiphol airport), and a short walk from Dam square. Everything is within easy reach, and during the whole weekend I only needed to use the tram once! Upon arrival the staff were delightful. We arrived at about 11am and our room was ready already, despite check-in time not being til' afternoon. The receptionist welcomed us, thanked me for my loyalty to the Priority Club programme and offered us detailed information on Amsterdam itself. Our room was located on the 4th floor, room 416, which is easily accessible by lift. The room itself was spacious and immaculate, with a large comfy bed and all the facilities you'd wish for. The bathroom has a powerful shower/bath and although not the largest I've seen, it fits the bill perfectly. All the staff at the hotel are exceptional, and always greet you before you have the chance to greet them. It's the little touches they add, such as the great customer service, pillow sprays to help you sleep and biscuits with the tea/coffee facilities that make this hotel stand out from the competition! While in Amsterdam check out the Bols Cocktail & Genever Experience near the Rijksmuseum, De Bijenkorf and Heineken Experience. There's always Anne Frank Huis and the Red Light District to add to your travel journal too!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kazandstu
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Crowne Plaza for about the last 6 years about 5/6 times a year so as you can see we think the hotel is great. It was refurbished last year maybe 2010 and it is now very modern and the rooms are a great size. The staff are lovely even when we come back a little worse for wear even with a burger from the burger bar round the corner (best burgers in the Dam) The hotel bar is very easy going and breakfast is great. We would recomend this hotel to anyone business or pleasure but in Amsterdam if you don't find both there is something wrong. Five minutes walk to Dam square and lots of tram stops just outside for tram's all over the city. Amsterdam Central is only a five minute walk too so I can't think of anything bad to say about this hotel...back there on the 17th Feb can't wait ! Oh and the beds and pillows are to die for

Reviews.Title: “First choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ChocoT
Reviews.Content: I travel to Amsterdam regularly on business and the Crowne Plaza is my first choice. Rooms are a decent size for a city centre hotel, are clean, well equipped and in good condition. Rooms are generally well soundproofed (particularly internally) but trams are audible to some degree in certain rooms; I notice few other reviewers mention this so I guess the noise levels don't bother most people. One area of disappointment is the bar, which lacks atmosphere and never seems very welcoming. That aside this remains an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very central.”
Reviews.Author: Brunella D
Reviews.Content: I've stayed recently in Crowne Plaza for my birthday with my husband and some friends. I have to say this hotel is mainly for business travellers, health center doesn't really exist (you have to book 1 day in advance to get a massage because beauty center employees work as external to the hotel). There was one concierge not really helpful: I ended up booking restaurant tables on my own realizing the information he provided about closing time were incorrect (probably he was bored to call and check to the restaurants). On the other hand fortunately few members of the staff at the reception were very welcoming, as soon as we arrived a nice lady took care of us and brought us to our room. The room assigned met exactly my requests asked via email to their reservation department. Nice touch of the general manager wich left us a personal message with beautiful flowers for the day of my birthday. Hotel's position is very central and is totally smoking free so you will never get stinky rooms which is a good added value expecially in a city like Amsterdam! The hotel is not exactly a luxurious property but is very clean and staff overall is well trained. If you're quite spoiled about room size I strongly suggest to book a club room or a suite because they're bigger and much more confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality”
Reviews.Author: Tony20000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend with my wife. The room was large and well appointed. The location is great. We didn't eat but the service at the bar was very good. All the staff we came into contact with were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “By far the nicest hotel we've ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Helen_1505
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for one night during a short break to Amsterdam. We booked a junior suite (room 620) and it was amazing!! The bed was really comfy and you're provided with a spray for your pillows to help you sleep. We had a small living room which was lovely and a balcony with a great view across the city (we were on the top floor). I could not fault the room whatsoever. It was perfect! There was even a 3 prong plug socket which was ideal because we'd forgot to take the adapter. The reception staff are extremely polite, professional and very helpful. They make you feel so welcome, especially Sylvia who showed us around the hotel and to our room. We didn't realise that when booking the junior suite, you get access to the club lounge. Here there is a variety of soft drinks, beer on draught, wine and snacks that you can help yourself too. There was also breakfast provided in the morning, there is room for improvement with the selection of food in the morning. The location of the hotel was brilliant. We were a 2 minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station, 5 minute from the red light district and about a 15 minute walk from Anne Franks House. Even though it was very central, you couldn't hear any noise or anything while you were in your room. The only problem we did have was that I called the general enquiries number a few days before we left to ask whether I would have to pay a deposit or anything of that sort on arrival and was told no, everything has been paid for. But on arrival at the hotel I had to give my bank card in for them to hold a Â£50 deposit. I can totally understand why a deposit is required (in case you drink/eat from the mini bar in the room), but a little tip would be to forewarn guests so they are prepared. I wasn't planning on taking my card so it's a good job I did. This is no fault of the hotel though, it just should be stated at the time of booking. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely be coming back. As soon as we got there we wished we could stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Gerri31
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights in Amsterdam. Decided to book this hotel because it got good reviews on this site and I wasn't disappointed. It's located within 3 minute walk from Amsterdam Central, a perfect place for exploring. The hotel is what you'd expect from a large chain, no character but spotless and modern. We stayed on the sixth floor, there wasn't a view but the room was spacious and very clean, only negative thing I'd say is the room was a bit cold. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food but the staff were friendly and helpful. Would recommend it and will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding hotel close to everything in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GlebeTravelller
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam at New Years Eve is very 'full on' and this place offered the perfect place to escape the hustle bustle when we needed to. We stayed here for 5 days. Everything about this hotel exceeded our expectations... 1) The warm welcome we received upon arrival. The lobby area is warm and inviting. Check in was a breeze and we were in our room within minutes 2) The quality of the room renovation was great. There was great attention paid to quiet zones in the hotel which guests observed. Our sleep quality was excellent. The bathroom was smallish but well fitted and the tea and coffee facilities made it relaxing. The mini bar was not well stocked but hey this is Amsterdam - who wants a drink in their room with all that is happening outside?? 3) Breakfast was fantastic. A good buffet selection with cafe style coffee to order. 4) All staff were genuinely interested in us and always polite and helpful. They seemed proud of their hotel and so they should be. I have traveled to Amsterdam many times and as most people would be aware, the Dutch people are among the frienliest in the world and it shows at this hotel. They were all fantastic and thanks to them for making our stay so wonderful. We had dinner on site once and it was a very dutch experience - well worth a try of their menu for some traditional dutch fare. The location is great - a short walk from Centraal and a stroll to Dam Square and beyond. We walked everywhere. There is a great selection of cafes, restaurants, coffee shops and bars everywhere around you here. We loved this place and would definately stay here next time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SebiAdventure
Reviews.Content: A very nice Hotel. The rooms are comfortable and big. You have a flat screen an the beds are Kingsize and the quality of sleeping is great. Free wifi is in the room. The hotel also includes a small fitness area and a swimming pool. The breakfast is quite complete. The only thing is that the hotel is a little bit far from the city of Amsterdam. You have to take a cap for like 55 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Janenoz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is every bit as luxurious as I had hoped for. The rooms were large for a city hotel and very nicely appointed. We had a room that faced the other side of the hotel so it really quiet, no street noise, which was perfect. We didn't have breakfast so cant comment on that. The staff were very courteous, friendly and offered a great service. Loved the little packet of scented pillow spray to help you sleep, which was on the bed when we arrived. Enjoyed our stay, and would definitely stay there again, or another Crowne Plaza elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stetcg
Reviews.Content: Great location staff and rooms top notch highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Hotel met our every expectation and more!”
Reviews.Author: wc1208
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris and decided to catch the train to Amsterdam. We walked the short distance from the train Centraal Station to the hotel. We were greeted and welcomed by the reservation and concierge staff immediately! Our room was a Club Room with many amenities but my favorite was the rain shower in the bathroom! We were able to use the internet very easily and found room service to be very fast. Concierge staff gave us maps and advise on how to see the town in our short stay. We would like to stay here again and recommend this property to anyone wanting comfortable, friendly surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Marigoldofhearts
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just returned from a short break in Amsterdam. My thoughts on the CP in the city centre are: location - excellent, just 5 mins walk from Centraal Station and tram stops right outside (the concierge can provide daily tram tickets for 7 euros). Although more set up as a business hotel it is absolutely fine for a family or romantic break too - we were upgraded on arrival from a superior twin to a suite and everything was provided for, even the bottle of water is very welcome as it saves on shopping time.The room was very comfortable and I was not aware of any noise. The fridge is well stocked although you cannot store your own drinks in it as it is set up electronically to record any removals. A large TV screen and usual toiletries plus comb, nail file, aromatherapy sleep solution. Breakfast at 25 euros much too expensive so did not even think about eating it there. Overall, would I recommend staying there - yes. Would I return to the same hotel? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Some frills but basics need attention”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiIndiTraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at this hotel. I was warmly welcomed and a room in the supposedly 'quiet side' was offered. The check in staff were courteous to call and ask if I was satisfied with the room which as well appointed including aroma therapy sleep aid on the pillow. Being a very light sleeper, I was looking forward to some rest after a long journey. To my disappointment the non stop sound of trams, ambulance and police cars kept me awake most of the night. I called the reception late night and after some discussion they agreed to change my room the next day. In the morning as requested Ileft my belongings packed in the room as the front desk had assured that they would move my bag to the room on the back side. To my disappoint,ent late in the afternoon when I returned my bag wasn't moved neither was a room ready. Not wanting to wait further I opted to move to the room on another floor. I was assured this was quieter. To my disappointment again there was sounds in he night and this was the second night that I could not sleep. They receptionist coded the wrong key type twice and so all I did as run from one room and one floor to another exhausted but mindlessly moving about . I was supposed to extend my stay by one night at crowne plaza but because of the noise problem, I moved to another hotel next to Crowne plaza. Guess what? Had no problems sleeping there and when they assigned a quiet room it was actually quiet and I slept well. Makes me wonder why a hotel of such high reputation fails to achieve customer satisfaction in terms of sleep, one of the most important things on a business trip. So, for the brand name and overall experience I recommend this hotel but for sleep, specially if you are a light sleeper, please avoid this property.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MissNoraS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four days at the crown plaza, city center. We enjoyed a club room, and we highly suggest this room for your visit. It includes free internet, and access to the club lounge. The location is excellent, as the central train station is a simple walk. Every one that works here is pleasant and helpful, and the service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good indeed but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: starcluster01
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City Centre is a 4 stars hotel located in a strategic position in the heart of Amsterdam, just few hundreds meter far from Amsterdam Central railway station. It provides the guests a very good services level. The building has been recently refurbished, the lobby is made for business men, and it is possible to have meeting rooms available for all kind of meetings, Wi â€“ fi is covering the whole building with a very good signal. The furnitureâ€™ style is minimal, everything is functional, stylish but it does not look like a â€œRococo churchâ€� full of golden decorations and so on. Nevertheless in the rooms you will find all what you can desire from an hotel. First of all the room is perfectly clean and provided with all the comforts: 40 inches LCD TV, extremely comfort bed and pillows, a wide modern and functional bathroom, wardrobe with light inside, safety box, minibar, business desk , different type of sockets to plug electronic devices (AUS/NZL sockets included). Rooms are wide, quiet and well equipped things that make the staying really comfortable, especially after an hard working day. A cattle with a selection of Ceylon and Japanese organic tea, biscuits, instant coffee and chocolate, dark chocolate tablets, 500 ml of water are provided everyday free as room facilities. Executive floor and lounge available. The staff is very professional and friendly, the room service is quick responding. The breakfast is good, in any case they have to improve the selection of jams (only strawberry and orange taste available) such as the selection of cheese (we are in Holland!!!!) and ham. It is possible to have fried eggs, omelettes and crepes expressly made by a chef present in the breakfast roomâ€¦which is the same location of the New Dorrius restaurant. I checked out the New Dorrius again (business dinner) and I found out the same excellent level of cousine. Internet, always available butâ€¦it is not acceptable to pay 6,95 Euro (1 hour) , and moreover it is impossible to stop and start again the connection session, or 19,94 Euro (one day) for the connection. The â€œHealth Clubâ€� is small but equipped with a good range of cardio fitness machines and also multi power machine for body building. The sauna room is not in good maintenance conditions. 1) Thermometer out of order, signs always 40Â°. 2) It is impossible to poor water into the â€œaroma systemâ€� as the big wooden spoon is completely broken 3) The shower side jets are out of order. The sauna room is perfectly clean, no problem under this profile. This hotel has been created more as business Hotel than a â€œfamily hotelâ€�, even if it is nice also to spend some vacations with the family in the Crowne Plaza. For that reason I find the internet policy quite stupid, as you find around the hotel some pubs which provide FREE INTERNET CONNECTION to all their customers. Considering the room rate it seems to be at least anachronistic. In any case, considering the whole matter, the Crowne Plaza is a very good, modern, elegant, and efficient hotel, I suggest to book here more for business than for leisure time, but, of course this is my feeling. To be an excellent hotel they have to improve breakfast, to think of a decent internet connection policy , and to repair the sauna room. I know these are details, but when are not staying in an Hostel details are the most important thingsâ€¦especially for a 4 stars hotel and upâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: salmja
Reviews.Content: I spent a two nights at Crowne Plaza and I have to say it was very good hotel. Everything I needed was close to the hotel and service was excellent. Good food, good beer: do you need much more after work? It's in downtown so there is everything else you'd need.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tamar0935
Reviews.Content: Me and my husbend stied in the hotel between 1/13 to 1/15 The hotel is located in a great location , 5 minutes from the centarl station ( take a train from the airport -4.30 ero) the rooms are clean brakefast is very good and dinner is excellent you better stay there tammy

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RedMiniStapler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located not too far from the train station, and clean. After staying at a horrible hotel in paris, this hotel seemed like the Caesars palace. At the entrance of the hotel we had to go through group of people cigg. and weed outside, and the smell was coming into the building. The staffs were friendly and professional, only problem we had was we requested 2 queen room, but getting 1 queen & 1 twins. It wasn't that big of a deal though, after long traveling with my hubby, it was nice to sleep on my own bed and blanket! I thought the breakfast were kind of pricey, because it was 25 euro per person. They had good selections of food but i still think it wasn't worth 25 euro. Would I stay here again if I come back to Amsterdam? definitely, but I'd probably find some place else for breakfast & food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diana8207
Reviews.Content: Central location, room are big, nice and clean, staff is helpfull. Restaurant it is also very nice

Reviews.Title: “Romantic break”
Reviews.Author: Littleeire23
Reviews.Content: Will be staying at the crowne plaza over valentines. Found it difficult to find THE hotel for us .As my main concern was to make this a great break away for us both since the birth of our first child. But going by all the great reviews of this hotel lately I can say we are both really looking forward to our sta

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel, comfortable rooms, friendly staff - Great central location”
Reviews.Author: CHRIS M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for a week on business. When I arrived at the train station, there is an information self service computer that printed me a map to show me how to get from the station to the hotel and I was pleasantly surprised how close it was. Barely five minutes from the central station on foot, the hotel is conveniently located for exploring Amsterdam on foot with none of the main attractions of the city being more than 30 minute's walk away. The staff were welcoming and helpful throughout my stay. The room was modern and clean with good tea and coffee facilities although milk in tea must not be normal in Holland as the only milk provided was caramel flavoured. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom spotless. The LCD tv had several English speaking channels and wifi (and wired internet) was available in the room though not included in the standard room rate. My booking didn't include breakfast and the price of adding it seemed pretty steep - â‚¬17 per day apparently if booked at check in - so I didn't try it out. The restaurant and bar area looked pleasant but were again a bit pricey compared to what you could get in the vast number of places in easy walking distance. The only downside to my room was the very strong wind and rain combining some of the nights to hammer against the window fairly loudly - but there's not much can be done about the weather - during my week there it was evident why Holland is known for its windmills! All in all a comfortable and relaxing place to stay and a perfect location for the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable & Clean”
Reviews.Author: reino80
Reviews.Content: Convenient. Location is ideal. The hotel is approximately 300 yards from the central train station (so if you are arriving or departing by train with luggage the walk to the hotel is not far at all). It is less than a 5 minute walk to Dam Square, Red Light District, and the Jordan. The city metro rail runs right by the hotel as well so you can hop on that if you are going farther or its raining. There is a main shopping pedestrian only street just out the back of the hotel. All the hotel staff spoke english and were friendly. Comfortable. Bed was comfortable, room was spacious (room 132) and quiet, and the lobby has a nice comfortable lounge area with a fireplace, tv, and selection of books. We ordered room service and it was very good and arrived promptly. I believe the hotel restaurant has a high tripadvisor rating. Clean. Bathroom was small, but clean. Room was clean and the hotel public areas were as well. It looks like the hotel has been renovated/updated in the last few years as many items seemed new / gently used. The decor is modern and a 'laid back' swanky. Overall a nice stay and would recommend this hotel. We stayed in other Crowne Plaza hotels on our trip in other countries and this one was the best one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: IJMatthews
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable room, efficient service, what else do you need?! This hotel has a nice entrance and great service upon arrival. Good silent rooms, although you are in the middle of buzzing Amsterdam. Good amenities in the rooms, very comfortable bed. And just walking distance from the city centre and major squares, good connection with public transport. Just for me THE hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: ajs245
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over new year, so probably paid more than normal. When we came to check in we were told that the room we had been given was smaller than it should have been, so they offered breakfast, Internet and late checkout for free. Location is close to the station and within walking distance of all the main sights. Staff were extremely helpful and breakfast had a good selection. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near to Centraal Station”
Reviews.Author: dylanw_uk
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City Centre for three nights in early January. Checkin was excellent, the reception staff were very friendly and acknowledged my priority club status by upgrading us to a Superior room (we also got vouchers for free drinks in the bar and some discount vouchers for the restaurant). The room was large (with a very large bed!), very comfortable and included the usual features associated with a hotel of this standard (Nespresso machine, flatscreen TV, workdesk, etc.). The TV had more english language channels than some hotels that we've stopped at in the UK! The hotel is five minutes walk from the Centraal station and is within walking distance of all major sites in the city. Positives: - In the heart of the city centre. Near the main station (Centraal station). - Very comfortable and modern rooms - Excellent checkin and friendly staff - Very good priority club upgrade Negatives: - None spring to mind! Overall: - A wonderful high end hotel in Amsterdam City Centre. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover to recover from jetlag”
Reviews.Author: CRadmac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family in 2 rooms for a couple of nights to recover and see sights of Amsterdam Central location close to train station, and right in centre of city. Safe hotel in a safe area Staff friendly, Rooms good. A good stay overall. The contras were * that although we booked 2 room, they were not together. * I dont like combination shower/baths - to me they are a bit of a safety issue as I get older. * WiFi not included in price. Everyone has at least one computer when they travel now. * Breakfast seemed a bit steep - try to get it included in your rate. Otherwise a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station”
Reviews.Author: aah0309
Reviews.Content: Good location, a quick walk from the train station. Albert Hein is also not too far. The room had tea and coffee and a small fridge. The service was excellent. Shopping areas and museums are all within walking distance. I also found several restaurants close to the hotel rated well on Trip Advisor. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: MartynP2
Reviews.Content: We thought we would try a trip away for new years eve. I am so pleased we choose Amsterdam and in particular this hotel. It has fantastic friendly staff who are the most helpful I have met. A large group of us had a meal in the new resturant on new years eve which was superb. The hotel has been modernised to a very high standard and is in an ideal location - just a few minutes across the road from the railway station. Despite its great central location we had a good nights sleep during our stay. Looking around at the other hotels in the area I would say this was the best all round.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Eldik
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, this time it was a vacation for a change. I am a platinum priority member (which is the Holiday inn/Crown Plaza/ Intercontinental club). Usually I get access to Crown Plaza's lounges around the world, but not here... never mind... I did get free internet access (which coasts almost 20 euro for 24 hours) and 50% off breakfast which I didn't use. The room is very nice, modern and the bed was very comfortable. I got a room on the 2nd floor facing the front street, just above the passing trams and as I am very sensitive to noise I was a afraid that the noise would bother me, but... nope...They have good noise isolation with double glassing and I could barely hear any noise. The location is also very good - 5 minute walk from the central station and 7 minute walk from the Dam. The staff at the reception were very kind and polite. All in all it was a great stay and I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: up40love
Reviews.Content: Super close to train station, room was nice. Nothing other than great location sticks out in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels I've stayed in - Staff were excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Miick1948
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for 5 days (on points) over the New Year's Eve period. The Hotel is very modern and newly refurbished & we found the location to be excellent (5 minutes walk from Dam Square & Central Station & a number of Trams stop right outside). The Room was large, modern, spotlessly clean & extremely comfortable & although it looked out on to the street from the first floor, we weren't bothered by traffic noise. From the moment we arrived (too early for the room) the staff couldn't have done more to be friendly, helpful & accomodating. The Concierge was excellent with information (Cinemas, Restaurants, Transport, etc) TIP: They sell tickets there for many of the Museums & attractions (we bought for Van Goch Museum & Heiniken Experience) which avoids standing in a long queue when you arrive! We ate in Dorrius Restaurant one night and the food was really good. I stay in a lot of hotels but I was really impressed with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LM82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a weekend in November, and were really pleased with the location and the standard of the room. Accommodation in Amsterdam is expensive, but we felt we got what we paid for. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the station, and is also close to Dam Square without being in a busy or noisy area. All the main tourist spots are a short walk away, and for the more southern city attractions (Van Gogh Museum, Heineken Experience etc) it was only a short tram ride. The room was spacious with a very comfortable bed (loved the complimentary 'This Works: Sleep' set), and was very clean on arrival. The staff were friendly however I was disappointed by the city tax charged on check out - having never been to Amsterdam before, we were unaware of this additional charge and would have preferred to have this flagged to us on check in. However, overall, we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, perfect location great staff!”
Reviews.Author: jammydodger0905
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights using some rewards points. The location couldn't be more prefect. Opposite the Central Station, literally a 5 min walk across the street. A very short walk to all the main shopping streets and attractions, very close to the Canal Bus and trams to get you all over the city. The room was a twin room, the beds a good size...bigger than a regular single bed, lovely crisp white linen & duvet! The rooms in spite of being so close to everything were well insulated both internally and externally, so nice and quiet! Tea & coffee in room, good TV channels, everything lovely and clean! My only bug bear is the high charges for internet use, however 30 mins free in the business centre was a small consolation! The staff were fabulous, nothing was too much trouble. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “execellent city hotel”
Reviews.Author: garv
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights here, 23 and 24/12/11. found it to be a simply excellent big city hotel. rooms were clean, large and well kitted out (we had a nespresso coffee machine in our room). best part however was the first class reception staff who were welcoming , helpful and informative whilst appearing to make their interest a personal matter. well done ! all staff around the hotel made a point of greeting us in a friendly way. the location is great for strolling around this compact City and an easy walk from the Centraal station even with luggage A lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent everything”
Reviews.Author: Tapatingo
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located in the heart of Amsterdam this hotel is extremely professional and efficient. The staff gets you in and out quickly and takes care of you as a Priority Club Platinum member. Very comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good size room”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the central train station and is within walking distance to the major places. You can find less expensive hotels but this is a clean and nice size room located perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic accommodating hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: relaxingaussies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Beautiful rooms, very friendly staff and a perfect location. From the moment we checked in EVERY staff member we dealt with was friendly knowledgable & seemed to go out of their way to accommodate our needs. Spend the extra money & take a Club Room. It's so nice & peaceful to be able to go there for a quiet drink at the end of a day. Hotel in a perfect location near the central train station, canal cruises & Dam Square.
