If you are visiting Amsterdam this is a perfect hotel for your stay. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Stay here, you will not be disappointed! Thank you to every staff member for making our stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: jinphil_cho
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on the first night of a quick 2-day visit to Amsterdam. The hotel is in a great location between Amsterdam Centraal and Dam Square. You can easily walk to the hotel from the train station even with your bags. The hotel is in a traditional-style building like the kind you see all over old Amsterdam. Hallways are somewhat narrow and the rooms are small, but everything feels quite cozy and comfortable. One big downside for me is the high price of Internet. Staff were all very professional and efficient. This is definitely one of the better Crowne Plazas out there, as I've been in some which are worse than a Holiday Inn Express. I can't say enough good things about the location, there's a tram stop right outside, Centraal Station is a short walk away and since Amsterdam is so flat you can walk to many places as well. I didn't try any of the food so I can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly priced central hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gueray
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights during business visit. The room was great, comfy and with all amenities I needed, even a decent hairdryer and iron. The hotel has a sleep well policy, so no cleaning or vacuuming before 10am, which was very appreciated by our jetlagged friends. Breakfast was good, excellent service, even diet cokes can be provided included in the price for e hung over ones. The bar service also good, they have two happy hours during afternoon and evening, so a visit is very affordable. There is a shopping pedestrian street outside one side of the hotel for those who have time to spend. The staff was super friendly, amazingly so for Amsterdam! We had a conference in e hotel, and those fascilities were also good for our groupnof 25 people. They kept swrving us snacks of various sorts throughout the day. The only negative thing I can think of is that wireless was euro 19,95 per day, not only per room but for connection. So my Iphone and laptop was charged with double, which I thought was unreasonable. They reduced it with slightly, charging me for one less day during check out. I liked the hotel a lot otherwise, and will stay there next time as well!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but for the air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: achillite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. I had booked a club room with full buffet breakfast. We were very impressed with the hotel in almost every aspect: friendly staff, high quality furnishings and fittings, comprehensive and tasty breakfast. Management and staff have obviously worked very hard to create and maintain this welcoming environment. Nd it is so handy to Central Station and the city centre in general. But for one major issue! The room's air conditioning. We would not feel able to return to this hotel nor to any other Crowne Plaza with a similar setup. To us it is absolurely vital to be able to have a good night's sleep. To this end we like to have quiteness and an acceptable room temperature. This was impossible. The room's air conditioning could not be switched off and all the windows were without openings. It might not seem important to most people but the lowest fan level still made a considerable noise. I rang about this the first night after trying for an hour to fall asleep. I was told that the air conditioning was so installed that there was always some air entering the room. I was told that every room was the same. I have only once before been in a hotel which had no way of opening windows or of switching off the air conditioning, so I never thought to ask beforehand. Even on the 15th floor of the Park Lane Hilton it is possible to get some fresh air! So, thank you, Crowne Plaza, for doing so much to create a lovely hotel. But an on/off switch on the aircon and one window that opens would at least give guests the option that is currently denied to personalise their environment.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, practical, contemporer stay in the city center”
Reviews.Author: jbdl
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza City Center is the most ideal place to stay in Amsterdam if you can afford it. It has all the efforts and offers to make your stay as easy and comfortable as possible. Room is super clean, check-in is super fast (although they said check-in time is above 15.00 but if they have the rooms available, you can always check in earlier), and staff is super helpful and friendly. Amenities is complete. The extra mile that this hotel goes is to offer the Quiet Zone! You can request for the Quiet Zone rooms. It means no room attendant, housekeeping or engineering activities from 21.00 to 10.00. Isn't that great? Another little bonus is a small package of aromatherapy next to your bed to ensure you have a good night sleep. It contains a fragrant spray and liquid to inhale. The breakfast is standard but adequate with a pot of coffee or tea instead of a cup. And the breakfast time is until 11.00. Will definitely come back here again. Location is just a stone throw away to shops and all the tourist attraction also a small squat and you will be in Central Station already.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DAshcroft
Reviews.Content: On a recent stay to Amsterdam we were very pleased with our choice of stay at the CP Amsterdam. Our room was upgraded and was very spacious and well appointed. Food in the New Dorius restaurant was excellent, well priced and the service staff very friendly and attentive. Combined with the location of a mere 3 minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal station and perhaps 5-10 minutes from the Jordaan area, I dont think you can choose a better hotel in central amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Free Stay due to Previous Mistake”
Reviews.Author: cairoegypt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City Centre a second time this year during our recent stopover. We used it for day use since our stopover was 10 hours during Â the day before our connecting flight.Â  Although we rested for most of our time here, I must say that this hotel has become our hotel of choice in Amsterdam for the following reasons:Â  1) location. It is literally a 3 minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal Station, which means you can take the train from Schiphol to City Centre and arrive at the hotel in about 20 minutes depending on the wait for your train. It is also very close to the main sections of Amsterdam all in walking distance to some great restaurants, Anne Frank House, shopping, etc. 2) hospitality. The staff are extremely friendly, courteous, and goes above and beyond to make you feel comfortable. 10 minutes after we entered our room, the front desk called to ask if we were satisfied with our room. Of course we were, but I believe they would have changed it for us if we were not. 3) modern. Great modern interior design and decor makes you feel like you are in a posh atmosphere. 4) breakfast. The breakfast buffet was exceptional. The staff are extremely friendly, service is great, and their selection is rich and various with high quality fresh ingredients. We were not disappointed. I liked the egg/omelette station which the chef cooked for you to your specifications. Good coffee too. OneÂ  important note: during my last visit here, our one complaint was that they failed to give us a wake-up call. You can read my review below. I want to say here that the manager contacted me and apologized for this and to make up for it, offered me a complimentary one night stay, which we used for this stopover. Thank you to Mr. Maurice Janssen for your kindness and hospitality. Again this is to show that this hotel will go above and beyond your needs to make sure that you will return to this hotel, which we gladly will. Oh, and this time we received a personal wake-up call from the front desk right on time. ;-) I highly recommend this hotel. The price is well worth your stay for location, service, and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: lizziefin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights. Staff very friendly and helpful, room we had was excellent, quiet and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stepballchange
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 3 nights and also booked a conference room for one day. Good points: Very central - less than 5 minutes' walk from Centraal station and within easy walking distance to most tourist attractions. Room was clean, comfortable, spacious, and quiet (slept without using earplugs which is rare in a hotel room). Staff were polite, efficient, cheerful and helpful without being too obsequious. Loved the free bottle of water and tea/coffee/hot chocolate/small biscuits/chocolates in the room. Price very reasonable for a quality city centre hotel. Conference room was laid out exactly as requested with water, juice, mints and sweets. Bad points: Internet was not free. Despite booking a conference room, I didn't get a reduction on my room rate. I was offered a reduction on the cost of a clubroom but it was still double the price of the standard room which I eventually booked through a travel website.

Reviews.Title: “Short business trip.”
Reviews.Author: charlietraveler57
Reviews.Content: I arrived early for check in as a meeting was changed, reception was very obliging and let me have my room at 10.30 am. Nice rooms with everything you need, very comfortable. Bar area is lovely and all staff very pleasant. Check out was quick but it was 7 am. Will stay every time i;m in amsterdam in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss one of the best hotels in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: jdub999
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you want an immaculate spacious room, incredibly professional staff, great restaurant and a convenient central location. The friendly staff went above and beyond to help and to make our stay memorable. Next time in Amsterdam we will be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice modern, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: RYAN S
Reviews.Content: Me and my brother stayed at this hotel in July 2009, first impressions was really good the hotel looks nice and modern inside & out. Considering we paid roughly Â£50.00 a night each to stay here i throught the hotel was very good value for money. The rooms are clean as are the bathrooms and the beds were very comfy and feature a nice flat screen tv. I couldnt fault the clenliness or the general up keep of the hotel overall very happy with my stay! Also the train station is basically opposite less than a 5 mins walk. there is also a coffee shop direclty opposite called Resin which we found to be the best Coffee shop in Amsterdam really as many are really old and grotty looking. The location is so central being 5 mins from Dam square roughly the same to the Red light districts and round the corner from the main high st shops such as Footlocker. If you stay at the Crowne Plaza id be very confident you will enjoy your stay. We did not eat at the Hotel, theres no reason for that, we just wanted typical dutch food so ventured out for stuff to eat so i can't rate the food but im sure it will be of a good standard.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, great staff and well appointed”
Reviews.Author: chchester
Reviews.Content: The hotel refurbishment has resulted in a quality hotel with 200m of the main railway station in the city centre. All the staff were very helpful, friendly but business like. The exec lounge is now on the ground floor and has free internet access with the usual drinks and continental breakfast. The one disappointment was the lack of cakes to compliment the tea and coffeee or soft drinks. The bedroom (201) was large and has a view down the main street with a wet room and shower that is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with an Excellent Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tonio_R
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife during October 2011. Our first time in Amsterdam. The location was superb. We arrived from Brussels at mid night and the hotel was just some mins from the Tran Station (aprox 5 min). The staff was really great. The concierge spectacular. We do not like to take tours, so we asked the concierge for recommendations in order to go by ourselves and they gave great advices. Really professional. I was also impressed with the conference rooms for making work out sessions. If I have to add something related to improve the Hotel is just the rooms. The one that I had was a little bit dark with a no nice view. No big deal considering that I spent the whole day in the City and I just the room for resting. No doubt that this is a great hotel. I defintely will comeback.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, really convenient for Centraal Station and the city”
Reviews.Author: elanem
Reviews.Content: The reason we stayed in this hotel is because we had eaten in the restaurant before which was amazing, and decided on our next trip back to Amsterdam we would stay in the hotel. As with most city hotels it can be pricey, but I do think you get your money's worth with the Crowne Plaza. It's not even a 10 minute walk to Centraal Station, so very convenient. Beds are very comfy and pillows too (always a bonus!). Clean and tidy rooms with a coffee maker - always nice! The staff are always very polite and helpful. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “"Storers the explorers”
Reviews.Author: HalfpintJilly
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed there for a week. The hotel is centerally located, close to shops, cafes and a short walk to train station. Our Quaint room had exposed beams,sloping roof and large windows.The room was large with a huge king size bed , comfortable lounge/sitting area ,an old world desk and wardrobe.The room also had an adjoining moderate sized bathroom that was well stocked with tioletries. Our room was also stocked with complimentry aromatherapy sleep preparations on arrival. The room also contained a Coffee maker maxchine that had an aray of different coffee flavours. This was restocked daily...at no extra cost to us. Our room was very clean and well serviced twice daily. Reception staff were helpfull , and had excellent customer relation skills .All of them spoke English well. The hotel has free access to the internet in its bussiness centre located on a lower level. 3 machines.are available for guests use, and also a printer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: flaljee
Reviews.Content: This is a very conveniently located hotel, within a 10 minute walk from Central station and offers all the modern amenities you can expect from Crowne Plaza. They give you a free bottle of water in your room, along with coffee maker in the room. Rooms are large and clean as is the bathroom. Modern decor and comfy beds. My only gripe - I hate when hotels don't offer free internet. And I don't like inconsistency. Their hotel in Helsinki offers free internet, so why can't they do the same in Amsterdam? Anyway, if you can get past that, I recommend it. Be warned that this is not the cheapest hotel in the area. Inntel hotels which is next door to it is about GBP 50 cheaper and has free internet.

Reviews.Title: “great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: RoytonBrowns
Reviews.Content: I stop here on business when I can as I am a member of the Priority Club loyalty card scheme for the group. Everything about this hotel is top quality - the reception area is huge, no scrabbling for space; the lounge area is very comfortable and rooms are superbly fitted. I stayed here in October and was delighted at check in to be given a free upgrade. I'm not sure what this was for or what it entailed, but just to hear the words 'free upgrade' is a boost in itself. My room was a good size, king bed, sofa, lots of little extras on the bed (I presume for the upgrade), bath and shower. The only annoying thing was the reliability of the wi-fi. Ordinarily this wouldn't bother me too much as once I'm in the room, I shut off from work. However, this time I needed it and the network was up and down like a fiddler's elbow. Ten minutes connected, followed by 30 minutes of not connected...and repeat for most of the evening. Breakfast is excellent. The food is basically a hot and cold buffet, but there is a chef on too who will do pancakes, waffles and the like as you need them. I've not tried the restaurant for evening meals as it seems a bit expensive for a set menu. Location is great just 5 minutes from Centraal Station. All in all an excellent hotel and worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “very good and silent location”
Reviews.Author: MMO_Istanbul
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights in February 2011 during a business trip. The hotel is situated very close to the center, with good restaurants and bars around and 10 minutes walk to the lively Dam square. The rooms are quite comfortable and silent, the buffet breakfast is rich and tasty. I used taxi for my business visits however the hotel is very close to the central station and also a tram passes across the front street so it is very convenient also for leisure stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephenMmurphy
Reviews.Content: Recently refurbished and very modern. Great location next to central station and the Dam. Walking distance to most things in the city centre. Best thing are the rooms. Very comfortable and very good price/comfort ratio. I have stayed in other hotels in Amsterdam and paid more and got less. My only comment is that the wifi in the room should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: adaki
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during an overnight in Amsterdam on the way back to the US from the middle east. The hotel's great location, a stone's throw away from central station, made it ideal for my girlfriend and I as we had to catch an early train to the airport. The room we had was a standard one but very comfortable, had great pillows and was generally great for that one night. The hotel's restaurant was good but expensive. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam, and I myself plan to be back there in December.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Malcy1
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel mainly due to the location. Some great bars / restaurants within short walking distance in Singel / Westerkirk eg De Spaanse Ruiter, Koggeschip etc and 5/10 minute walk from Damraak/ Dam Square, Oude Kerk etc... Also only 5 minute walk from Central Station (very big plus for those weighted down with luggage). The hotel is what you expect from A Crowne Plaza hotel large modern clean rooms plus room staff that arrives the same day! Down side is it can be expensive but if you ship around via Hotel booking sites or book in advance you can get a room for as little as 60 euros.. One last thing the drinks at the restaurant and bar are pricey however if you are not on a budget or fancy splashing out the restaurant at the Hotel is of a very high quality with a superb wine list. The staff are also excellent. Well worth a visit at least once..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great location.Shame about Female reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Alvin D
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nightâ€™s with eight friends ( my stag weekend). The location is great for roaming the city. Rooms are large and clean, we didnâ€™t spend much time in the hotel bar and restaurant as they are expensive, but most places in Amsterdam are. We got a really good nightly rate, but this seems to have annoyed the majority of female staff, from the moment I arrived at reception there was problems. A computer hitch meant my rooms were not probably booked, the staff basically said this was my problem and they could not help (fully booked - Friday night at 10.30pm)). Funny considering they took the money from my account 2 months previous !!!!!!. Having said this, the manager is very accommodating and sorted everything, shame I had to experience the arrogance of the female staff on reception first. If you experience any problems at reception just ask to speak to the manager. But all things considered it is a nice hotel and the location is walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Mizinko
Reviews.Content: Spent a lovely Saturday in Amsterdam which was 'crowned' by our stay at this hotel. We arrived early not expecting our superior room to be ready. We left our car with the valet (40 euro for 24 hours, which given the extortionate prices at the nearby bijenkorf car park is good value). Anyway to our pleasant surprise the kind gentleman behind the desk upgraded us to a club room. The room was in what would be the old part of the hotel and had character, exposed beams etc. Bed super comfy and thoughtful touches like pillow spray and rituals cosmetics were lovely. What really makes this hotel, aside from it's very central yet reasonably quiet location is the staff. From the charming Chinese lady who studies hotel management and brought us drinks, to the smiling concierge and the lovely Spanish woman who gave us a gift of tea on our check out, you can easily understand how this hotel won best crowne plaza in the world recently. Tastefully decorated too. Go.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Gottheshirttoproveit
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel in a great location. Walking distance from the train station (with luggage), amazingly welcoming staff who spoke perfect English (even though we speak Dutch as well). I was upgraded as I'm a PCR Gold Member. Room was so comfortable, great bed and a Nespresso Machine (was very welcome due to just arriving from Paris where they still haven't learnt to make coffee). I've stayed at many Crowne Plaza's, and this is one of the best. I would definately book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: pia a
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel, very clean. Room are normal size, not too big but not too small. Location is great, less then two minutes walking from Central Station. Staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near train station”
Reviews.Author: dupree78
Reviews.Content: Very handy location 5 min walk from central train station and close to Dam square and other tourist destinations. Beautiful modern room with exposed beams, espresso maker and very nicely finished bathroom. Room was a little dark however. Ate two meals in the restaurant and was not disappointed. Free wifi due to our platinum status with priority club. would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Poor upgrades for Platinum guests.”
Reviews.Author: rbrown8
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and great location, however is you belong to Priority Club reward programs skip this hotel. They dont give upgrades to a club lounge.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: lockportgal
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? The beautiful [recently remodeled] rooms? The housekeepers? The friendly staff? The helpful concierge? The lounge area? The location? The restaurant? The rooms were clean and very comfortable, the sheets high quality, amenities in the bathroom--it seemed like a very high end boutique hotel. Okay, I did not get to the work out room, but heard that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our short vacation”
Reviews.Author: harb_hany
Reviews.Content: The hotel is few steps from all attractions , they are very friendly and helpful staff and as priority club member they upgrade us to club room with benefit of 50% discount on breakfast and 25% on car parking, driving is very difficult in Amsterdam and best way is walking or take the tram or hire a bike . You will find out many restaurants near by and the tram stop opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy_Two_Socks
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza City Centre is right across the road from the railway station and close to all city amenities. We had a great room with every comfort, and found that the staff went the extra mile to provide great service. Breakfast was a little more expensive than we would have liked, but this is not a Holiday Inn Express, and provided good value.

Reviews.Title: “High quality staff”
Reviews.Author: Tambo_10
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but found the hotel very well located and comfortable. But the highlight was the quality of the staff. Everyone we encountered was helpfull, knowledgable and friendly. We were even able to check in at 9:00am. We had a queen room rather than a king room as that was the only one available at that hour. We think it was a businessman's room as it was very well appointed and was quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPDKL
Reviews.Content: Great location and only a short walk to central station. Very nice decor and very impressed with the upgraded room. I had a two day conference here and the facilities were very good and so was the service. Numerous restaurants and bars in walking distance, many just across the road. Compared to other hotels in and around Central Station this is the best. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bax52
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay here a couple of weeks ago. Actually struggling to remember the hotel as its a typical big international chain hotel. Everything as you may expect. Wifi is ridiculously expensive and should be in the rate for a business hotel, so didnt use it. Sleep quality great and rooms well soundproofed, and beds / linens very good. Id stay here again in Amsterdam as the location is excellent. 5 mins from Centraal Station, and everything in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: UkBobC
Reviews.Content: I spend around 150 nights every year in hotels around the world, I have become somewhat underwhelmed by the supposed over rated and generaly dull quality of what the 'big brands' have to offer and on booking this trip did so with the memory of a pretty average establishment. However sometimes one gets a pleasent suprise and this was one of those times. This hotel is well placed for the tourist but also the traveler wanting something a little less sterile than an airport hotel, minutes on foot from the station and all the main city centre attractions and with numerous restaurants and the like within a few footsteps. The hotel has had a massive refurbishment since my last trip and what a difference this has made, the public rooms are comfortable, there is a small bar and restaurant right on the street. All the staff are very pleasant and helpfull without being over bearing. I am a 'Royal Ambassador' member with this group (Intercontinental) which allows me some serious options, I always book a club/executive room and sometimes get upgrades as happened here to a slightly larger room (235), outside noise is quite high but hey this is a city centre what should one expect, the room is (I'm in here now writing this review) interesting, as part of the old building it has beamed ceilings etc, I would highley recommend this room for anyone looking for something a little special, the club lounge is well sorted with computers and printers available, I get free wifi which is useful and if there is one fault it is that they would charge 19.50 euro for 24hrs normaly,this is an absolute rip off, there is absolutely no justification for this. This is a hotel I will bring my wife for a weekend break, agreed it is not the lowest cost option in the city and shouldn't be compared as such, what you do get in my opinion is what you pay for and a little more, if you want quality and a little style you will not go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: FrenchLeave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Crowne Plaza in Amsterdam's city centre over the weekend and were mightily impressed with everything. Our room was large (we were upgraded) and spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable giving us 2 superbly relaxing nights' sleep. The staff were courteous throughout. The venue of this hotel could not be better and yet, despite its central location, it was safe and secure. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in a very good hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: alexandrasousa
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in this hotel located in the very center of Amesterdam, it's near the train station, with loads of shops and restaurants just around the corner. The breakfast is very good with loads of variety of hot and cold dishes, they have pancakes on requests (no extra charge) and nice french style croissants. The room is spacious (stayed in 142), with a nice king bed and a small bathroom with bathtub. The staff is all very friendly and helpful. I will advice to stay in a high level floor (or in a room in the other side of the building) because the street is very busy so a bit noisy. Definitely a very good choice if you aim for 4 start hotel in Amesterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location, Friendly staff ,recently renovated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SvenZH
Reviews.Content: I stay regularly at this Hotel and the location is really amazing , there is no canal view but it is so close to everything, a few minutes walk to the railway station and all the public transportation, right in the city center you can walk to all the major sightseeing points. The hotel was renovated a maybe 1.5 year ago and is still looking fresh, wifi in all rooms, nespresso coffee machine , club lounge and a restaurant . Only the fitness is quite small. The breakfast offer is very good and the staff is helpful and friendly . I can only recommend it either for a short city break or as base to visit some more cities in Holland as with the train you can travel trough the country very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: MSandCS
Reviews.Content: This upscale hotel is in a perfect location in central Amsterdam, a short walk from the train station and Dam Square. Perfect for an overnight stay or longer. Location can't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGetawayFolks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. First hotel in a LONG time that rang up to room after check in to see if everything alright. (Always stay in 4 star plus so pleaseantly surprised that good customer service is not dead and buried). Room an adequate size for us and good facitiies. Cleaned morning and evening service also. Front of house staff extremely helpful. The bar and lounge areas very comfortable for nightcaps. We didn't have breakfast in hotel. Price, as usual in Netherlands, steep for what you get. Plenty of lovely cafes etc around for half the price. Very close to all amenities and tram stop just down from hotel. We spent alot of time wandering the Jordaan and Nine Streets which are within walking distance. Would recommend highly this hotel for service, comfort, location. Price as usual saucy but this is Amsterdam! Wouldn't have used internet access etc in hotel as price beyond belief but if you have a company paying I suppose not so bad!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: berged
Reviews.Content: Arriving by taxi or train, this hotel is in a perfect location. You can easily walk to most of the city sites from here, although I'd recommend taking a canal tour or getting a 'hop-on/hop-off' ticket. The hotel is recently remodeled since I last stayed, and it is quite a nice improvement. The lobby, dining and public spaces are very attractive. The updated rooms are very pleasant and the hotel services are very good. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, small, but clean.”
Reviews.Author: joesmoe00
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night. The hotel itself is very small, the rooms also. It was comfortable enough for a single quick night but I don't know I would want to spend longer.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bondsy74
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from Amsterdam visiting friends. We stayed with our friends the first night as we arrived late however we had previously booked the Crowne Plaza for our second night. As much as I love my friends, I wish we had booked 2 nights!! Firstly, our welcome was warm and friendly. The hotel is lovely inside, all staff are dressed impeccably and their manners equally so. We checked in and were advised our room was not ready (which was not a problem at all as it was only 12pm and we were just dropping our bags off). We had a twin booked but were offered a double if we were prepared to come back later in the day, again not a problem. We returned around 3.30pm to check into our room and we were very happy! Our room was HUGE, definitely did not expect it! Everything you need is in there, including robes and slippers. The bed was super comfortable and I am very fussy when it comes to pillows....they were divine! Approximately 15 mins or so after we had gone into our room, there was a knock at the door. It was one of the staff who looked slightly confused. He apologised profusely as he had been expecting someone else. We were concerned we had been given the wrong room! There was no issue so we thought nothing more and headed back out. Returned at 7.30pm to shower and change before heading out again, and we were greeted with a bottle of sparkling rose and a card, again apologising "for the disturbance earlier today". Naturally, we enjoyed the sparkling wine and thanked the staff. We would most definitely stay at the Crowne Plaza again if we come back to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: janpki
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with friend during Amsterdam Marathon. Arrived on early flight on Saturday morning and feared we have to wait for ever to get our room; but no, it was ready to move in early in morning. Never had that before. The room was recently refurbished and for city centre hotel in that price category top. The best off all was the friendly staff though. They were all friendly and helpful to the max (specially the guy at reception). Just perfect. Next time in Amsterdam will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: lizzylizzy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, close to easy transportation and major city center attractions. The central station is within 5-10 min walk, where frequent trains take you to Schiphnol in 15 min. Walking distance to the dam, red light district, and other major attractions (Anne Frank House for example is 15 min away). Yet hotel is not right at the attractions as some other hotels so has less noise and traffic (still facing a major road and easy to find). I was in a clubroom facing the courtyard and heard no noise at all. A glass table in the middle separates the room into roughly a living area (with a sofa, a coffee table and an armchair) and a sleeping area (a king size bed). I believe this room type is shown in one of the photos on their website and found it inconvenient - this setting forced me to use the glass table in the center of the room but it is too small and my chair cannot move around (it is locked on one side by another desk and at the other side by the coffee table). In room coffee and tea selections are plenty, with a tea kettle and a fancy coffee maker that uses small coffee packets. I was offered a one-package daily rate of around 28 euros for internet (20 euros daily if charged separately) and movies,and would probably accept it if my room rate did not include the internet already. Staff is more than friendly. The concierge desk is very helpful in providing all sorts of information and advice. Was greeted every time I entered the hotel or in the hallway. Club lounge on the ground floor is large and provides adequate contiental breakfast with yogourt and cold meat such as salami and turkey. During the day cookies and some small bites are provided.

Reviews.Title: “One of the simplest and classiest hotels I have visited so far”
Reviews.Author: SagaLEB
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Crown Plaza City Center in Amsterdam in September 2011. Just before that I was a guest in a Crown Plaza in Antwerp, Belgium. I still have the perspective of the Crown Plazas between two different countries and I have to say there are some big differences. 1- Hotel In General I just love that place. It is so charming and so welcoming. I have been to many luxurious accommodations before but that hotel is just classy and luxurious by being super simple. the lobby is spacious and has all what you need to have a swift quick check in. there is a dedicated Priority Club members desk. they greeted me like a king and my check in was swift and fast. There are two wings in the hotel and at the lobby they are separated by a large living room like area with a large TV in the middle, just a great area to unwind in with a glass of wine after a long day walking around Amsterdam and just before going up to your room. The hallways are a little think but well furnished with carpets which for the first time in my experience, are clean without dust. From outside the hotel is just a great facade of old Amsterdam which blends in its surroundings 2- Location In the middle of Downtown and just 5 minutes on foot from central station, it is really the best located hotel in the city. It is very close to all the attractions yet far enough to have a nice stay away from noisy and loud tourists. The red light district is two blocks away and the greatest cafes and bars are just surrounding the location. If you like shopping, well just walk a couple of blocks and enjoy all what Amsterdam has to offer in shops and markets. I give it a 5 on its location 3- Staff I personally like the simple smiles, they are welcoming and warm to experience when you spend a lot of time traveling. I don't like to be over indulged by compliments (I know you are after my money eventually) and smiley teeth and I also don't like to be greeted like I am a nobody. Well the staff here are surely warm and know how to treat to the fullest without being all around you at every corner. I got greeted by a very welcoming lady on the day of my arrival who has showed me the way to the priority club members desk. The guy in charge of that desk has also been extremely welcoming by making sure that I get checked in in 5 minutes and gave me a wonderful choice of rooms. All were very clear in their explanations, and offered me exactly what I was searching for. Baggage carriers here don;t act like beggars (as is the case in a lots of 5 stars I have visited), they just carry your bags to the room and just make a quiet exit....how can you not tip them in this case? Just a small note...they were not so helpful when I asked them for directions to reach the hotel, yet after check in they were super great in showing me around and offering me the best maps of the city. (Tram, roads...) Compliments to a really good job and really nice warming personnel 4- Rooms I really liked the room I was given. Spacious and super comfortable, the bed large and in the middle offers the best view of the TV. I don;t know what they have done to that bed, but you just sink in it and in between the pillows. You just don;t want to get out. The room has all the amenities you can imagine from a hotel and offers lots of comfort and ease of access to everything. The bathroom is well placed and its access is not obstructed by anything. I liked the balcony, not much of an asset in Amsterdam as it is raining most of the time, but I had the chance to have a great weather so relaxing on that balcony with a bottle of wine and enjoying the wonderful breezes was just magical. The only drawback is that the internet is paid. I am aware that a lot of hotels still charge for it but we are in the 21st century and I truly believe that internet should be free. Finally, I really recommend this hotel to all travelers who want to enjoy Amsterdam. It is a great place to be in. Your will definitely like Amsterdam even more while staying there

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tony W
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a King size room. Bed was US sized King size and much bigger than UK size. Room was clean and spacious with TFT TV on wall. 2 chairs to sit on round small coffee table and additional computer chair in front of workspace. Hotel staff very pleasant and friendly, and made the stay that much nicer. Will always be my first choice when staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: globalswede
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 nights stay in this hotel and were really pleased to 99%. Only problem was the lack of wifi connection in room ( but i dont complain really much as Platinum members get free Wifi and there was a neighboring house offering WiFi anyway..) Got upgraded to a Junior Suite and it was amongst the nicest hotelrooms I ever stayed in - perfect size, good working area and comfortable sitting area. Bed was just perfect for a good sleep. Nice lounge - could however be improved by adding something warm to the breakfast buffet. Also good with the opening hours for the lounge - 0700-2300. Check in was really efficient - so was check out. All needed information was given, also concierge services were efficient. Buy your sightseeing tickets here - a few Euros deductioin is given compared to buying direct at canal boat offices. I will certainly stay here again next time in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Lil H
Reviews.Content: A lovely well appointed hotel with excellent service and friendly staff. The location is fantastic and the hotel is hard to fault with spacious and comfortable public areas and lovely rooms with all the amenities you need. I really enjoyed my stay here and highly recommend this property to others. The only down side was no wi fi in room and huge price fluctuations from night to night. Breakfast was delightful - fresh, appealing and vast range of food groups to choose from. The conceirge staff were fabulous - very helpful and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: EarnyinLA
Reviews.Content: I stopped over in Amsterdam for one night and decided to stay at the Crowne Plaza. The location is great since it's not on a busy street but yet is close to almost everything. The central station is a block away and there is a tram that runs along the street in front of it. The checkin person was a great help. After a quick checkin, she was more than happy in showing me the area on a map. I asked her for some recommendations on where to eat and she gave me some great suggestions. Instead of pointing me to the hotel restaurant she showed me places around the area. The room was spacious, quiet, and up to date. Couldn't complain at all. The fitness center was on the basement floor and was sufficient. I had a car and the cost to valet was not bad compared to other places I've stayed at if you are a priority club member. I'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent one-night stay”
Reviews.Author: octeckels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very brief stay, arriving by train at 9 pm and leaving for a meeting the next morning. The hotel is a short walk from the Central Station. As a Priority Club Platinum member, we received an upgrade to a nice Excecutive corner room free internet access, and drink coupons. We had an excellent dinner in the restaurant, enjoying the delicious and very reasonable "October Menu." The room service breakfast the next morning was very good. When we come back to Amsterdam, we will definitely plan to stay at the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “great location, modern, spotless but bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: bjx25
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times and being just a few hundred yards from the train station, the location is great. Modern, with great well equiped bathrooms its a pleasure to stay here. However price fluctuates enormously so can go from good value to over priced within a day or so. Aother negative is the lack of wifi throughout and the exorbitant online charges in the room. Hotels of this calibre should provide free wifi throughout - its essential when on business. They dont charge extra for hot and cold running water - so why for internet. And watch out if booking using hotels.com - their price match guarantee - its worthless and they dont honor their commitment to reduce the price if the room rate drops. I tried 6 times to get them to recognise the new and lower price - all to no avail

Reviews.Title: “back to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: oldtraveller294003
Reviews.Content: when i go to Amsterdam,i like to stay as close as possible to DAM.We arrived at 7 am and our check-in time was at 2 pm.we were so tired .it fair to say that the staff were very understanding and allowed as a room at 9 am,thanks to them.however,the queen bed was small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: flennie
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in late September as part of a business trip. This hotel is very centrally located, only minutes from the Centraal station, right along a tram route. However, I walked everywhere, even as far as to Rembrandtâ€™s house. The room was exceptionally comfortable, a good size for single person, very well equipped with everything one can ask for. I especially appreciated having a hot water heater and assortment of instant coffee, hot cocoa, and teabags. I really appreciated the pair of slippers provided as I like to take my shoes off for comfort but do not like going barefoot. I even brought my own pair from a previous hotel stay, which I left behind since the pair from Crowne Plaza was much more comfortable! I ate breakfast one morning at the hotel restaurant, which offered a very good buffet, but was rather shocked by the price after wards (didnâ€™t check the price in advance). I needed to have a good breakfast before the meeting, so it was worth it as part of a business trip. All in all, I had excellent stay there, and was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: historian1874
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a three night stay at the Crowne Plaza in early October 2011. The hotel registration staff is very friendly and accommodating, especially as we arrived in mid-morning. Our room was quickly made ready for us and luggage transported to our room cheerfully and efficiently. The location is ideal for exploration of Amsterdam. This was our first visit to the city and the concierge provided maps and advice on how to locate sites of historic or cultural interest. We also were given information on nearby restaurants, which turned out to be excellent dining experiences. At our depature, the concierge made taxi arrangements to Schipol as well as provided advice on travel times. The room was nicely equipped with comfortable beds and an adequate sized bathroom. Although the shower controls were a bit difficult to figure out and operate, the water pressure and temperature were excellent. The room temperature controls worked very well. Coffee and tea are available in the room and ice machines are close by on each floor. The hotel is quiet. Access to elevators is controled by the room "key-card." The hotel restaurant provided very nice breakfasts, which are available at 13 euros each - excellent food with wide varieity. We also ate one dinner in the hotel restaurant. The menu was adequate for our needs and the food was nicely presented and of excellent quality. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. The friendly reception and concierge staff made the visit especially nice.

Reviews.Title: “Short break in the city of canals”
Reviews.Author: popejohn67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastically well located near Central Station and all the associated Tram and Bus services you will probably use whilst in Amsterdam. The staff were attentive and always say hello to you as you enter the Hotel lobby. Despite its central position, we found the Hotel peaceful and were not disturbed at night. My only gripe (just a small one) was that they allowed a group of very drunk men to congregate outside the building one morning which was intimidating.

Reviews.Title: “A right place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sjmartins
Reviews.Content: Great location, full hotel amenities, and a spacious & cosy room. Do we need more? Yes, free-wifi internet, but in these bailout days, cheap daily rates are welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room”
Reviews.Author: Ragnhild
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed just a five-minute walk from the Central station, and has a great location if you want to discover Amsterdam. Even if it is centrally located, I found it to be quiet, and the sleep quality was very good! This, of course, also do to the great beds. Nice touch with the lavender-spray to spray on your pillow at bed time. My room (which was an executive room with lounge access) was large, and tastefully furnished. Bathroom facilities also very good. The lounge was also good, so was the breakfast. All in all, a good hotel to stay in, and if I go to Amsterdam again, I will definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: MoeMom
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The location is fantastic (just a 5-10 minute walk from Centraal Station), the rooms are wonderful (with British outlets and American outlets on the desk), and the breakfast buffet is plentiful (but overpriced). However, the best thing about this hotel is its staff. Every single person I encountered was welcoming, professional and friendly. We got to the hotel before the official check in time, and they couldn't have been more apologetic that my room wasn't ready. Obviously, I understood and was happy to wait. They were able to have a room for me a couple of hours after I arrived (and was still able to check in before the regular check in time). The concierge is knowledgeable and helpful. The bar and restaurant members of the staff are also friendly. It's also a very quiet hotel. We didn't hear anyone in the halls or in the rooms on either side of us (and the hotel was full because of a conference). I will definitely stay here again when I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good under different circumstances”
Reviews.Author: Lunapants
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with a group during a large conference in Amsterdam. The location is convenient to everything near central station and other tourist attractions. I thought the breakfast was nice even if a bit understaffed during peak morning times. There were many mistakes regarding reservations dates of our group members and this caused frustration and a bit of stress. They had even lost an envelope left for a guest and claimed they didn't have it only to have it magically appear to his door the day afterwards. I would have assumed for over 250â‚¬ a night you'd get wifi but that was also an extra 20â‚¬ a day. If you get a good rate at the hotel it would make a nice base for exploring the city but I don't recommend the location for groups.

Reviews.Title: “Meh. The Renaissance around the corner is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: JessiandAmir
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad about this hotel really - it is very "ok". The decor is sterile, the rooms are small and the view is just ok. Prior to staying at this hotel, we stayed for one night at the Renaissance around the corner which turned out to be a far better hotel - Large rooms, great views, incredible staff and a delicious breakfast. Forgo the Crowne Plaza and stay at the Renaissance!

Reviews.Title: “great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tszil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near to the Central Station and the main hub of the city. The staff were most friendly and very helpful. Having stayed here before, the rooms we were given on this trip were much smaller than those given on earlier visits. It may be worthwhile checking this out when you make your reservation. Plenty of places to eat nearby, making the hotel breakfast rather expensive in comparison

Reviews.Title: “Great location for City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Dougal D
Reviews.Content: Although staying for a Leisure Break this time, I often stay in IHG Hotels for work, and this one lives up to their normal good standard. The Hotel is Ideally located close to the Central station. If you want a 'racier' entertainment the Red Light distance is but a short walk away but far enough away to not be right outside the windows! Transport in Amsterdam is by far easiest by tram, and these are located close by as well, with routes to all locations. There are canal cruise companies nearby also, but our experience of "Holland International" was enough to recommend travelling further afield for that entertainment! The Museums and Cultural centres are easily accessed, and the area around the canals makes for a pleasant walk. There are many restaurants nearby, with a variety of cuisine styles. Inside the hotel the room was reasonably spacious. Not huge, but we werent tripping over the bed either! Breakfast was pleasant. We left completely satisfied and ready for a day in the city. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. Courteous and always willing to go that little extra. Whilst not the cheapest hotel available in Amsterdam, the cost reflected the quality of service and stay and was well worth every last euro. When returning to Amsterdam for Business or pleasure, this will be where I will be staying. My only regret is that this was a short break and we only stayed for 2 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: xray35
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small, but nice and the decor was updated. The location is perfects, as it is a quick walk from the train station. I would definitley recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “Best European Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: VPNor
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be ranked # 1 on Tripadvisor! This is Amsterdam's best kept hotel secret! First of all, LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! Just 3 blocks from Central Station, on the metro route, close to many shops and cafes, red light district, gay and straight bars, and lots of attractions! You cannot choose a better location. The hotel staff is EXTREMELY PROFESSIONAL AND VERY VERY FRIENDLY!!! They are very knowledgable of American IHG Hotel Standards, as well as Amsterdam. The hotel is super clean, lots of great amentities, and is not over prices. The rooms are very large for European standards and the beds are out of this world. Very modern rooms with many modern amentities, including flat screen tv's. There is even a business center with free internet/computer use. If you are used to luxury at a moderate price, STAY HERE! IT is a OUTSTANDING HOTEL EXPERIENCE- and I travel to Europe and Amsterdam VERY OFTEN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Wendy M
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located close to central station - a short walk easily made even with a heavy suitcase. Located within easy walking distance of numerous sights including red light district and Den Square. Front of desk staff were delightful and knowledgeable. Concierge provided good information about tours and local train times. I was in a superior room which was nicely decorated and with a very comfortable bed. The provision of aromatherapy to help with sleep was most appreciated. Downside of hotel is the very expensive cost of movies, internet and food and the limited number of toiletries provided each day. In addition the room had limited view from the window. However, their is a business lounge in the basement where internet can be accessed free of cost.

Reviews.Title: “It's a perfect place to be in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DoobiBoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel surprisingly looks new and very clean. We stayed for 3 days and it was hard to leave the place. The food, shopping and entertainment is around the corner. No other place you'd rather be when your in this part of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Comfort, Service, but they forgot wake-up call”
Reviews.Author: cairoegypt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally 3 minutes walk from the Amsterdam Centraal Station which connects you to the airport by 15 minutes. After check-in, you can literally walk around everywhere in the heart of Amsterdam. there are great restaurants around both cheap and expensive. The service is great. They are very polite to you and will try to meet every request you have. Fortunately, as a Priority Club Platinum member, we were able to get an upgrade to a club executive room, which had king size bed, office, and living area. Complimentary water upon arrival, two free drinks at the hotel restaurant, free wifi access, and 50% off breakfast. We had our almost 2 year old with us, and they provided a baby cot at no extra charge. The baby cot was new, clean, and in working order. This is by far the best Crowne Plaza I've been to. Will definitely try to stay here again when we are in Amsterdam. The only problem was I requested a 6:30 am wake up call but it never came. We got up late and had to begin a mad rush to the airport. They simply apologized. We were unable to eat breakfast, and when we got to the airport, we were already very late and the lines were so long through check-in, passport control, and security check. I'm glad we made our flight, however, but we were hungry since we missed breakfast. It read in their policy that they would give us the room free if they miss our wake-up call, but they didn't do this at all. Although I used my priority club points for this, perhaps I should have received a refund of my points because they forgot the wakeup call. This was the only thing disappointing about my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Hotel Choice for Amsterdam, Ever!”
Reviews.Author: bignewf93
Reviews.Content: After several trips to Amsterdam, the Crown Plaza is tops. Location is just a five minute walk to Centraal Station, and to the trams. Restaurants and shops are within a few block walk. Exceptionally professional and friendly staff, who honored any request. I stayed the last week of August, and my last day my flight back to the US was cancelled. Extending my stay another day required zero effort, just a quick request to the front desk. I stayed in a club room, a full-sized room equivalent to an American Sheraton or Marriot. The room was spotless and very quiet. Also included in the club room was complementary beer and wine and snacks in a private room, which included a pc and printer. The lobby is modern and spacious and clean, as well as the entire hotel. Internet came with my room, both wired and wireless, with excellent connection speed. My cellphone fell out of my pocket in the taxi in front of the hotel, and by the time I realized I left it, the cab sped off. About 30 minutes later, I asked the front desk to check with security, and about a minute later an extremely polite man, who was the head of security handed me my cell phone! What incredible customer service! When I inquired about day trips out of Amsterdam, they went out of theri way and spent alot of time researching options for me. There is no need to waste hours of time looking for hotels on your next trip to Amsterdam, as this hotel will meet all your expectations and more. Also, Crown Plaza will match the internet room price with any online site like Orbitz, Hotels.com, Expedia, etc, and you won't have to worry about your reservation getting mixed up with some third party agency. So why add additional worry to your vacation, Crown Plaze City Center gives you a pleasurable, worry free stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in amsterdam centre”
Reviews.Author: MIG21
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights during our honeymoon , the hotel was great , the location just off dam square is awesome , u really won't need to take any taxis or public trans. as everything is within walking distance the red light area is also close by but u can simply avoid it , nothing to ruin ur trip for , unless u wana go there ..LOL just like all the staff we met in our european trip , the staff at this hotel was great too , they managed to get a taxi for me early in the morning for my flight , they were always smiling & willing to help , nothing was too much for them the room is on the small side (if compared to the hilton that we stayed in recently) but generally its decent in european standards , plus it was very clean & seemed like they went through a major renovation a yr or 2 ago as everything was clean & modern the breakfast was good , not like the hilton but the spread was decent , the food was fresh & tasty , again the staff at the restaurant were as great as the ones at the front desk i will always recommend this hotel for their great location & hospitality , & will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “YOUR CHOICE IN AMSTERDAM CENTRE”
Reviews.Author: mkent924
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth trip to Amsterdam, and if you wish to stay in the Center of the City close to Centraal Station, and want a spacious room, comfortable bed, and modern hotel with excellent staff, then this is your hotel of choice. During my stay from Aug. 23-29, I had the pleasure of being in a Club Room, which is spacious, clean, comfortable, and includes a delightful breakfast . The staff is extremely professional and courteous, and shows their dedication to superior customer service. This was demonstrated in numerous ways-the provision of early check-in upon arrival, prompt delivery of an extension cord to the room, hassle-free extendion of my stay to accomodate a flight cancellation due to bad weather, an informative and friendly Concierge and Front Desk staff, and attentiveness by staff in the Club Room. Upon a return trip to Amsterdam, I would immedately book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jabei
Reviews.Content: I am a Priority Club member which means I try to stay close to Holiday Inn brands. It doesn't always serve me well but I have yet to be let down with a Crowne Plaza. This hotel was no exception. The room / bathroom / foyer were all up to scratch, no problems at all. the location is great. Close enough to walk from the main station and anywhere else in the Centre you may need to go. The best part here were the staff....usually staff are only mentioned in terms of how they deal with problems. I had no problems here but was still bowled over by how friendly they were. We didn;t arrive until after midnight but the front desk was fully manned and the welcome and offer of maps/information etc. was as friendly as if it was midday. Throughout the stay, the "good mornings" - smiles - friendly comments were perfectly pitched to not be patronising or irritating. Maybe it's just Dutch hospitality but I found the people here just great.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: washmjd
Reviews.Content: We we're only supposed to stay here two nights, but due to hurricane Irene, we arrived in AMS a day early. The hotel had no issues checking us in early, and at the lower rate we had originally booked. The rooms were good size and very clean. This hotel is no more than a five minute walk to the Central Station. There Is plenty of everything around this hotel. You're on the outside of the red light district, 15 min walk to the flower market, 5 min to Dam Square, 20 min to Rembrandt square...great hotel if you can get it for a reasonable price. We paid about $190 euros/night. I did not eat at the restaurant. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best by Amsterdam Standards”
Reviews.Author: AfshinM
Reviews.Content: The reason I say it was the best by Amsterdam standards is that most hotels in Amsterdam, for that matter in Europe, pale in comparison to those in USA or Canada. I usually stay at the Ibis Hotel. However, decided to change as I can not handle the small rooms at that location. I booked a king room. The room size was decent (again by European standards). The bathroom was much better and larger than other hotels in the city. The premise is well kept and clean. The room is very clean with new furniture. The hotel building is old, but has been renovated and modernized, The staff were friendly. The breakfast buffet was quite pricey (25 euros per person). Internet access is free in the business room, but 20 euros every 24 hours if you wish to use it in your hotel room. The hotel is just 15 minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station (down the first street that leads to the train station). It is also quite close to shops and other attractions. I did notice that at night the area is a bit shady so use caution when walking late in the area. Then again, most of Amsterdam looks shady and quite dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussieleeann
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for a one night stay for my two adult children and my husband and myself. They gave us adjoining rooms which was great. The staff were very helpful and polite and the rooms were clean and modern. A nice touch was the aromatherapy essences to help you sleep. We didn't eat at their restaurant and instead chose to dine with the locals. Good value hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, modern hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Rufito_Annet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crown Plaza Amsterdam City Centre a long weekend and was amazed by the friendliness and responsiveness of the personnel. There was always a smile on the faces which made me feel very welcome. Moreover, the hotel is very centrally located with main tourist attractions in walking distance and the central station not far away. The hotel itself is up to the higher standards with an appealing modern interior design, big rooms a business centre where you can use the internet for free and make print outs and it has a small fitness room. In short - I can very much recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gail c
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days for our honeymoon in August. The hotel was lovely - really clean, comfortable rooms. We were honeymooning on a ridiculously tight budget so the fact that we were given a free upgrade and had a free bottle of wine waiting in our room when we arrived made a huge difference. Small touches, like aromatherapy in the room and an ice disepnser just outside our room, were really nice. The staff at this hotel were very helpful (particulalry Sylvie) and more genuine than we have ever come across - usually I feel quite irritated by the constant and obviously fake 'good mornings' and 'enjoy your days' that are handed out by hotel staff around the world, but there is something about the staff at this hotel that feels very genuine in their desire for guests to enjoy they stay here. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: krys_k
Reviews.Content: This place is really great - quick walk from station and following renovation its great - sometimes renovations are only in public areas and corridors and rooms are ignored - not here, its a four star but one of the best I have stayed in. Staff are very friendly. Brilliantly comfy beds too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: barilyn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. There was no complaints from us about their service, food or customer service. The room was clean and beds comfortable. We would stay again and recommends our friends to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: seansaudiRiyadh
Reviews.Content: Cannot beat this hotel for the location, 2 mins from Centraal Station and Dam Square. Rooms are great, modern and comfortable. Bed is one of the best. Staff are very friendly and helpful. I ate at the New Dorrious restaurant - service was exceptional and the food on offer was great Dutch fayre with a modern take. Excellent value for money and i would always make this my preference when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sosincere
Reviews.Content: Clean,Quiet,Great location...if they only offered coffeein the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - ideal location”
Reviews.Author: djg2018
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel, as I'd booked it as a special offer via ICH as my "usual" hotel in Amsterdam was fully booked, or at least wouldn't allow a one night stay on that weekend, I wasn't too sure what to expect. Despite the outside of the building being somewhat anonymous and in keeping with the buildings around , the inside of the hotel is very modern design with a very well laid out entrance lobby , so loads of circulation room before reaching the reception desks. Reception staff were friendly and efficient, both for check-in and check-out. I was in a Club Room, which was extremely spacious - certainly by Amsterdam standards - with a wide choice of toiletries, very comfortable bed, good choice of complementary hot drinks ( including an espresso machine) . I'm guessing the room was renovated no less than a couple of years ago at most , as the fabric of the room was in good shape. The hotel itself is in an excellent location, being just 5 minutes walk from the Central Station, and around 10/15 minutes away from Dam Square on foot, with tram stop outside for travelling further. All in all, a very nice hotel in an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: jontycLondon
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find any fault with the hotel, apart from the bath/shower taps are hard to turn. It's in a good location, easy to walk to from the train station. Staff were helpful and friendly. Room was a good size and clean. Hallway carpet is a bit dated, but room decor is good.

Reviews.Title: “You can not go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Beanbag109
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay. You are smack in the middle of AMSTERDAM! This is the best hotel to stay at if you plan on explore Amsterdam. I got to the hotel at about 9 am, and after a short nap, I went exploring. All day long, I had my room close by if I needed to take a break. After my long day, the bar down stairs was just what I needed before going off to bed.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: KKfromFL
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for all the main attractions. A very comfortable hotel. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Super well located quality hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: PE1703
Reviews.Content: Several years ago, I stayed at your hotel for just one night - I had no complaints. Last Friday, I have, again, visited you, and have the following feedback: Renovations made at your reception area really working. The check-in desks are well positioned, and the whole area is very welcoming. Reception & Check-in: Staff are very polite and professional. Even though, I had not advised of an early check-in, they made sure I was quickly accomodated, and even upgraded to a larger room. They duly mentioned special offers, hotel facilities etc..etc.. and shortly after my arrival in the room, made a call to check that all was OK. Room: Clearly quality renovation since my last visit. The overall quality of the room was excellent, it's a nice size, design, finish, well equipped, and comfortable. TV, internet, bathroom is nice. The shower unit was very easy to use. I liked the Nespresso machine - Nice touch. Room-Service: The ordered food and wine lunch duly arrived within mentioned time of 20 minutes - The pizza was tasty and good value. Room service staff were polite and efficient. I departed fully relaxed, having decided that your hotel will now become the hotel of choice for all future travel to Amsterdam. It will also be recommended to colleagues & friends. In short, your hotel & staff are a credit to your management company and to IHG Hotel chain!

Reviews.Title: “Returning customer...Once again it`s the best!”
Reviews.Author: lfcmad2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 24th July for 1 night on a over night stop to Munich.I have stayed here before and knew what to expect.Some times you go back to a hotel and wonder why you liked it so much last time? Not with the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City centre,they continue to surprise me with there level of customer care..10/10 again..See you in November

Reviews.Title: “Our visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Westlakevillage
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza in Amsterdam was a great hotel. Centrally located. Near everything. We could walk everywhere. Near train. Were able to get tickets for museums through the hotel. Made it easier. Hotel staff so helpful and friendly. Enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in city center”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel255
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel based on friend's recommendation and was not disapppointed. This was our first time to Amsterdam. The hotel is ideally located in city center within a 10 minute walk to the train station (not recommended to walk if you're lugging alot of bags around), Anne Frank's house, Dam Square, and the canal boat tours. Hotel was clean, room large with comfortable bed, refrigerator, and room safe. Staff was very friendly and accomodating and recommended restaurants based on our tastes. You've got to check out the Pancake Bakery but get there when they open to avoid stanindg in line. It's a crepe rather than pancake but it was DELICIOUS, HUGE, completely filling a dinner sized plate, and did I say delicious? You won't walk away hungry!! You've also got to try Dutch pea soup...some places were better than others but it was always tasty. We took the Connextion bus to transfer from AMS airport to the hotel which cost about 15EUR per person and took about 30 minutes after dropping other people off at different hotels. Our friends took the train from the airport to city center for about 4EUR per person but complained it was a mistake dragging all their luggage (2 rolling duffles and 2 small carryons) across train tracks, up and down curbs to get to the hotel. Train station is only a 10 minute walk without baggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic! Great hotel and location....”
Reviews.Author: Njh001
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza Amsterdam We stayed 3 nights in a club room. Excellent hotel in a very good location. The rooms are a good size for European standards and are equipped with everything you need (including UK power sockets). Friendly and helpful reception, concierge and F&B staff. The club room is certainly worth the extra cost as it provides you with complimentary snacks and drinks throughout the day and complimentary internet access in your room. Would definitely recommend!Â

Reviews.Title: “Supberb location”
Reviews.Author: Cinders18
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 2 nights. Excellent location, just 2-3 mins from main railway station. Asked for a quieter room and were given a gorgeous room in their 'quiet zone' which doesnt allow children, no cleaning before 10am and is on top 2 floor away from any street noise. Will definitely be my 1st choice when next i visit amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great restaurant, fare prices”
Reviews.Author: liliaesther6
Reviews.Content: Crown Plaza Central in Amsterdam Good location specially if you are tacking the metro, train to Brugges, just cross the street to the Central Rail Station, great for shopping everything near by walking distance, excelent staff,

Reviews.Title: “Great stay--booked ahead and got a great price too!”
Reviews.Author: kpb1nv
Reviews.Content: Literally within 2 blocks of the Centraal Station and close to everything. Nice soundproof rooms. On a street that has plenty of eateries but is not TOO close to coffee shops, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! A little pricey, but worth it if you want to splurge!”
Reviews.Author: h-dog78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated close to the train station as well as the city center. You are in the heart of the tourist attractions with lots of cafes, restaraunts and bars, but you won't hear a sound when you're in your room. The staff were pleaseant and helpful, and the room was supremely comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in every way!”
Reviews.Author: thesarahrich
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City Center for a total of eight days this past month. We're Priority Club Platinum members and have stayed in numerous CP's over the years. This particular hotel and its staff were among the best, however. The hotel itself is located right in the middle of the city with easy access to all the main sites. There's a tram line that runs right outside the hotel, and Centraal Station is just a short (3 blocks) walk away. The hotel looks as if it's been recently renovated, and all the outlets and rooms are tastefully done. I should mention that the rooms are also "normal" sized for Americans, meaning they are substantially bigger than what most European hotels offer. The staff here were absolutely fantastic as well. Each person, from the bellboys who took our bags to the personnel behind the counter to the restaurant staff were extremely friendly and efficient. On two separate mornings we'd overslept and went down for breakfast (in their Club Lounge) with only 10 minutes or so left before closing. We weren't rushed to finish on either day, and in fact they left the buffet open longer simply to accommodate us. Like most of the Dutch, everyone there spoke beautiful English and were able to easily help us find places to go and direct us on how to use the subway. For those interested in using the Club Lounge benefits, I will say that it's smaller than some of the other lounges we've been seen in Crowne Plazas. However, the entire eight days we were there, it was continually stocked with drinks and snacks with relatively few people ever in there at once. We've used other Club Lounges that are noisy and busy (just the opposite of what you generally look for). This particular hotel has wine and beer available for most of the day, but no cocktail hour (with hors d'Å“uvres) like at some other hotels. They do provide a light breakfast in the sanctity of their peaceful little environment there, and we found it more than enough to satisfy us. While the lounge is small, it's very comfortable and offers two computers (along with free printing) and two large screen tv's if you want a break from all the hustle and bustle of the city. Internet is included with the lounge as well (including wi-fi in your room). Overall, we couldn't have been happier with our stay there. The general manager, Mr. Tako Kim Plate, extended a warm welcome to us, and we genuinely felt important to all the staff there. We travel often to Amsterdam, and there's no doubt that we'll stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jamesmac32
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice, clean and very modern Rooms! The gym is ok but not spectacular (admission is included though). Breakfast was ok but not spectacular. All-in-all a great stay and great value for money! Recommended for both business and pleasure

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: RobStone_UK
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel for its proximity to central station, which makes it easy to see all of The Dam. Great discreet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
