Reviews.Author: LeedsDunc
Reviews.Content: Good clean comfortable hotel, staff were polite, pleasant and efficient on check in. Location is excellent minutes from central station and very easy to find. Room was of a reasonable size I would say large for Amsterdam. Sound proofing was fine with very little noise from the street or the inside of the hotel coming into the rooms and the blackout curtains worked better than most hotels I have been in. The bathroom was a decent size for Amsterdam and had the usual complimentary soaps and gels. I did think the help to sleep aromatherapy sprays a nice touch. Overall a very pleasant stay and this is now my favourite hotel in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: loveknot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short break to Amsterdam as we got a decent rate. Your standard Crowne Plaza experience - think business hotel. Comfy bed, decent shower, quiet rooms, TV, minibar etc. Good location, close to central station and Dam Square. Good transport links with the tram to take you to the flower market/vondelpark. A tad rough round the hotel as it's close to the infamous red light district, a few unsavoury characters around and not much choice of decent food. There's better eating places and more scenic walks to take if you leave the hotel and head in the direction of the Anne Frank House. This is Amsterdam at its finest. Points to look out for: - the car parking is ridiculously expensive, 40 Euros plus city tax per night - better parking out by the olympic stadium and get a tram ride in, 8 Euros per day - for some weird reason they charge 20 Euros per day for wi-fi access, what a money making con given its business credentials. No hotel these days in my opinion should be charging for wi-fi access. We were room only so I cannot comment on the food within the hotel. Overall one of those hotels that is uninspiring but does the job to enjoy the city at its finest.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Hell!”
Reviews.Author: zakthetax
Reviews.Content: "Welcome to Hell" - I should make it clear - these are not my words but those of a member of staff in the Club Lounge. He clearly didn't see me sitting there when he let his colleague in late one evening! Obviously not happy in his work as he very rarely smiled and wasn't overly welcoming. He looked rather horrified when he saw me sitting there! We had already christened him Mr Grumps even before the comment and even though he was grumpy he was still very efficient in every way. I have to say thought that I really enjoyed my stay! The hotel is clean, comfortable and very well located opposite the central station. The room was modern and stylish - only downside was the size of the bathroom. I was in a Club Room and the bathroom was very small - e.g. you had to shut the door to get anywhere near the toilet, bath or use the sink - a bit of a disappointment. Wi-Fi is expensive as others have noted - you would have thought that Wi-Fi would be free in these modern times or at least much, much cheaper than it is. We ate in the restaurant one evening and the food and service was good. Seems to be geared towards the American tourist (e.g. USA Steak!) which I don't particularly like - nothing against Americans but would prefer it to be more authenticly Dutch. All the main attractions of Amsterdam are within walking distance and you won't be stuck for something to do. Overall an excellent stay and I would highly recommend. Book early and get a good rate - if you leave it to the last minute you'll struggle to find availability as the place was full every night we were there.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly located charming hotel for a high price”
Reviews.Author: mintkiwi
Reviews.Content: i definitely liked the hotel because of it's great location, nice stuff, comfortable rooms, old building and decoration. the hotel is perfectly located, just in the middle of the action. there is shopping street, lots of bars and restaurants just around the corner. charming old building, very small but comfortable rooms with large windows. small clean bathroom with a window. the price is high but the hotel worth it. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: AndreaOregon_USA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for last Christmas and New Years. My email correspondence prior to arrival was always promptly responded to and the staff went above and beyond my expectations in filling my requests. We had a Jr Suite with a balcony and it was amazing. Watching the fireworks on New Years was a priceless view. The club lounge was also a great treat. To be able to sit and relax right in front of a pedestrian only zone and watch the flow of people with a beverage was terrific. I am not sure what was best - the room, the staff or the location. I would recommend this hotel and have already booked again for the upcoming holiday.

Reviews.Title: “STILL....no actual benefits for the loyalty of Platinum members!”
Reviews.Author: NOTqwertyedYET
Reviews.Content: The good points is the location (close to centrum station and a mere 5 min max walk), staff, cleanliness, decor....and the of course the bed.!! Just to repeat previously reviews of that the internet is crazy for 20euros (minus 20% (16euros)) for Platinum members) for 24 hours (which I might add is TOTAL for 24 hours...not as most places of 24 Hours of USAGE!). They did give me 2 free drinks voucher being a platinum member must be what previous members have been complaining about as normally you get 1 free breakfast and one free drink voucher. Although, seeing I'd already paid the ridiculous amount of 25euros for the breakfast for 8 days (yes that's eight days.....you make the maths). Overall it is a very nicely decorated hotel, which feels new and clean and to be completely honest itâ€™s the staff and location are the best thing about this hotel. Would I stay again? It depends.......Being on business the internet was a real issue for me.....but honestly, I would stay possibly without the ridiculous price for the normal standard of breakfast for this rated hotel!. Also, think twice on their loyalty issues as previous reviewers have said so donâ€™t expect anything more than a free drink or maybe a free breakfast (ONE of course!!) even if you stay for over 8 nights!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel Super location”
Reviews.Author: WannaVacataionAgain
Reviews.Content: Back for my 3rd visit. Close to train station and all to see And do in Amsterdam. Large-ish rooms for Europe. Spotless facility. Unsurpassed service. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No internet = not a good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rocketleech
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times, always for business. Very good location, nice quiet rooms, very good restaurant. This time I was very disappointed that the wi-fi internet was not working. I was not informed of this major inconvenience when I checked in, and I was repeatedly assured by the front desk staff that the problem would be resolved "within an hour". Except that it wasn't. A business hotel without internet is simply unacceptable. The response of the front desk staff has been even worse. I received profuse apologies and the assurance that the problem will be resolved soon. That is a day late and a dollar short. The front desk should have clearly informed me that internet was not working, in which case I would have gone to another hotel. As it was, their misinformation caused me lots of problems, loss of business, etc. I guess refunding the payment for non-performance is not part of the Crowne Plaza's policy.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location, staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: ChappyOz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights, the room was excellent, spacious with a very comfortable bed. They also had aromatherapy to help you sleep! The bath was also very relaxing after a long flight. I found the location very good, with a short walk to the train station, trams everywhere and a quick walk to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Azra_8
Reviews.Content: Modern, comfortable and conveniently located. Room small but modern, clean and well appointed. Very quiet despite busy street. Very good night's sleep. Business and meeting facilities very good and lobby area wonderful with comfortable chairs, a fabulous library, great meeting tables and even an open fire place. Staff helpful and courteous. Wish they had had bicycles available for guests on-site.

Reviews.Title: “Super Comfortable Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: n1w9106
Reviews.Content: Check-in on May 18th was a great experience after nearly a full day of travel from the US. Everyone at the hotel spoke perfect English, were courteous and helpful, and visitors will have no issues communicating. We were given a choice of rooms and selected one one in the "quiet" wing. We received a stylish corner room with a nice view. The room was clean and appears to have been renovated in the past few years. The bed and linens were comfortable, the furniture and room trim was very nice (looked like teak wood) and the TV was a big screen. The bath was also very nice, granite, tile and glass throughout. As implied, the room was quite and with the curtains drawn, very dark. The room rate included an excellent English breakfast in the restaurant/bar at street level. Room coffees/teas and bathroom amenities were enjoyable. The location of the hotel was perfect for sight seeing. In addition to being less than a block from the trains at Centraal Station, it was also less than a block from canal boat tours, bus city and day tours, and was walking distance to the Jordaan and nine street areas. We enjoyed Keukenhof gardens on through via a nearby day trip bus pick-up and had memorable meals at restaurants De Belhamel and Hamilton's.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - shame about lack of Platinum benefits”
Reviews.Author: diederik82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week stay in April while hosting a conference. The CP Amsterdam is a very nice hotel, centrally located and recently refurbished - rooms and public spaces are in great condition. Location: Absolutely great location, a few minute walk from the Central Station and close to all major hot spots in the city - yet the rooms give a quiet feeling. Great spot for exploring Amsterdam by foot or public transport, not so great if you are by car (which I in general do not recommend in Amsterdam). Priority Club: Big disappointment. As platinum member I did not receive a room upgrade, got a voucher for breakfast for one person for one day only (nice, however my room rate already included breakfast so useless) - the other days were discounted (note that the breakfast is expensive and not worth the money in my opinion) and 20% of their way overpriced internet access. With other words: don't expect anything as priority club member - they do not upgrade to Club access, room upgrades seem rare. Unfortunately there are not many alternatives for PC members apart from the very nice, but very expensive Intercontinental Amstel and Holiday Inn (which is quite far from city center). Rooms & Extras: Rooms were very nice, stylish, media hubs (i.e. USB charger for iPod, laptop could be connected to TV, etc) and very clean. Had a nice view from my room too! Beds were comfortable. Unfortunately, in-room internet is grossly overpriced at 20 EUR per day. For me a reason to might stay somewhere else next time. The connection was also very slow - to give you an idea, it wasn't even possible to stream youtube low quality videos without waiting on buffering all the time. Disappointing! Breakfast was okay, but not worth the 25 EUR (!) they charge for it. Quite a basic spread with limited choice of items for the price they charge for it. Would've expected more. Service: Absolutely great - all staff members (and I have met a lot of them) were very friendly and professional - not a single exception to it. It seems that the hotel spends a great time on training there staff - or they just have a very good hiring policy :) Conclusion: Great hotel, keep in mind that internet + breakfast come extra to nearly 50 EUR a day. Platinum members - keep in mind that the hotel doesn't seem to care much about that; which is a shame. Even so, still a great hotel and absolutely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and the right price/quality tag!”
Reviews.Author: WBastiaan
Reviews.Content: A hotel which fitted my requirements, cozy & trendy enough (renovated completely in 2009), very helpful staff (maybe this was even best of all I experienced in the hotel), nice room with very good beds (did not want to get out!), good restaurant, enjoyed the launch, good business facilities, shopping nearby, restaurants nearby but still not a large hotel. Not far (walkable) from the train station. I would stay there again (when they don't hike the price!).

Reviews.Title: “Going to Amsterdam - this is the place !”
Reviews.Author: LornaShay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just over the road from Central Station and close by to all the sights. Our room was spacious, modern and clean. There is a tray with Coffee, Tea, biscuits, etc. A fridge, room safe and even little sprays to put on your pillow to help you have a good nights sleep - but the beds were that comfortable you dont need them. The breakfast was fabulous and you could even have a drop of Cava if you were up to it - I mixed mine with fresh orange juice (well it was morning after all!). The lounge area is very stylish! You dont need adapters as there is a plug port in the room. Amsterdam was nicer than I thought - if you are going to Anne Franks house go early or very late as the queues are massive! A Canal cruise is recommended and there are lots of Argentinian Steak houses which are good. The drinks can be very expensive look at the prices before you buy in some places and some even charge to use the loo.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruthie2m
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel one of the best we have stayed in. It was clean, comfortable, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was excellent and the food in the restaurant was good and served by friendly staff who could not do enough to help. The bedrooms were modern and clean. The beds were so comfortable that we had the best night sleep ever. Position great and near all the sights. All in all an excellent hotel and one that we would certainly recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, quiet, spacious”
Reviews.Author: hbd82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hop, skip and jump from Centraal station. We only needed to stay overnight for one night and it was perfect. Very new, modern and spacious. Nice bathrooms that have showers up to American standards. Very comfortable beds and had more space than older hotels in area. Breakfast was not complimentary and seemed too expensive. It's not along the canals - so if you're looking for a romantic view out the window or want to be in a narrow old, Dutch building - this is not it. But it's very nice and I'd say Americans could equate it to nice hotels in big, U.S. cities. Maybe better for business and quick trips than romantic get-away place.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TheChinaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in many placed in Amsterdam and the Crowne Plaza is definately the best. Breakfast is not bad but the bed is fantastic with great pillows. The service is not exceptional but its pretty good for Amsterdam. Its situated right next to Central station so if you land in Schipol you just need to get a train to Central station, walk out the front, cross the road and your there. Taxis are very expensive in amsterdam so this is something not to overlook. There is also a tram stop near the hotel so its very easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Value & Service in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: No7Agency
Reviews.Content: Reception staff & Management at this Hotel go the extra mile to ensure you feel welcome, the Club rooms benefit from a private elevator by the lounge area. If you are visiting Amsterdam and cannot decide I would recomend this Hotel. The location is perfect and the worlds best burger bar is a 8 minute walk away. (see my other review)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: TheTurfBurner
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with everything said recently â€“ an excellent hotel well sited for both the central railway station and city attractions. Friendly staff and good breakfast room (did not sample evening meal as there are too many restaurants in the area). Large and quiet bedroom with all necessary amenities and all the bits and pieces you could want (we were at the back â€“ front bedrooms could have been disturbed by Queenâ€™s Birthday celebrations). Also, free broadband internet in the basement. Liked the lounge area beside the restaurant, where the â€œbetter halfâ€� was much take with the gas fire (expect she now wants to buy one). Enjoyed stay and will definitely be back. Very minor comment â€“ not sure what I got for Platinum status. Free breakfast voucher (useless, had booked B&B rate), free 1 drink voucher (what was wife to do â€“ sit and watch me?) and a key ring (actually useful). Now, Iâ€™m only interested in the points, not status, but the â€œfreebiesâ€� should be something worthwhile â€“ 2 free drinks vouchers at the least. Also, hotel took full cost of package in GBPÂ£ from my credit card at time off booking â€“ which meant I paid their bank a conversion charge which would not have been applied by my credit card issuer. Second time this has happened with this hotel group and future bookings will include an instruction to pass debits in Euros only. Travellerâ€™s tips: Do not under any circumstances miss the Rijksmuseum and the Dutch old masters. Stunning. Do not visit during the Queenâ€™s Birthday (around 30 April) â€“ everything is shut. Do get a 1-day unlimited bus travel ticket and visit Edam and Vollendam (â‚¬6 with the IAmsterdam discount card) for the chance to see two nice Dutch towns with canal, river and sea walks. Bus stop currently at the east front of Central station, but may move as redevelopment work completes.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and plush in the middle of busy street”
Reviews.Author: Austingrl05
Reviews.Content: I don't walk in the US much, so I was nervous about walking from C. Station, but it was a breeze. The area was in chaos bc I arrived on Queen's Day, but inside the hotel was tranquil. Staff helpful and friendly. My room was cozy and nice, all up-to-date. Breakfast was expensive, but convenient. Hotel walking distance to RLD, Coffee houses, AF house. Best-lovely atmosphere and I felt safe by myself. Least-nothing-great hotel, maybe a bit pricey, but worth it if you expect perfection in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a travelling couple”
Reviews.Author: berkshiremick
Reviews.Content: Five minutes walk from Centraal Station, so easy to find - also easy to leave on the return journey. The staff wer very helpful, and the concierge advised of the impending queues at the Van Gogh museum (he wasn't wrong) when he sold us tickets (at no extra cost). Tram tickets were for sale here also. The room was comfortable, and spacious, and breakfast was up to expectations. We had a champagne (Cava) breakfast on our 30th wedding anniversary (02/05/11), but that is available to every guest. The service was excellent at every level, and no one appeared to be judged by the professional staff. The hotel appears to be off the radar of stag and hen weekends (the price is right here then), and offers a tranquil environment - we would not have known that the queens weekend (Dutch Royal Family) was going on outside until we hit the street..

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DAC041
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights on a City break. Good hotel will helpful staff, clean rooms and great location near to the central station. Rooms very quiet and great sleep - very comfy bed and pillows. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Philafoodie
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews and were very satisfied -- just a short walk from the Central Station and conveniently located for lots of trams that provided good transportation to everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel was 4 star quality, very clean and attractive. They let us into our room when we arrived at approximately 10 AM, for which we were very grateful after an all-night flight with no sleep. The concierge and all the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Platinum members don't count on upgrades - disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Iwannabeonvacation
Reviews.Content: As has been said in other interviews - these beds were wonderful!!! The location is convenient to the train. I did not feel like the staff were helpful to someone who was clearly a visitor. The bathtub is ridiculous. I can't believe they haven't been sued when someone has fallen trying to get into it. It israised 2 feet off the ground. Water temp flucuated constantly. It's so disappointing to read some reviews where platinum members are given free club access or vouchers for breakfast or drinks. We were given nothing. IHG should make some rules that are standard for every person. I understand they can't upgrade you to a suite if one is not available but that doesn't explain how they can give one platinum member free breakfasts and nothing to the next platinum member. Frustrating!!!! Being a platinum member of this hotel chain means nothing as far as I have seen - I am focusing my loyalty to Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity to train station, good value”
Reviews.Author: BostonInAustin
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed, pillows, and room. Up to date with good internet access (but expensive if not included in room). Breakfast is quite expensive at 25â‚¬. Location is great for train station and tram access, but areas father south might be more desirable if train access isn't a top priority. First floor street side rooms can be a bit noisy. There is a fitness center but with limited equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Quinola
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, perfect location and very friendly staff. The beds are superb. Make sure you reserve parking if travelling by car.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel right over from the train stationnd”
Reviews.Author: TheadamsfamilyLeics
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend although it was quite expensive the room was clean and quite modern given a corner room but the windows do not open so no fresh air I must say the staff were friendly but the foyey aNd lounge lacked atnosphere but breakfast was nice overall a good clean hotel and very central

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lovesmusic
Reviews.Content: My husband had business in Amsterdam and I came along. His business colleague wanted to stay at the Crowne Plaza near Centraal Station. The rate we got for the days we would pay for the room (before and after the company-paid nights) were acceptable, so we decided to stay there the whole time (8 nights) rather than changing hotels. We were glad we did -- we liked the location and it was a very comfortable hotel. We arrived very early Saturday morning after our overnight flight and we waited in the comfortable lounge area for an hour and then we could get into our room. The bed was comfortable, with lots of pillows. Everything seemed quite new and very clean. We only had breakfast at the restaurant one morning and it was delicious. But it was too expensive for us to do everyday, plus we end up eating more than we need when confronted with such delicious buffet choices. We didn't end up paying for internet, but each day used the business center in the lower level, which had 3 computers with free internet access. They were usually available and the internet was fast, so it was fine for us. The city is very walkable, but this hotel is also close to public transportation options and very convenient when coming in on the train from the airport -- it's just a short walk away from the train station. The staff always seemed friendly. We rented bikes for 24 hours and they let us lock them up overnight in the area where the staff keep their bikes. And when we asked the concierge where we could get a good steak, he gave us a card for free drinks at Toro Dorado across the street from the hotel. The steaks were great. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: petrol1967
Reviews.Content: Was in Amsterdm for 1 night to attend an exhibition at the RAI Centre. Check in was perfect, and as a Platnium Priority club member, I was given a free breakfastcoupon and a free drink in the bar, Nice touch! Room was good size in relation to other European cities. Hotel is in a great location for site seeing, as just a 3 minute walk from Central Station. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: lfcmad2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights using my reward points. Being a Gold member i liked that they had there own desk with leather chairs to check in. The staff were 100% perfect in everyway My Friend got some sad news the first night we were there that his father passed away and the Hotel called KLM and arranged his flight home for him,depite the fact we were drunk as were out all day,i cant imagine many hotels would of helped us.. Total respect

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: trvllife1
Reviews.Content: Been wanting to stay at this property for a few years now but always felt it was way over priced. Finally I got a reasonable price and thought I would give it a try. Good point would be location. Across from Central Station. In the heart of the center so plenty of places to eat drink and be merry. Modern hotel with what I felt were exceptionally large rooms. Had all of the amenities of a modern hotel including over priced mini bar, iron, robes, safe and toiletries. Did not interact much with the staff but they all seemed friendly and willing to help if needed. Beds were large and comfy with about 6-8 pillows on each bed. Room was overall very clean and modern looking. Bad point would be the internet access. If you pay for 3 hours at 09:00 it will expire at 12:00 regardless of how much time you were actually online. Most hotels I stay at have a timer on the internet service so if you buy 3 hours you actually get 3 hours of internet time. Considering what you pay for this service it was incredibly disappointing and a complete waste of money if you only need the internet for 10 or 15 minutes at a time. Based on this alone I would not stay at this hotel again. If the internet is not a big deal for you then I would have no problem recommending it on the other merits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: assafJerusalem
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, fantastic location welcoming staff 5 min walk from Central Station and 5 min from center High level spacious rooms No doubt I'll be back to the hotel assaf

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Dave4242
Reviews.Content: I had a layover for a night and day and this hotel is in the perfect location. Taking the train from the airport is the only way to go. The hotel is a 3 block walk from the Central Station. The hotel staff was great and gave me excellent suggestions in what to do on limited time. It is close but not too close to the RLD. I requested an early check in at 9 a.m. and they had a room ready for me when I arrived I even got upgraded. Room was very nice and quiet. Breakfast is insane at 25e but not many choices at 7 a.m. on a Sunday morning and I looked before coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent staff, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: OldWoodster
Reviews.Content: I had booked two rooms using reward points for my wife and I and friends. We also elected to pay a 55 euro per room per night surcharge to get an upgrade to an exec room which also gave us all access to the Exec suite. The staff at this hotel are fantastic, they literally could not have been more helpful, were very friendly and really made us feel like valued guests. The bedrooms were ok, we were on the 4th floor, they were a bit tight but well furnished. The bathroom was very small with a shower over the bath. The exec suite is on the ground floor which is unusual, and it was decorated in the 70's by the looks of things (and had piped music to match the decor) There was free wine and beer, soft drinks and a few snacks. Prettyy limited choices. Breakfast is also served there in the morning but it was very limited with no hot options, the staff informed us that we could eat in the main breafast restaurant at no extra cost, and this was excellent. The communal areas of teh hotel are very modern and relaxing. Overall an excellent hotel, made all the more enjoyable by the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: BeHappy001
Reviews.Content: Rooms are equipped with mordern furniture, but not classy. Hotel is very well located, Dam Square, high street shopping, resturants are just walking distance from the hotel. Tram as well as Railways station is also near to the hotel. If in amsterdam people (both guys and gals ) want to see the red light area, which is also close to the hotel. Crown Plaza Amsterdam is a good hotel if your are not looking for great ambience, amenities, services etc.. coming from Asia, I was a bit shocked with the service culture, you will find people less polite and not proactive to help. I also found service bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay excellent location”
Reviews.Author: shannonehill
Reviews.Content: I'm a priority club member and am typically very happy with hotels in the holiday inn family. This crown plaza exceeded my expectations! The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was incredibly comfortable (soft bed, not hard like typical european hotels). The location is perfect! Restaurants, pubs, shops, coffee shops, etc right out the door. You can buy tickets to most museums and attractions at the front desk. This is super convent since lines to buy tickets can be very long! I'm planning a return trip to Amsterdam in a few months and will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “out standing”
Reviews.Author: king4495
Reviews.Content: he came here for one night to celebrate my sisters 21st birthday, he got of the plane, got on the train and walked for 2 mins and we where at the hotel, wwe walked into the hotel and all the staff where so friendly annd polite (they could not have helped us much more) we then went to are rooms and they were so clean and tidy. this hotel is one of the best that i have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - good location and service”
Reviews.Author: Jtung74
Reviews.Content: Two nights stay at this hotel for leisure. Overall very good hotel. Location is great. Few minutes walk to central station. The city being so small you can walk to everywhere. Service is also great â€“ very helpful, and efficient. The bar area is quiet, with fire place. Good place to have a drink after a long day of sightseeing. Service in the restaurant is great but the food is average. I was told that the restaurant was in the historical room before but they moved it to the new part of the hotel. The historical room looks stunning. New restaurant is a bit cold and soulless. Room is clean and contemporary. Bathroom is on the small side but still good. I was given a room facing the busy road and you can hear the noise (mainly the traffic) during the day, but after 10-11pm it gets quiet so not a big issue Overall a good hotel, reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Dierregi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is closed to the station and conveniently located for shopping. The lobby is large and a bit "cold". The room we had was on the 4th floor. It was spacious enough for twin beds, a small table and chairs, a desk, flat TV screen on the wall and small wardrobe. The lighting was good and we had reading lamps (very difficult to find a hotel offering reading lamps - they are however much appreciated). Everything looked spotless clean. We got a robe and slippers, and plenty of towels. Complimentary coffee, tea and a small bottle of water are at your disposal. Downstairs there is a large room with fireplace, which also looks a bit "cold", but strangely enough, also quite cosy, probably thanks to the wooden panels. Breakfast is not included, but it is served in the hotel restaurant. We had dinner in the same restaurant and absolutely loved it. The food quality is excellent, service impeccable and the atmosphere very cosy. Final note: we received a thank you e-mail a couple of days after our stay. It was a surpirse and a nice touch, much appreciated. Even if you do not stay in this hotel in Amsterdam, I would strongly recommend eating in the restaurant. A rare pleasure, especially for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Kelly-Marie1984
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hote. The team were very friendly and welcoming on arrival, the rooms were lovely. The only small negative was the room was noisey but I did expect that been in the city centre and by tra lines.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location location”
Reviews.Author: good2go43
Reviews.Content: 3 days in Amsterdam. Great hotel for single female. Close to train station, city transportation, shopping. Hotel restaurant excellent, maybe a little higher cost, but service, food and attention was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless hotel”
Reviews.Author: jack321
Reviews.Content: We arrived before 10 am to put our bags in the luggage room, they had a room ready but as it was on the 1st floor and we had requested the 3rd we decided to go off to the anne frank museum have lunch and come back so that was nice of them. hotel is modern clean. 5 mins walk from central station with trams running up and down amsterdam outside. we heard no noise from the street trams stop at 12. nice living room area in hotel. didnt go for breakfast option. full irish breakfast accross the road for 8.50.this hotel is so central one street back from amsterdammes main shopping street which gones on for about 2 miles thro' dam square.Room was very big clean modern with a large flat screen with all mod cons incl iron etc.free internet pc's downstairs in the business centre + a fully equipped gym. paid 280 euro for 2 nights no breakfast you get what you pay for this is a quality 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Steve5839
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our break at this hotel and I must say I was very impressed. The staff were helpful attentive and knowledgeable. I was a little disappointed at check in as I had to ask for an upgrade (PC Platinum), but was given a recently refurbished club room when I pushed it. The refurbished â€œClubâ€� room we were upgraded to was very good and well appointed. We were also not told that we could have access to the Club Lounge, but I was not bothered as I knew we could have access, but it would have been nice to have been told. On to the hotel, the bar and service was excellent, the breakfast was good and plentiful; one point of note is that the breakfast staff are lazy, they do not clear tables quick enough despite them walking round the room past them and doing nothing. Free wifi in reception / bar would be a good addition to the service offering. The hotel location is also very good as it near the main party area, but far enough away too and it is also close to the train and local trams. All in all a good well run hotel, would I recommend this hotel yes.

Reviews.Title: “A Total FAILURE !”
Reviews.Author: Burek_Polny
Reviews.Content: We decided to make the most of our first trip to Amsterdam and went for the Crowne Plaza to spend the New Year there, enjoying stays at this hotel brand in other European destinations. Booked a Junior Suite (nr. 606 â€“ in case the hotelâ€™s Management would want to identify itâ€™s guestâ€™s easily) + parking lot for four days, almost EUR 400 a night and got in return (in order of appearance): 1. Parking lot in a neighboring building with no free access to our own car; 2. No chit chat greeting, nothing more than customary 'Hello'; 3. A complementary free drink voucher scribbled on back of a name card; 4. Found the terrace of the suite being left uncleaned after the last guests, including an ashtray full of stale cigarette bucks; 5. First day being denied access to Lounge Bar breakfast even though paid for; 6. No free wifi in the room even though promised in the offer (have been told the charge will be taken off the bill upon checkout); 7. Been misguided by the staff regarding trying to find my way to some local utilities; 8. Weâ€™ve been waiting for TWO days to have our dirty plates collected from hotel hall. We were really willing to compromise on all these inconveniences, but the last straw was the lousy quality of breakfasts we and our kids got during the WHOLE duration of our stay (breakfasts were served in two rooms: regular and Lounge Bar): there was hardly anything tasty, the boiled eggs were served cold, scrambled eggs seemed as if being stepped into, nothing for individual order, no omlettes, no fresh, organic food nor bread, the whole choice tasted stale, unsavory, inedible and tasteless and was really limited. First day we ate at regular bar, the next at lounge hoping for breakfast to be better there, BUT it turned out that there was even a smaller choice available in the Lounge Bar menu. We complained on the quality, but in return were told that the hotel serves no more, than what is found on the tables (sic!), which I find hard to understand. Together with our kids, we were leaving the hotel disappointed and hungry EVERY morning and had to supplement our breakfasts outside (so this was by no means a one day slip up!) ! An unimaginable, annoying and unforgettable experience I would never want to go through again, especially with our kids around. The staff generally presented a friendly attitude, the place has recently been refurbished to a stylish, glamour look, but the number of drawbacks and the quality of food puts this hotel's real value into question. I would accept this in a 2* facility, but not in a Crowne Plaza. The only thing which is great is the location - the only thing the hotel canâ€™t spoil anymore. It is right next to the pedestrian zone Niuwendijk, with lots of shops, boutiques and coffee places, where one can get high easily, considering the hotel's price tag and the given treat for it really being indecent...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Montebono
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza City Center and were very impressed with how modern, clean, and comfortable the room was for the price we paid - $150/night (excluding breakfast). It is a very short walk from the train station (approximately 5-10 minutes) and the train station is approximately 15-20 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Historic Provenance. Love it!”
Reviews.Author: portmill01
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic location. Recently remodeled, this hotel is gorgeous. The staff is incredible. The restaurant is traditional dutch - meat and potatoes. Delish! Also don't forget Platinum Priority Club members get free access to Executive Club Lounge (which is on the roof and is amazing) with free food and drinks all day and Internet with printing. Just awesome. Excellent service and quality. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: fjbuck
Reviews.Content: We had a short two day trip - our fist - to Amsterdam. Chose this hotel because of location and reasonable price. One block from central train station made it great to get to and to get back to the airport. Staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. Room was available even though we arrived early in the morning. Great assistance with sightseeing recommendations (the two day I Amsterdam pass was well worth it) and also restaurant recommendations. Room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We didn't hear any noise from the street. Have stayed in more luxurious rooms but this had all we needed and more. We loved Amsterdam and plan to return. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You just don't get it.”
Reviews.Author: Hawkwind1966
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveller and stay in Crowne Plazas regularly. By being a regular and loyal traveller, I get good service at most Crowne Plazas - upgraded rooms etc. At the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam, after its renovation (which made this hotel a no-go zone for ages), I get the level of service that would not get me reaching for my wallet. Nothing bad, just nothing good - no welcome back, no friendly chat, slow service and quite honestly the rooms are average - poor for a renovation. I stay here on loyalty points, if I am paying I stay at the Radisson Blu - now they understand service.

Reviews.Title: “A single muttered "sorry" is not enough - if you have a chronic vermin infestation - close the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: awoods
Reviews.Content: I agonised re writing this - but I would want to know, so I am sharing it with you. The hotel since my last visit is great - lots of money has been spent, the decor is fantastic - really really good, full marks. Some of the staff are somewhere between rude and arrogant.. Stupid things at first - the shower in the room did not work, I reported it, I got the feeling I wasn't being listened to, and sure enough it still wasn't working on the 2nd moning. my key would not work on the 2nd day... no sorry for the fact I had walked all the way to the room and had to queue for it to be reset, before walking all the way back again . A query why my Platinum membership did not get me inot the Priority Lounge (which it does it all other Crowne Plaza hotels) again no sorry - just "we don't do that." - this despite I bought the hotel 3 colleagues ..... they wanted to go to the Hilton. Then the real cracker..... over dinner a mouse ran across the restaurant counter, where breakfast was served the previous morning. Guests screamed - the waiter just flicked it off the polished granite with his cloth - then carried on as if nothing had happened. In 30 years of business travel, some of it in very dodgy hotels I have never seen such a thing - the odd cockroach yes - but never mice in the restaurant. - I complained to reception (instantly deciding that this was not where I wanted to eat) - no sorry, more of a "that sort of thing happens all the time, do you really want to ttalk to the manager about this?" response! The manager arrived in my room and said much the same sort of thing - blaming the tunnels that are being built for the metro - he did apologise once - BUT this is not some 1* back street hotel or hostel, this is at least a 4, maybe a 5 star luxury hotel just refitted . I do not pay their rates to have mice running around the public areas of the restaurant - and if they are there I expect serious compensation - not a muttered "sorry they are everywhere". This is not good enough - and such a shame given the money that has been spent on the new fittings - mind you if they can not be bothered to look after them (faulty shower above) it is all a bit academic, as it will soon be shabby and not nice - a bit like some of the staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a Bit Noisy”
Reviews.Author: StephanieRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel property. We liked the hotel furnishings as much was recently upgraded. The staff was friendly and helpful for us. Location is nice in being close to Central Station and Dam Square. Because I am a Platinum member with ICH, we received a voucher for complimentary breakfast at the hotel's restaurant and a discounted price for others dining. We did eat there because of that-be aware that full price for buffet breakfast is 30 euros. It was a nice buffet. The only complaint I have on the property is that it is noisy. We were on the first floor facing the street and heard trams and traffic all night-keeping us awake.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: sclarkdundee
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that ticks all the boxes. If you are going to stay in Amsterdam ... stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: hitravlr
Reviews.Content: Didn't expect much, as I just picked a reasonable-rate hotel to stay the night during airport transfer - but what a surprise! The rooms were super spacious, interior design modern and good taste, nice and clean bathroom appliances. Amenities were nice, and even included a loaded Espresso machine and chocolate! Staff was very friendly and helpful, and we felt welcomed very much. Thanks a lot for the nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: LozzieDokay
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam and a nights stay at the Crowne Plaza. It's in an excellent location if you are coming from the train station - a two minute walk and there are plenty of cafe's and shops in the vicinity. I am a Priority Club member so I was a bit disappointed that I was unable to have free access to the club lounge but it didn't spoil the stay. The hotel had lots of facilities and I was a frequent user of the business centre to check emails etc. The hotel is modern, rooms are clean and the staff are friendly so you really can't go wrong with this hotel. I am already planning my next trip back to Amsterdam for Summer 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Boring”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Pez
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night as the air conditioning was very loud and you couldn't open the windows so it was a bit like an airport hotel. The rooms were clean with a comfortable bed and pillows but the hotel itself was more suited for business purposes. Broadband and parking were expensive. Near the town centre but on a busy road.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Rogcar84
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Crowne Plaza City Centre, Amsterdam.Great position, close to the Central Station, shopping, attractions, etc. Beautiful suite,very clean modern Hotel. Great facilities and good food at the restaurant. All the staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful (including the management) who made our stay very memorable. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Once again our thanks to you all. Roger and Carolyn Graham. London

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: vendair
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Hotel was in a very good location. The hotel room was clean and the only problem we had was that the cleaners didn't seem to want to clean the cups after the first night and we had to wash the cups ourselves in the sink. We would say it was a little expensive and considering what we paid per night we think breakfast should have been included in the price. Would also have been good to have free wifi in the room But other than that we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: The_Travel_G0ddess
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a central location. Close to the central train station and walking distance to many sights. Disappointed in the addtional high cost for internet access but there is a business center where you can use a computer.

Reviews.Title: “EFFICIENT, PROFESSIONAL AND SUPERBLY RENOVATED”
Reviews.Author: SimonInSudbury
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for city breaks a few times already, but having not been able to visit last year, I was stunned by the extent of the renovation which has happened when I arrived for my 4-night stay last week. Whilst the old decor was more than acceptable, the look today could not be more far removed. I suspect that an African theme runs through some of the changes (specifically in the "Living Room" and my own room), but however it has been conceived, the result is stunning. There is without doubt a 21st century feel to this hotel now, and the quietness of the public areas stood out tremendously. The old Dorrius restaurant is now known as the Queen of Holland Room, and I suspect opens for special functions only. The Dorrius Brasserie which was only open for breakfast and lunch is now renamed The New Dorrius, and all meals are served here. This is also where the bar is located. The seating area outside the old bar is now a "Living Room" with a very large seating area with low tables in the middle, and an artificial-flame fire across the width of the area. There are also some seats around the perimiter. On the far wall is an extensive bookshelf, complete with a selection of books to read (many were in Dutch). The small gift shop by the main lifts which also sold daily newspapers is a casualty of the changes, and is no longer there. My room was excellent. Large, and very well appointed. Crucially, and this is the fantastic attention to detail which this hotel pays it's guests, there is a range of international plug sockets available on the desk in the room (in my room at least), so that if you should forget your plug adapter, you need not worry when visiting this hotel. I ate breakfast in the New Dorrius. This has not changed from the offering in the past which I am pleased about. The staff are as ever excellent, and once again I am pleased that some familiar faces still work there, given that staff turnover in many hotels is so high. It's clear that they are content to work in such a fabulous hotel, and their professionalism shines through. The hotel is located just 5 minutes walk from Centraal Station, but if you are looking to use the public transport system in the city, you would be very wise to read up on the new ticketing system now in exclusive use on the trams and buses. The ov-Chipkaart is the equivalent to the London Oystercard, and if used correctly is good value. No other form of ticketing is valid on GVB or Connexxions buses, and in the not-too-distant future this will also be the only acceptable form of ticketing on main line NS trains as well. There is a reasonable amount of construction work taking place around the station as there is a new North/South Metro line being built, but this does not affect the hotel in any way. In summary, my stay was as usual fantastic. Lovely room, beautifully comfortable bed and pillows, quiet room, even though it looked out onto the main road (I could only barely hear the trams outside, but not once did I have any problem getting to sleep, nor did I get awakened by noise outside). The staff were great and the service thoroughly efficient and professional. I can't wait to get back again, but this time I will not leave it so long before doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location - central but quiet”
Reviews.Author: Scot17
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel. Stayed here for 2 nights in October for a short city break and although hotel was busy with business travellers, did not feel out of place for leisure stay, and room was nice and quiet. Very central - 5 mins walk from Centraal station and close to all the main attractions, and far enough away from Red Light District. Lovely restaurant, quite expensive, but excellent food. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... And here are some hints and tips”
Reviews.Author: AVeryEnglishGent
Reviews.Content: As priority club members, it made sense for us to use our points towards our 3 night stay in Amsterdam. We have never visited the city before and were really looking forward to our visit. This was our anniversary and was a special surprise for myself. My partner had emailed ahead of our visit to the hotel to let them know of the special occasion. Sadly this is where the hotel lost points. I am not saying they had to do anything special. however, every other time we have had a special occasion in one of the same chain of hotels, they have gone out if their way to acknowledge the occasion (the park lane in London even included an upgrade on the room and nibbles and drinks) Again, not vital in the end. Always a nice touch though. More importantly, the position of the hotel is just minutes away from the central station. We didnt have the hotel breakfast due to their being so much choice around the area. A tip I will give for anyone wanting a nice place to sit and snack in the morning. If you come out of the hotel, cross to the next street adjacent. Walk down past the "gays and gadgets" store and the Sid street on the right leads to a series of 3 or 4 canal ways. Not only I'd it a gorgeous picturesque walk, but also if you follow to the last canal junction and turn left towards the Anne Frank huis (house) there is a great cafe called roem on the right handside of the canal. Great staff and great price. Try their club sandwich or even the scrambled eggs... Yum The location of the hotel is just fantastic for getting to the different quarters of the city. It's worth getting a hop on hop off canal bus pass outside the central station. If you walk to the bottom of the sane street you get dam square. Also, a nice expensive looking shopping centre on the righthand side. This houses the store called sissy boy (don't be fooled by the name). It's like an upmarket urban outfitters. Some nice clothing and bits for the home. Behind the hotel, is the main street that heads towards the citys centre dam square. And just next to that, is the red light district (wasn't my cup of tea) We found that for wi-fi access around the city. The coffee company chain was useful as they give you a code with each purchase for free wifi access. Some nice coffee aswell. We can't wait to go back again. Largely in part to the hotels service and positioning. As a final tip. A nice little restaurant was "seasons" which was about a a ten min walk from hotel towards the roem cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Used our free nights here and liked it very much!”
Reviews.Author: Tkids
Reviews.Content: We had a room overlooking the street and even though they were soundproof windows, you can somewhat hear the Tram, so bring ear plugs if you are light sleeper. Great location! Very friendly staff and professional. There are courtyard rooms, that might be an option for people looking for quiet rooms! I would stay here again! Short walk from the Central train station!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location- nice, large, upper-scale chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: scscientist
Reviews.Content: In mid-September 2010 spouse and I spent 3 nights here free on Priority Club points â€“ so I rated the value as excellent â€“ if I had to pay I probably would not. The location is superb - 1 block from Central Station, with multiple trams and buses on the street where the hotel is located. You can go anywhere in Amsterdam via public transit right outside the hotel door. Staff was excellent â€“ check in was quick â€“ the room was not ready (at 9 am â€“ surprise, surprise!) but were told to come back at noon â€“ and it was ready. Concierges were fonts of information and advice as was the desk staff. Inside the hotel you would not know you were in Amsterdam (except there are people speaking Dutch, of course) â€“ it is a big, upscale chain hotel â€“ you might be in any place in the world where there is a Crown Plaza. So the hotel is not a â€œDutchâ€� experience â€“ but it is immaculately clean, with amenities (free internet access in business center), pool, spa, exercise room and a very nice restaurant/bar. We did not eat there â€“ because there were so many restaurants in the immediate vicinity. So if you do not need a â€œDutchâ€� hotel experience â€“ previously we stayed in small canal side hotels and that was very nice â€“ this is a very nice and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just had a very pleasant stay. The staff...”
Reviews.Author: dkracerfl
Reviews.Content: Just had a very pleasant stay. The staff is professional and attentive. Arrived in the early morning, no room was ready. But instead of having to ask the staff found me in the lounge within 30 minutes and handed me my key. That is attention to detail and customer service you just cannot find everywhere. The rooms are clean. Everything worked well. I think that as a very frequent traveler the folks at Crowne Plaza could learn from Marriott and Starwood and let their gold level customers have free use of their club lounge. But alas they do not, and this is a competitive disadvantage. If I had a longer stay I would probably take issue with this but on a quick overnight with an early departure it was worth taking advantage of a lower nightly rate than at the Rennaissance where the lounge would be free as a Marriott gold elite customer. In the end, a fine property right by Central Station making it a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in City Centre - Clean and Beds are Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: julieeandrews
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. We were a walk-in reservation after finding the original hotel we'd booked just too awful to stay in. (See Hotel Ben) Front desk staff went out of their way to assist us in booking tours, making dinner reservations, etc. We had a superior room the first night and a Club Room for the second. We had room 203 the first night and it was great, room overlooking the street with great views and not too noisy. Bed was really comfortable and the room was very clean. We loved it. The Club Room was 501 and the layout wasn't as organised but the bed was even better if possible. The bathrooms were immaculate and our only issue was that both times we had to call housekeeping to get an extra towel and robe as there was only one both times. There really isn't any difference room wise between the superior and Club but with the Club we had access to the club lounge which is heaven. Key card access only, complimentary drinks and breakfast. Internet access and a nice place to watch the morning news and read a paper before heading out into the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam. Highly recommend ! Also, hotel is in a central part of town with some unique shopping close by.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better for a Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: twotencents
Reviews.Content: To me, this is your typical business hotel. The staff very polite but not overtly friendly, concierge and front office staff gave adequate information to get you to your location but do not venture any extra info. For a hotel under the Crowne Plaza, I found this disappointing. The greats â€“ location. It is close to the city center, tram etc but far away enough to be out of the â€œcrazinessâ€� and noise. Room was not huge but not as small as other hotels in Amsterdam. Nicely decorated with renovated bathrooms. I got a room on the second floor and was expecting it to be noisy due to street noise etc but it was pleasantly quite. This was due to the location as well as the insulation of the windows. The not so great â€“ Only had breakfast in the hotel (as this was provided for in the rate) â€“ not too great on variety, same thing everyday, got quite tiresome after the 3rd day. Only had wireless internet in the room; good connection but if you wanted to link up your iphone or a second device they expected you to pay for the second connection. For some reason they donâ€™t display all the standard toiletries that you find in most hotels in the bathroom expect for the shower gels. They wanted you to call housekeeping for the items. With the number of frills they put on the bed, it would have been nice if they had a turndown service especially to refresh the towels etc. Would I stay there again ??â€“ for business, maybe but for leisure, no.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to our return”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOf4_SEPT_2010
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Crowne Plaza (check out today - 3rd Sept).....I travelled with my wife and two young children (2 year old and a 10 month old)......would absolutely return. We paid a little extra and were able to avail of their Club Lounge - which was great when we had two young children with us...we couls have our breakfast there knowing we weren't disturbing other guests and we had wine, tea, coffee, beer on tap ! ALmost felt like we were stealing it! But it was all inclusive! The room wasn't massive but was enough...they had a lovely travel cot all made up upon our arrival and always had the bins emptied, fresh towels in the bathroom and beds made by the time we'd return from breakfast! The hotel is perfectly located. Literally a 2 mins walk away from the main square and most of the major attractions. The concierge there will happily book tours on yourr behalf if you wish. We were very happy with our stay and with the service we received. When we saw some of the other hotels in Amsterdam we were soooooooo happy we picked the Crowne Plaza !

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stopover”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowSpud
Reviews.Content: Stopped over in Amsterdam on the way back to the UK from Asia. The hotel has a very good location within waking distance of most of the places you want to see. We found Amsterdam to be really good city to explore on foot although a canal trip is also pretty much a must. Rooms are not huge but the hotel seems to have been recently renovated and both the bedrooms and bathrooms are well appointed. Front desk staff were helpful in getting us into a room since we came in on a very early flight and really wanted to freshen up. Concierge were also informative and helpful in giving us tourist information. Must admit that we did not really use any of their food and beverage outlets as there are plenty of other eating places to explore. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU WANT WINDOWS THAT OPEN”
Reviews.Author: cpvanlee
Reviews.Content: Might sound trivial, but most hotels in Amsterdam, especially at this price range, have windows that open. Most windows in this hotel do not. Even though the hotel was renovated recently, including the air conditioning system, it was a poor design. After checking with the front desk and the engineer that came to our room, you CANNOT leave the fan on manual for circulation. Rather, it automatically shuts on and off based on the temperature desired. While that parked worked well, during the first night, my son and I woke up several times with stale, uncirculated air, because the system would not cycle on, even though the temperature was good. If that is not an issue for you, then I would recommend this hotel because it is in a great central location. The breakfast is outrageous, at 25 Euro. You can do much better at the many local restaurants with less than a five minute walking distance. Staff is so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Room, Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jasonuz
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it is just Amsterdam, but the staff at this hotel were the most unfriendly of any property I have stayed at in recent memory. I'm a happy guy - but no smiles at this place. The front office staff could not be bothered, housekeeping kept throwing away our personal toiletry items (I finally got that issue solved), and the restaurant were not there to service the customer. I should point out that I stay 60+nights at Holiday Inn properties every year and have been a Platinum with them for about 5 years running. All that being said, one cannot argue with the location of this property. As the name suggests, it is literally in the city center. The weather was pleasant (not hot at all) so we walked everywhere. I highly recommend the Chinese restaurant across the street. Contrary to the hotel, the staff at the restauarant want you to eat there! The owner of the restaurant actually told me that quite a few clients at Crowne Plaza express the same frustrations about the service and prefer to eat at his restaurant. Now that should tell the Crowne Plaza something. Also - the rooms at this hotel are EXCELLENT! Granted, i only stayed in one room (obviously) on the club floor. But, if that is any indication of the quality of the rooms hotel-wide, then I recommend the hotel as long as you are an independent traveler and can deal without staff assitting. Also - if you are a Platinum holder, don't expect an upgrade! Even though I know there were rooms available (I sneakily asked housekeeping) they refused to upgrade us. I am working with Priority Club now to get an answer to that one. They assured me they would be dealing with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: PQrev
Reviews.Content: A good standard hotel with modern facilities and good rooms. The location is excellent, a few minutes walk from the railway station and when your there the key sites like Anne Franks house are all within walking distance. Staff are pleasant but it is a busy hotel so checkout can take some time. Breakfast is in the restaurant and is OK but the room is relatively small and can be crowded at peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Crowne Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FirstTraveller60
Reviews.Content: Booked a junior suite for 3 nights over the weekend. Arrived at reception at 17:45 on the Friday only to be told room was not ready yet. Check in supposed to be from 15:00. Room finally ready at 18:20. Room booked for 2 people however, only towels, etc for 1. This corrected after a call to reception - twice! Housekeeping not good. No top up of coffee, tea, sugar etc and we had to keep asking for some everyday. This hotel is not cheap but being a Crowne Plaza I am normally prepared to pay for the service that chain normally provides. What really annoys me is when I don't get the service I am paying for and we didn't get that service at this particular establishment. Most experienced travellers will know that Amsterdam anyway is expensive and a bit of a rip-off and this hotel ensures that it "gets in there first" with their additional charges and poor service. I most certainly do not recommend this place and if you are looking for a good place to stay in Amsterdam City I woud suggest looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Like a BMW, basic model reasonably priced, but go for the extras ....”
Reviews.Author: sam19771977
Reviews.Content: Good: - Clean - Spacious room - Central location - Big TV - Nice bathroom - Nice lounge Bad: - THE most unrealiable useless WIFI connection I have ever experienced. It literally has a mind of its own. Staff on front desk, rather than admit they don't know the problem give useless waste of time advice. I endured this for 8 days. Asked for partial refund due to my known complaints - REFUSED. - WIFI is eye wateringly expensive. The other hotel I use here on business the IBIS over the road is Euro 3 per day, Crowne Plaza is 20 - how on earth do they justify this for such a useless service?! - Staff very smart and many of them but they are stuck up, like they thing they are better than the guests! They just have that way of looking at you .... creepy - Room service quick but again very expensive and unimaginative menu - Breakfast - Euro 25. Come again? How on earth can they justify that for a bowl of melon and a glass of juice. I had it twice - nice but price is just stupid. In summary - great hotel, price is reasonable - my company chose it because for the period I stayed it was just cheaper than IBIS - but eat anything, use internet, touch anything and its way over priced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Single (Black) Female Travelers”
Reviews.Author: tadpole1995
Reviews.Content: I will say this, the hotel was very lovely with attractive amenities. The price was a bit more than I'd usually spend, but no higher than any similarly starred hotel in a similar area. This is where my compliments of this hotel end. The trouble started as soon as I walked in and was practically ignored by the front desk clerk. It was busy but when I finally reached the desk, unlike every other guest, the smile immediately left his face. I was given curt info and directions to my room. After a long train ride from another country I really just wanted to stay in the hotel and grab a drink, so I went to the bar thinking it would be no big deal, right? It was a nice bar and I will say that the bar tenders were friendly enough, but I'd barely sat down and finished half my drink before an official member of the hotel staff started lurking around my area casting suspicious glances my way. As I was literally taking my last sip he had the nerve to come right up to me and ask me, in way that suggested he was more like hoping, if I was leaving. Having endured the discomfort of his hovering (and the absurd cost of the drink in the first place) I decided, yes I would be leaving. Thank goodness I only wasted one night here...they apparently assume all single (black) females are prostitutes or something worse. I highly recommend Chic and Basic instead. It's cheaper, has better views, MUCH friendlier staff, and less stuffy clientÃ¨le.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Sparky0121
Reviews.Content: Flying into Schipol airport we decided to catch the train to Amsterdam Central. The hotel is extremely close and within 5 minutes walking. The hotel is really upto date with it's decor and well appointed rooms and extremely comfortable. Great location to all sights and would recommend this hotel and would stay here again. . .

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Perthi
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and practical hotel. No luxuries. Good rooms, central and good breakfast But the waitresses tend to organise the tables for lunch before guests finish their breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, well laid out & in great location.”
Reviews.Author: pjohnuk
Reviews.Content: I normally get to stay in Airport hotels in Amsterdam but decided to stay in the centre this time. Although meant I had to travel further for meetings the "down time" compensates as hotel is few minutes walk from the principal canals and some great restaurants and bars. Hotel has recently been remodeled and although a bit "minimalist" in design in places very comfortable. The room was very well laid out ..with excellent desk and connections for PC etc . Only criticisms would be the bathroom which was a bit small and my perennial hate with the big chains ....the cost of WiFi connection , which I had to pay for twice, once for PC & again for iPhone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gajoma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2009 and again in December. We couldnt fault it at all. Refurbishment was taking place in July and when we returned in December it was completely finished. And what a transformation! Hotel was beautiful and spotlessly clean. Rooms were excellent. We were on the club floor which gave us access to the executive lounge. Breakfast was plentiful and varied and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location could not have been better, being only a short walk from the train station and with many good restaurants within walking distance. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to be”
Reviews.Author: zeeshankarimi
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, i am travelling with 2 childrens 6-8 years and they loved the place, nice hotel, nice staff and the best thing is the location, it is close to everything, it is expensive but if u are travelling once a year and if its yr first time to amsterdam then go a ahead and book it. Try to be on the club floor they are cheaper in a way thay free access to club lounge , free internet access and lot more. I love it, my children locves it, ofcourse remember this is europe dont expect lavish large rooms, line of attendents.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Anny56
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel five times and would not consider staying anywhere else when in Amsterdam. Excellent location, close to all amenities, friendly staff and excellent to have pool facilities in a city centre hotel. The only problem I had was the the decor of the hotel was slightly old however I have been informed that the hotel has been refurbished since my last visit and the pictures look very nice. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Should be better than #70 don't believe the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: BeerinDaJacuzzi
Reviews.Content: First of all please it's ridiculous to have to defend a hotel but are most of my fellow travelers used to old, disgusting, dirty, 18-19th century furnishing just because they don't want to be in a modern "sterile" setting? Ridiculous! People please don't believe any of the other reviews hating on this hotel. THE GOOD: 1. Clean. I mean the entire hotel. Yes it was modern, sterile, no funky "Amsterdam" or old architecture but no dust, mildew, bugs or other garbage associated with "funky" hotels. 2. Large rooms 3. Plasma TV 4. Plenty of storage space 5. In-room safe easy to operate 6. Plenty of outlets 7. Hairdryer 8. Coffee/tea/biscuits/chocolate/shampoo/soap with additional upon request 9. Prompt housekeeping calls 10. Staff that respects Do Not Disturb sign 11. Ice machine 12. Large bathroom with removable massage showerhead 13. Seemingly comfortable queen bed with feathered down style bedding 14. A free bottle of sparkling water 15. Business centre with internet computers and printers (free) 16. Excellent location 17. Free umbrellas for use (during a rainstorm ugh) 18. Allowed late check out 19. Luggage room for storage prior to departure 20. Fitness room (did not use) THE BAD: 1. Only 1 bottle of sparkling water 2. Internet prohibitively expensive, only 2 business centre computers and one was offline most of the time along with a busted printer 3. Broken umbrellas 4. Plane departed 17:20 checkout only allowed up to 12:30 5. Few other perks or amenities such as a jacuzzi Much nice than the near-by Inntel (formerly Golden Tulip). I stayed at the Inntel not long ago and I will insist that the Crown Plaza is a cleaner, nicer version of the Inntel. Cannot fathom why this hotel is rated #70 when it should easily be #20. Is it the lack of cheap Internet? Use the business centre. If you want to sit in the hotel room and use cheap internet go somewhere else. If you want a free mini-bar go to Grand Amrath. Looking for luxury go to the Intercontinental. Want a funky old bed and breakfast then go to one of the locations rated 1-10. Need a cheap place then stay outside of the centre or in a hostel. This is your typical modern newly refurnished and redecorated US-style Holiday Inn but a Crown Plaza with a little extra such as a nice living room with television and bar/food service for example...but the hotel is not cheap as most things in Amsterdam are not cheap. In the US though you would be paying half the price for a night but I am pretty sure it is because of the expensive nature of Amsterdam city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Pau109
Reviews.Content: Just spent a night at the Crown Plaza, Amsterdam and were very impressed indeed. Our welcome was excellent with friendly and very helpful, happy staff. They even offered to take our luggage, which is a nice difference to many other hotels in the area. The foyer is large and clean with an odd bar area that is part of the adjacent restaurant. The hotel really could do with a separate bar area. Our room was clean and well appointed. I did think it was a little small though. The bathroom was also small but clean and with a few toiletries. It could do with a few more complimentary soaps and shampoos etc. The bed was large and comfy with plenty of clean blankets. The TV was a good size and had loads of channels to choose from. The complimentary bottle of water was a nice touch, particularly considering the temperature outside. We didn't try the Dutch restaurant as the food didn't seem very attractive and the price was well over the top. There was however an excellent Chinese restaurant across the road, albeit a little expensive too. The hotel lacks a pool however there is a good sized gym and a sauna. In terms of location, the hotel is a few minute walk from Central Station and in an area between the main road and the neighbouring shopping district. It was a little noisy with passing trams and cars etc, but don't let this put you off. Everywhere was a short walk, and in terms of location, we really couldn't fault it. I have stayed in several Amsterdam hotels and I would say this is the best so far. The Moevenpick is on a par however it is located a little too far out of town for my liking. For a decent four star hotel, you really can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great location, but no smoking”
Reviews.Author: BBuffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night each on either ends of our trip elsewhere. Each time the staff was efficient and friendly and after arriving form overseas flight it was nice to be able to check in early too. And, upon return, we couldn't check in early but we could drop our luggage while we went out an saw the sights. That is VERY nice. Also, they gave us free water in the room and we could purchase public transport tickets from the concierge. There was wi-fi available for ~7 Euro/ 1 hour. Steep but they know you need it so they can charge it. I am used to free wi-fi in the US at hotels so it is hard for me to pay for it in Europe. However, we did find some restaurants over there that had free wi-fi so keep checking at each place you eat/drink. The rooms were very nice as were the bathrooms. And, I was worried about noise, but the rooms were very quiet. We stayed here because we could use my husband's points and they treated us just as well as, if not better than, paying customers - they were really nice. However, because I am a smoker, if we would have had to pay for the room, we would have gone to smoke-friendly hotel with one or two rooms set aside for smokers. As it was, I had to go downstairs out the front door where all the traffic, pedestrians and trains were to smoke. Lots of people looking at me in my pajamas, but, that's the sacrifice I made for free room. It was mostly worth it. We never tried the restaurant - out and about too early and late - but it is near all public transport, plus nice walk to Dam square, train station, good bars/restaurants - great location! Overall, if you don't smoke, this is a great hotel. If you smoke and cannot find a smoke-friendly hotel, this would be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel, expensive WiFi”
Reviews.Author: ncalad
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in June. I liked the hotel overall but the internet costs 20 euros/24 hours which is very expensive. Some front desk staff were very efficient and helpful ... others were not. You don't start helping a guest, then tell them to hold on while you deal with some paperwork and have a conversation about some other guest's mini-bar. I room was nice but the bathroom was chopped in half by the front wall of the hotel Avoid rooms 120/220/320 etc. because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and modern rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: felipegonzal
Reviews.Content: I spent some days at crown plaza 2 weeks ago and it served us good when we explorde the city or went to the beach. The hotel is mored geared towards business traveler but the location is veryclose to the city center and the main station so it served us perfectly.
