The room was nice and quiet, but I think I received an upgrad from the standard room I booked due to my status. We had a medical emergency and when we asked for a pharmay, the HSE-manager was called and he helped us find a doctor specialized on expats and tourists. It was very professional. On the other side I would consider the hotel to be very personnal, but it's nicely and modern decorated. I would definitly recommend the hotel if you are looking for a sure choice where to stay in central Amsterdam. Be aware as the red light district and the coffee shops are spread out all over the center.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC - TOUCH COSTLY THOUGH”
Reviews.Author: deveshm
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 days between May 13-15 with my wife and infant son. The hotel lives up to its brand in very sense - very comfortable, suitably located and a touch costly. The single biggest quality for me was the location. It is situated minutes from the main train station and very very close to all the night hotspots. Famous or infamous RLD is just 5 minutes walk. We had timed our trip for the Tulip gardens and found the pick up point for bus just 2 minutes away. There are lots of restaurants close by providing a delicious and cheap alternative over eating in the hotel. The lounge area of hotel has a fantastic seating place and has a soothing feeling. We enjoyed our drinks there for all 3 evenings. Very good and cosy place to stay with almost all the amenities. Only complain was that the rooms are slightly smaller. However this may be due to the very high cost of real estate in the place that it is located.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Battota_AA
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in June. It was before the world cup start... I'll summarize our stay in few points: - it's located in the city center... GREAT - walkable from the Central station (Hbf), about 5 to 7 min - the neighbourhood is so Alive with all the shops, resaurants & cafes - large beds, however, the matress & the pillows were very soft - AC was very good - big flat screen TV with a good variety of English channels - there was a safe - there was a refigirator, however, it wouldn't open and we didn't ask for help - bathroom had all suffiecient stuff... however, i would prefer if they use liquid soap

Reviews.Title: “Great location/excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DDKW
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Perfect location in the heart of Amsterdam. Rooms and service were excellent. Recommend purchasing tourist passes from concierge as you avoid lineups at attractions with these pre-purchased passes at no extra cost. ie Van Gogh museum etc

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: EssexLove2travel
Reviews.Content: We spent Saturday night at the Crowne Plaza with two other couples. The hotel is furnished to a very high standard with excellent facilities. The location couldn't be better. Just a few minutes from the train station and very central to all attractions. We love the Jordaan area and found it the best place to eat and drink. This is our second visit to Amsterdam. We love the atmosphere and the friendly dutch people and will definitely return again, hopefuly

Reviews.Title: “Great location. New, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Roberto_MJ
Reviews.Content: If you want location, its right in downtown, but very quiet. Rooms are big. Windows dont open, but it didn't seem to bother. Shower is great. Staff is very helpful. Good value. Good food in room service. Dont bother getting a taxi or tram from Central station. Its just 5 min walking or less. Good internet in the TV system for a reasonable price considering the convinience. You dont have to carry a notebook or go downstairs

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: feef0101
Reviews.Content: Overall nice clean hotel in a great location. You are close to some great places to eat and some great places to drink. Also close to many different coffee houses.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: b00b00hunns
Reviews.Content: When me and my wife reached Amsterdam we booked at the Renaissance Hotel which is the next bulding accross crown plaza. I was given reward points for an OFFER price only to find out on that day that my reward points wasn't enough and got rejected from the offer given which was only notified on the day of arrival! this was a huge bump and i was furious because its a weekend so alot of the rooms were booked or have to pay the price which was 250 euros! My good willing clever wife said we should for another hotel because she said its ridiculous! which i completely agreed on! we went hotel hunting and went in to CROWN PLAZA hotel! we looked at the loby have this feel of comfort welcoming immidiately staff approached us if we needed some assistance! thumbs up for me! we enquired for a room and given a good price especially for the week in AMSTERDAM we thought about it for a few minutes comparing other hotels! We took Crown Plaza on! is that feeling you get yes i will come back to this hotel again. the room was great clean stylish and the bed was a very comfortable bed! everything was good and we had a blast! check it out and you will know what i mean! And the Location IS 5 MINUTES FROM EVERYWHERE!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghTimbergirl
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the crowne plaza over the queensday weekend and everthing was just perfect;we arrived early morning just after 9 and expected to just leave our bags,but our room was ready,we also requested a late checkout so didnt have to leave until 2pm,we have stayed here 3 times now and always came away happy.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good for work trips, close to old town”
Reviews.Author: thoroughlygood
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really comfortable, the mattresses firm and the pillows really comfy. The bathrooms feel a bit special - shower could have been a little more powerful but still it was pretty good. My room rate didn't include breakfast - be warned breakfast here will set you back 25 Euros where a pastry from a nearby bakery will be no more than 4 Euros. What breakfast I did have in the hotel wasn't all that stunning. Certainly not worth the 25 Euros. That said, the staff are very helpful. I had a problem with the air conditioning which was fixed within a few hours (and a note left on my door telling me the work had been done). Doorman service was very good too. Very close to the old town. Most decent stuff in Amsterdam - the old town stuff - is nearby, no more than 15-20 minutes walk down canalsides etc. So it's well placed to the tourist stuff and various other eateries. Very close to the train station too. About 20 minutes in a taxi from Schipol airport. I'd probably not stay here if I was having a break in Amsterdam (I'd prefer something with a bit more charm overlooking canals etc) but otherwise it's a goodun. Internet access charges are an absolute crime - 20 Euros for 24 hours or 7 Euros - but there is free internet access in the business centre in the basement. It's a bit small but it suffices. Restaurant was quite good - lovely pea soup one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location a bit pricy”
Reviews.Author: LeahAKS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the last night of our vacation. After sleeping in tight quarters and small beds for two weeks, this was a welcomed change. The room and bathroom were spacious and clear. The location is great and within a 5 minute walk to Amsterdam Central train station (with a quick train ride to the airport). We were greeted by a relatively friendly staff who held our luggage while we explored the city. Breakfast was decent but overpriced for what it was. I would recommend this hotel but it could quickly be a budget breaker.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Couldn't stay anywhere better in Dam”
Reviews.Author: Sweet786
Reviews.Content: We went away for my partners birthday in dec 2009, sorry for the delay! This hotel is brilliant!! We got there at about 12.20am and the staff were very professional. And the service they provide is fantastic! This hotel was lovely! They had a nice lounge area downstairs and its very peaceful there. I came downstairs one night when i could get to bed and just sat there going through the books they had on the shelfs. No one bothered me, it was great! Room: Lovely roomy bedroom, The beds were the most comfortable beds I have now slept in! We got there on the night of my partners birthday and it was snowing outside, freezing! But the rooms were very comfortable and warm. They provide a bathrobe and slippers, nice touch! Toiletries in the bathroom and a safe in the cupboard. Large flatroom tv wall mounted. Ice box and ice machine on every floor. They had lots of hot drinks stacked up everyday on our return from our day sight-seeing which was very nice as it was very cold and you would need to return back to the hotel for a warm drink. Food: We ordered food the first night, room service was quite expensive but then again for a 4 star hotel, its what you would expect. I tried to order a dessert with a candle, they didnt have a candle so i still ordered hima birthday treat and was pleasently sprised to see his dessert said happy birthday written on the plate.. very sweet! Bathroom: Very clean and tidy, spacious and good powerful shower with lots of hot water! Location: This hotel is in a fantastic location, i couldnt believe how lucky we were when i booked the holiday. so close to everywhere you need to be!! Honestly if your going to Amsterdam and want somewhere nice to stay... Stay here! You wont be disappointed. If I ever come back to Amsterdam I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel looks great, staff was decent as well.”
Reviews.Author: HumanRover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights, overall it was a pleasant stay. Room was a good size compared to other local hotels. There is a tram stop by hotel which is convenient. Although if you've been to Amsterdam you know you will end up walking the whole time. So i would definitely stay a this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for business traveler.”
Reviews.Author: steve375
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch Crown Plaza. I am staying here this week for a trade show at the RAI. It is a short walk to Amsterdam Central Train Station. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are large, clean and comfortable. I strongly recommend this hotel for anyone. I saw many United Airlines people here. So they also consider it a great hotel..

Reviews.Title: “new hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: sbwsbw
Reviews.Content: great stay, the loughe should have more to offer. the restaurant is not the same standard as before.

Reviews.Title: “absolute paradise”
Reviews.Author: PATJORDAN
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Crowne Plaza 5 years ago and thoroughly enjoyed it. This was our first trip to Amsterdam since then and we were delighted with the standard of the recent refurbishment. We had booked a Club room and it was superb. The club lounge is now on the ground floor and is also very good: a good selection of drinks and snacks is available all day with a nice breakfast in the morning.After a few hours exploring Amsterdam, it was a pleasure to return to ther hotel, deposit shopping in the room and relax in the lounge with a cold beer. My only gripe was that we could not access the movies in our room. This was found to be due to a technical issue and we were moved to another room. Not just any room but a suite...the duty manager said it was the least he could do for us. Now if that isn't an example of excellent customer service, what is? Many other hotels could learn from this Crowne Plaza. Any members of staff we encountered were very pleasant indeed. Locationwise, the hotel is minutes away from Centraal Station, Trams, shops; it's hard to beat for this alone. An excellent hotel to which we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TeresaPhila
Reviews.Content: great hotel, walking distance from train station!!!! hotel was under construction, so a little noisy. The new room were Plush compared to the old style rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good ammenities for club level”
Reviews.Author: mollypollywog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights on vacation, the location was superb. We enjoyed the free lounge with snacks, drinks and a very nice continental breakfast, as well as the internet which comes with club level. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, food and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: amanda879
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the 3 nights I spent at this hotel. Even though it was the first time I had been there, my family and I were treated like old costumers. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms, recently refurbished, were very clean and quite spacious. The Dorrius restaurant offers a great food. They have the best hamburger Iâ€™ve ever tried. The location is great. It only takes you 10 minutes to get to Dam Square. The hotel was a bit expensive but definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Another qaulity stay with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: petrol1967
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my partner last weekend and I must say, this Hotel is ideal for anyone who has not been to Amsterdam before. The location is ideal for you to navigate the city on foot, with everything close by Red Light District 5 min walk, Dam square 5 min walk, Centraal station 5 minute walk. When we arrived at reception, as a Platinum Ambassador Priority club member we were upgraded into a club room with free access to the club lounge where we had a free breakfast and drinks throughout the day (only used it for breakfast) Staff were polite and courteous and always smiling which is a very positive aspect when staying away. We will not make this our last trip to the Crowne Plaza, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel - this hotel understands customer loyalty”
Reviews.Author: Frequent Traveller from Scotland
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times. And whilst I have written about other hotels in the InterCon stable that do not value customer loyalty (CP Republique in Paris, CP Kensington in London as examples) this one (like the Hamilton CP in Washington, DC) really, really get it. First, the hotel. Great location. 5 minutes to the Central Station (why do the rail authorities in Holland seek to gouge visitors with their machines - many don't take cash and will not take UK chip and pin debit cards, so you have to pay a 25%, that's not a typo, surcharge to use a credit card!) Lots of shops, bars all close by. Really warm welcome from the staff, who welcomed me back. Even tried to get me the same room as I stayed in before. All the rooms I have stayed in recently have been refurbished to a high standard. Great beds, nice bathrooms, flat screen TV's and great chair for working at the desk in the room. Given access to the new club lounge. Sadly, they have moved it from the top floor with the views over the Amsterdam rooftops, but the new one is nice and cosy. Great selection of drinks, snacks and internet access. The hotel has ibann as the internet provider, so if you use Boingo for global roaming you can easily get online. To prove my loyalty point, and I hope the hotel read this. I was travelling with colleagues who are in other loyalty programs. Because of my previous good experience here, they opted to go with my choice of hotel. So, they got 4 extra room nights off the back of that. Plus, I have just rebooked for another couple of nights next month. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location - Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: argylllassie
Reviews.Content: We were part of group of 8 staying the long weekend here and we all appreciated the close proximity to the railway station. The hotel has been recently refurbished and the rooms were clean and comfortable with safe, mini bar (expensive and no room to store your own drink) and an iron and ironing board. Two friends were celebrating their wedding anniversary during the trip and when this was mentioned at check in they were upgraded to a larger clubroom! Did not eat in the hotel but can heartily recommend Ankara, a Turkish restaurant opposite the hotel - food and service excellent and prices reasonable. We also ate in Humphreys, which was nice, and in Teppenyaki Nippon - expensive but a great fun night with lovely food! Can recoomend "Breakfast, Lunch,Dinner" - a cafe opposite hotel for breakfast - friendly service and tasty breakfasts and at around 9 euros a lot cheaper than hotel buffet! I would stay here again and would have no trouble in recommending both the area and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience for Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: WISEWOMANBrussels
Reviews.Content: We shared our 17th Anniversary on 13 Feb 2010 at this newly renovated and beautiful hotel. The staff was very helpful; the Club Lounge was a nice treat included in the roomrate which gave a free breakfast (juices, coffee, fresh sliced cold cuts and breads, cereal etc..) in the afternoon there was complimentarty sodas, wine and beer available. The television was set to be watched in several languages including English and the club room we had came with free internet as well. There was a nice gym/workout area with separate saunas for the men and women, which we never used because we were too exhausted from our day and nightlife events we didn't get any gym time in. Location of the hotel was a 5 to 7 minute walk to the train station. Our bed was so comfortable, it was hard to get up in the morning. Upon our arrival, I shared with the staff member that we were celebrating our Anniversary and when we returned to our room the next day (which was our anniversary day) management had left a nice card and chocolates on our bed, wishing us many more years of happiness. I would definitely recommend this hotel to couples on a nice getaway. It is centrally located and easy to get to anywhere in Amsterdam. Though we walked to most of the sites we visited, the tram runs right in front of the hotel. And an added plus was, right outside the hotel was a McDonalds and a local Doner Kebap shop which stayed open til 4am; came in quite handy for the late night returns to the hotel. Our experience at this hotel was totally awesome, I would recommend it to others and will definitely stay there again. 3 nights (11 Feb til 14 Feb)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to the railway station.”
Reviews.Author: Zuerich_7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 2-night stay in this Amsterdamâ€™s hotel. It is located very close to the central railway station and a few tram stops from the city center. Hotelâ€™s staff were very friendly and helpful, they gave good restaurant advice, booked excursions for us, were nice in general. The room was quite standard, bathroom clean, tea and coffee making facilities provided in the room. Breakfast was not included in our room rate, so we ate in cafes close to the restaurant â€“ there are hundreds of them. Hotel is non-smoking, it was nice to enjoy our drinks in the bar without the cigarette smoke. There is a very small gym and a sauna, everything clean. The hotel has a decent restaurant and very cosy bar/lounge area. We were offered a free drink as Priority Club members. Iâ€™d say itâ€™s a good hotel both for sightseeing and for business meetings in Amsterdam, it was very special, but we cannot complain about anything either.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend - A great 4 star Hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: JimmyKLondon
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel. It was exceptionally clean, modern and centrally located. Also great value for money. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jajipoolu
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza, Amsterdam is one of the wonderfully located location in Amsterdam. It is close to the city centre and within walking distance to most of the site seeing locations. Also very close to the back waters where you can take a ride through canals of Amsterdam. The night life in Amstedam is very well known and this locational advantage of the hotel gives a chance to stroll around the place and be choosy. The tariff is on the higher side and can go higher during peak seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Life57
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean, quite new (apparently recently refurbished ). Rooms were large and modern. Staff was also ++ It is approprietly located if you are here for leisure (red district : 5-8 min walk) There was a bike rental business 100 meters away from the hotel, which is convenient to visit a town like amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: MrSpeyk
Reviews.Content: Traveling as a platinum premier club memebr seldom makes a difference, here it most certainly did. I booked with points, just a standard room, on arrival I was allocated a Jnr Suite and access to the club lounge. Shame I was only there for one night. The location is graet, right accross from the station and in easy walking distance of every kind of attraction you might require. Very friendly staff, all in all a most pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: benmychree
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 day break just before Xmas in Amsterdam. The hotel is in a brilliant location - you jump on the train at the airport, get off at the Central Station, and the hotel is literally about a 150 metre walk from there - no need for taxis, even with baggage. It was snowing and bitterly cold, but it was no problem even with the baggage. From the hotel it is a relatively easy and short walk to the city centre and all the main tourist attractions. The interior is modern and stylish. The room was not massive but it was ok. It was very clean, and as the hotel has been refurbished everything was in great condition. We didn't seem able to regulate the temperature too well, leaving the room very warm, especially at night. Staff were ok - not great but certainly not bad. Room service was way overpriced and not the greatest quality - recommend you avoid. Plenty of places nearby for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The hotel has a restaurant but we didn't use it. For winter visitors we recommend the Soup Kitchen, which is literally right opposite the hotel (see google maps street level). They do great soups and sandwich deals for about 5 Euros, just perfect when it was -6 celsius and icy outside! There is also a cafe called We R Bar and Food about 50 metres towards the station on the same side of the road. This does good but slightly pricey food, although there is free wifi. We would stay at the Crowne Plaza again as it was a decent price and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: jg1way
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, and a newly remodeled hotel (Sept 2009) with a fresh decor was wonderful for me. My three day trip was for shopping and sightseeing. Thanks to concierge Dave who recommended the Argentine steak house across the street. All the staff were excellent. Just one small issue I brought to managements attention is the privacy shade in the bath room, it isn't too private, but hopefully they will take action.

Reviews.Title: “a brill new year”
Reviews.Author: lmdavies33
Reviews.Content: very good, location just in the right place,5 mins from station and central to shops, nightlife and some really good coffee shops!Had a meal in the resturant quite pricey but the food was excellent and so was the service, it was nice to try some traditional dutch food i recommend the stimpy stampy(meatballs and mash potato).Stayed in a few hotels in amsterdam now,we will definately stay at this hotel again.thank you for a good trip!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and in the perfect location"”
Reviews.Author: LondonMonika
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel, just seconds from the train station(but not noisy) and in the main shopping area. 10 minutes walk to all "interesting" places and just 5 min walk to main square. Lovely deco, very spacious room and stuff very friendly.I would recommend this hotel to everybody. It is worth to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find!!!”
Reviews.Author: bgbigadventure
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the city and has been completely redone. It is a very contemporary style which is not my favorite, but it is very nice. The lobby living room area has a fantastic fireplace. Our room was a good size with nice amenities. There was plenty of working space and a good tv which actually had some English programs - a real treat in Europe. The bathroom was good sized as well. The hotel is a bit hard to find if you are driving as there is only a small space to pull in where you check in. We missed it the first time,and with Amsterdam's one way streets, getting back to the hotel was a challenge. Parking is very expensive, but there is valet parking, so we didn't have to maneuver in and out of the parking garage. The Priority Club facility was great,and the dining room in the hotel was very good food. We ate dinner there our first night as we didn't want to venture out. Staff all speak excellent English and are very friendly and helpful. The concierge has tickets for the museums. Close to good restaurants and shopping as well as the Tram to ride to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Amsterdam sets the standard for comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: Standby4321
Reviews.Content: We last visited this property several years ago and we were impressed with the level of service and the staff, as well as the club amenities. It's only become better with a top to bottom renovation. While many European travelers may be accustomed to making some concessions in the way of room size, amenities and overall comfort, none of that is necessary with this hotel. Guest rooms are spacious and well-appointed. The entire building is modern, despite having the historic charm of a centuries-old city right outside the front door. The location is especially good since it is within convenient walking distance of Amsterdam Centraal rail station, providing economical access to the airport and easy travel to other points throughout the Netherlands and beyond. We especially enjoyed the club room, which has been moved to the main floor and features a low-key breakfast that is satisfying nonetheless, along with snacks and complimentary beverages including soft drinks, coffee, beer and wine. Wi-Fi is available throughout the hotel and the club room features Internet access on two computers available for free use. There is also a business center. The front desk staff is unfailingly professional and courteous. Security is excellent. We give the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam our highest rating and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, unfortunate incident”
Reviews.Author: Afrodyte
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in January 2009, it has the best location, right in the centre of Amsterdam! From this hotel you are only a short walk away from anything worth seeing in the city. The rooms were clean and spacious and the facilities fantastic. They have a gym, spa and pool that are pretty much accessible 24/7. While I would recommend this hotel to anyone, unfortunately my brand new phone was stolen from the hotel by one of the cleaning staff, so that would be my only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyc_t08
Reviews.Content: Given our recent experience with hotels in europe our expectations were very low for this hotel. However, we were pleasantly surprised. This hotel is closer to the hotels in the US. We had a spacious clean room with good amenities. We were upgraded to a club room since our superior room was not ready so I am not sure what the size or amenities are in the non club rooms. The location is great -very close to the station but in a good neighborhood and within walking distance of all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & modern hotel , good central location near station”
Reviews.Author: sybiltheswan
Reviews.Content: Quite a dowdy hotel from outside but on entering I was pleasantly surprised. Modern foyer , friendly helpful staff. On arrival to our room , it hadnt been cleaned.We rang reception and our room was upgraded and we were granted free access to the club lounge ( private area with free drinks & snacks ) and they also included breakfast which was previously not included. We were thrilled ! Great location, we walked from the station. Central to all sights and close to a tram stop. Amsterdam is very expensive to eat and drink but so are most european cities. We had a great time though .We walked miles to explore . Ann Frank house worth a visit, also the Heineken museum was great. Wouldnt bother with canal cruise everyone looked bored sick on them ! Would use this hotel again and recommend it to you for your Amsterdam stay !

Reviews.Title: “Basic, good, 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: npog99
Reviews.Content: The hotel has completed its renovation. Rooms appear fresh and clean, the beds are very comfortable, there was no noise (our room faced the hotel entrance street), and it had all the standard conveniences. The bathroom was clean, well lit, with good quality towels, and enough room on the counter to store one's toiletries. The faucets function perfectly well, and both, the water temperature and pressure were excellent. The maid service was efficient and detailed in the restocking of all room amenities. However, the carpet was not vacuumed during the entire 5 day stay. Breakfast at the restaurant was nothing out of the ordinary. The buffet offered the staple scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, and some cooked vegetables; all of standard quality and fresh. Eggs to order were made behind the buffet line; not sure about pancakes or waffles). Juices were close to freshly squeezed, and good quality, but not the real thing (heartburn problems). The pastries seemed freshly baked, but not made from scratch as you would expect from a higher quality kitchen product. Fruit was scarce and not very tasty. Cereals were from individual boxes; no pre-made muesli. For two guys who rely on breakfast as one of the main two meals for a long day of walking, this breakfast did not do much. Restaurant service was very good: Attentive and helpful. I have to say that we did not asked for anything other than what was displayed on the buffet. The hotel lobby is modern, clean, and offers a feeling of an open, minimalistic space.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hsblendo
Reviews.Content: I was told I was in a newly renovated room - I'm not sure how recently - but the decor was very pretty, the bed extremely comfortable, and the room was overall an excellent place to return after a day of work (and often, keep working). The location is a convenient short walk to Centraal station, the red light district, and some decent food options. My experience with room service was not very good and the food was pretty poor. The restaurant in the hotel isn't great but was a good option after a long day. The bathroom was a tad cramped but had a good sized tub and excellent water pressure. I didn't use (or see) the fitness room but if/when I return for work, I'm glad to know they have one. My biggest complaint, I found the 20+ Euros per day charge for internet really ridiculous, and the business center computers were slow - and another guest advised that they quit out mid-task very often. The staff was friendly and overall this will be my "go to" hotel when I'm there on business again. It was very corporate/chain feeling hotel though, if you don't like that ambiance. For the amenities and the friendly staff, I definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it...”
Reviews.Author: ElkieW
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for four nights and we couldn't fault this hotel. The refurbishment was finished last month and everything is pristine. Staff were polite, friendly and helpful and we enjoyed being able to walk so quickly from the train station to the hotel and tfrom the hotel o the hustle and bustle of the city. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EamonK
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel for those visiting Amsterdam is absolutely perfect. 5 minutes walk from Centraal Station and located at the end of one of the shopping streets it couldn't be much more central. I stayed here two years ago but since then the rooms have been renovated and are much more of what you would expect from a four star hotel. Only minor downside was that the club lounge is no longer on the roof but is now on the ground floor and has a very sterile feeling to it.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Hel1982
Reviews.Content: This is a high standard hotel, and has been refurbished since I last stayed a year ago. A perfect base for both business and leisure, two minutes from Amsterdam Central train station.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing outstanding,room too hot.”
Reviews.Author: Wahaay
Reviews.Content: A rather bland hotel that benefits from an excellent location but on every night of our stay we were woken by the stuffiness of the rooms - they were too hot and the air-conditioning on full power and at the lowest temperature didn't do its job. The advertised hotel gym is actually a tiny room tucked away in the basement of the hotel with a ceiling so low I had to bend down to use the step machine. The staff were perfunctory but nothing more. Overall this hotel was just about worth the money we paid but it lacks any character and charm and there are much better options available in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Central to Everything”
Reviews.Author: dre35mm
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked to be recently renovated with a very modern lobby and internet access point. The rooms were excellent and had the most comfortable bed Iâ€™ve slept on in a while. The location of the hotel putâ€™s you in the middle of everything and is walking distance to almost everything youâ€™d want to see. Itâ€™s also conveniently located within walking distance to the train station and has a tram stop directly in front of it which lets you explore the city even faster. The only pitfall was that internet access in your room was very pricy so you had to compete with people surfing facebook in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly comfortable ... a little sterile”
Reviews.Author: Flankster
Reviews.Content: My initial response was negative. I checked into my room and found a pamphlet discussing the sleep expert Crowne had on staff whose tips and herbal/aromatherapy remedies were going to provide the greatest night of sleep ever ... as I listened to a jackhammer break up concrete on the front steps of the hotel. Fortunately, that was a fairly isolated incident. During my five day stay at the Crowne Plaza, I came to enjoy the comforts of my room. Though my window faced an interior courtyard/passageway, the trade-off was that there was no outside noise. I did sleep very well. The location is excellent. You can walk, take public transportation, or bike anywhere from the Crowne. The Hotel is a little sterile, and had the ambiance of a hospital (albeit modern). Because of my ability to sleep there, and its great location, I would stay there again for the right price. Broadband internet runs about $30 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy rooms, horrible beds.”
Reviews.Author: J123456789
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Holiday Inn free stays promotion. The hotel is smart, clean, efficient and superbly located. However, there are two show-stoppers:- The rooms have no ventilation. The windows do not open and the air-con recirculates the air in the room. There is no ducting of air from outside. They then have the gall to provide two bottles of potions designed to help you breath more easily! One is to spray on the pillow and one to spray up your nose. I don't think pharmaceuticals are a substitute for a small opener on the window. The beds are horrid. Hard, with springs that dig into you. They have attempted to ameliorate this by providing a mattress comforter but this is synthetic and combined with a synthetic quilt and stuffy room makes the bed very clammy. I've stayed in lots of Holiday Inns and can always rely on a comfortable bed. If only this Crowne Plaza used the same beds. Again they rub salt into the wound with an instruction leaflet on how to get a good nights sleep (go elsewhere). This hotel is nice with pleasant staff, but every Holiday Inn Express I've stayed at has been far more successful at providing somewhere comfortable to stay the night. Why pay these prices for no sleep?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tripplanner62
Reviews.Content: We spend 2 nights here and they were very enjoyable. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and the bed was fantastic. After 10 hours on the plane a king size bed with fluffy pillows was what we desperately needed. A little on the higher end of our budget but loved it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, fantastic hotel, big room”
Reviews.Author: dudeonwheels
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a wheelchair accessible room. Other than the bathroom door opening the wrong way, the room was perfect and spotlessly clean. Everything was brand shiny new after recent refurb. The bed was enormous, a true super king size and extremely comfortable. One of the biggest european rooms I've stayed in. The hotel has a wonderful modern designer lounge with a huge open fire - great place to sit and relax. All the staff were very helpful and polite. Being just a stone's throw from the centraal station it's hard to find a better location. A great 4+star hotel

Reviews.Title: “heat broken, no apologies...”
Reviews.Author: braved
Reviews.Content: when you check in, check if the heat works in your room immediately. this place is notorious for having non-functioning heat and AC

Reviews.Title: “Stop Searching! Book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_C
Reviews.Content: I'll try to keep it short and sweet... The hotel is PERFECT. Central to everything from shops, to Dam Square to coffee shops.. if you wanna give it a try. But be warned.. its much more potent than that stuff you tried at a party one time! Blows the head clean off you! :)-~ Very clean, very central, and is the best hotel I have stayed in for quite a while. Only small thing I could complain about, is at the time of writing, the hotel bar is still closed for renovations. But once thats done, it will be top notch. Will definately stay here again. Just a stroll down to Dam squre, where you could happily sit for HOURS with just a couple of drinks, and watch all the people and bikes go by. Chilled out city. I couldnt be bothered ever trying to beat this hotel for value, location and cleanliness. So stop searching for ages on trip advisor! This is the place to stay, wether you are a couple, a family or a group of friends. And Amsterdam has something for everyone. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Phone calls with or without will cost you a bundle”
Reviews.Author: ukmike8
Reviews.Content: Still a rip off. We spent 2 nights here. The location is great. But the plumbing is poor sometimes not enough water pressure to take a shower. The rooms are large perhaps 30 years old. The local phone call were a massive rip off, I paid over $100 for local or 800 calls. BEWARE. Lot of other smaller hotels in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “No worries with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireMirry
Reviews.Content: We have just enjoyed a short stay at the Crowne Plaza City Centre. Taking our 6 and 5 year olds with us. Its only a 5 minute walk from the bus stop and really easy to find. The hotel is central to almost everything and a tram ride to most sights. We were upgraded on arrival which was excellent, the room was large and very clean with a great bed . All the hotel seemed to be finished to a high standard, but was still undergoing building works. This didnt put us off and it will be great when its completed. The only down side was that there wasnt a lounge/bar to be able to have an evening drink in after you returned from a busy day. The breakfast was lovely with lots on offer and they made pancakes for the kids! The staff were really friendly and spoke excellent english. Although you could find cheaper hotels on offer, it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: elads
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza City Center in Amsterdam for one night - was wonderful. Not a single complain. Everything was just great. Highly recommended luxury hotel! Hope to be back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Antithasys
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while not the cheapest, was reasonably priced. It's location is excellent. Just two blocks from the Red Light District and five or six blocks from the Anne Frank House. If you have to train around, there is a train stop 1 block away, and central station is two blocks away. Both can give you easy access to Dam Square and other museums south. The staff was nice and spoke English well. The hotel was undergoing the last part of a renovation, so there was some construction noise early one morning, but I wouldn't expect that to last. Overall it was a very nice place to stay, but there are equally nice places down the street for $20 euros less and free internet and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh newly refurbished hotel in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lancs_Lizzy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the middle of the refurbishment when I arrived. This wasn't an issue as the work was being done during the day whilst i was out at work. The hotel is located in the centre, almost opposite the main railway station. There are plenty of retaurants and bars in the area. I had a refurbished room, it wasn't the biggest room I've stayed in but it was quite comfortable. It was well decorated and cosy. The only downside to the hotel was the lack of free internet in the rooms. The cost of internet access was extremely high. Higher than anywhere I've stayed. The hotel restaurant was ok and is advertised as one of the oldest in Amsterdam, this didn't really fit with the look of the refurbished hotel lobby and rooms though?

Reviews.Title: “This is THE place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: loli007
Reviews.Content: Yeah... Be careful were you use your ATM cards. Make sure it's in a reputable establishment. Great location, in walking distance of absolutely everything. Location was key! Had a security box to hide your important items like passport, jewelry and such. The bed was really comfy and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: ILove3Travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at the end of July. I was a bit worried about the work being done in the hotel, when I was in my room I could hear the distant hum of a drill for 10 minutes during the morning. Apart from that there were no problems. Room was spotless as you would expect in a Crowne Plaza Hotel. Staff were very helpful. As a solo traveler I felt very safe in the hotel. The hotel location is great, 5 minute walk to the central train station, 15 minute walk to Dam Square. I would highly recommend this hotel, when I go back to Amsterdam I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PinkLondon2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel has/still being renovated until september 2009. The new rooms are amazing, lovely purples and dark wood. The beds are massive and so amazingly comfortable! You could probably fit about 5 people in the bed its that big! It was our one year anniversay so i asked beforehand to have white wine, chocolates and a bowl of fruit in the room when we arrived. It was a lovely touch and it wasnt too expensive. amazing location, just 5 mins walk from the station. and a few mins walk to where the canal boat trips start. We went on the candlelight canal cruise, this was amazing and we would definatly do this again when we go back! There are lots of shops/restuarants nearby so its a very good place to stay but its quiet at night which is good. About 10 mins walk to the green light district, with coffee shops and bars. 15 mins walk to the red light district! We loved Amsterdam and would definatly go back and would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: enelym1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for two nights. Checked-in on Friday and leaving on a Sunday. The location is pretty good, almost across the street from the main station and at a walkable distance to the city main attractions. I did not see any construction works going on. The only things closed for renovation were one of the restaurant and the fitness area. My room was on the 5th floor with a view on the back of the hotel. It was quiet, a good size and newly refurbished. The bathroom was big and looked nice. LCD TV and mini-bar (extra charges) available as well as a kettle and complimentary coffee and tea. Wireless internet is at a pricey â‚¬20 for 24hrs! If you can, bring your own network cable and you will enjoy free wired Internet access. Staff was pretty friendly and polite. I will most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: pienadam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is indeed renovating, as some people have already mentioned, but it's looking stunning!!! I always use this hotel for my clients and they love it. All of them talk about the amazing beds. Haven't used it myself yet, but soon will HAVE to try. It's now completely modern and up-to-date with cool inroom technology (even USB port for the TV). The receptionist told me that the rooms are nearly finished now and that in September their new restaurant, suitably named New Dorrius will be opened (the old one was called Dorrius). Can't wait to eat there as their previous restaurant was great too. Always ate there with clients, because they serve the Dutch cuisine. I'm proud of my herritage. I use the hotel for my family as well, as it's in the city centre so my family can easily go shopping and I can easily visit them. Keep up the good work guys! Looking forward to seeing the hotel being finished.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: DrandMrsRoper
Reviews.Content: Having booked a supposed 4 star hotel around the corner with expedia that turned out to be glorified knocking shop we happened across the Crown Plaza trying to save our 10 wedding anniversary trip. Very modern, clean and exactly the quality required for a 4 star hotel. The restaurant served an excellent evening meal that was worth the 65 quid for 2 price ticket in a traditional style restaurant setting that contrasts beautifully with the rest of the modern hotel. Avoid the over priced breakfast however which although nice was not worth 50 Euro. Once completed this hotel will be a stunningly good location for a central Amsterdam business or leisure trip and my wife and I would definitely return. The pictures on the website accurately show what you will get when you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A great location for business of leisure”
Reviews.Author: suziesuz
Reviews.Content: We Booked this hotel using my husbands priority points for a weekend break, as he is platinum, we were upgraded to the Executive club lounge, which is rare when redeeming points,. The rooms have been recently refurbished to a high standard, the club lounge had plenty of complimentary refreshments and a fab terrace overlooking the city. Reception and the concierge were very helpful and polite, booking tickets for the museums for us so we didn;t have to queue..i strongly recommend this as the queue's are huge. Great location to walk to all the sights like the Dam square, Red light District, and shopping areas. a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: NT17
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel across the street from Amsterdam Centraal Station and within walking distance to all of the best sites. The room was beautifully decorated, very clean and bright. The bed was super comfortable and luxurious. The bathroom was very nice as well. We ate in one of the restaurants- the more casual one and it was excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: lindadetlefsen
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from train station, but locate on map before leaving the station. Close to all tourist activities, including canal boat tour start points. Rooms are small, the usual decor, but new and clean. Excellent service. Free Internet access using hotel computers or ask for ethernet cord for your own laptop. 20 Euro wifi, which is dumb since they give you the cord. Hotel restaurant is excellent for authentic dutch food, but not cheap. Construction going on, so pool was closed...you may want to call to make sure it is now open.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: bruggeEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend recently stayed at this hotel for a couple of days and enjoyed our stay. We arrived on a friday and stayed until sunday. There were workmen in hammering away when we arrived but when we got up to our room on the 5th floor we did not hear anything else for the next two days. Our room was a newly refurbished one which was really nice. The room itself was spotless and the decor was modern and contemporary. The best thing about the room was the bed. I have never slept in such a comfortable bed ever! They are hypnos beds and I am looking into buying one now that im home. We ate out so cannot comment on hotel food. The hotel is also in the best location and anything you need is just a few minutes away. Overall I would recommend this hotel its great.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION FOR SIGHTSEEING”
Reviews.Author: UPTHEDUBS09
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through 1800 hotels for two nights as a birthday present for my boyfriend! We flew to Schiphol airport and got a taxi to the hotel (DO NOT GET A TAXI - TRUST ME, IT COST NEARLY â‚¬80 - RIPOFF, get on the train at the airport and it leaves you literally 5 minutes from the hotel at central station. check in was quick and the staff are polite. Rooms are quite small but this appears to be the norm in amsterdam. Other hotels around are much cheaper, this hotel cost us â‚¬325 for the two nights inc breakfast but for its location and cleanliness of the hotel i wouldnt choose anywere else in amsterdam although the tulip inn (across the road) looked quite nice too. The breakfast is a buffet, it was gorgeos, you definetly get your moneys worth! The hotel is situated about a 5-7 minute walk from Dam Square, excellent location. I honestly couldnt fault this hotel at all, it is a great standard for amsterdam hotels and the location is just fantastic. I wouldnt hesitate on staying here again!!! Cant wait to go back to amsterdam, its a must see!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, will be very nice when renovations completed”
Reviews.Author: johnv0129
Reviews.Content: 2 block walk from Central Station, 4 blocks from RLD, Seconds from streetcars to take you anywhere in the city. Concierge very friendly and helpful. Desk staff not rude but not overly friendly either. Breakfast was overly pricey at 30 euro-went across the street for numerous options at 10euro. McDonald's 2 doors away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - will be superb when refurbishment complete”
Reviews.Author: chchester
Reviews.Content: Can't ask for a better location as within 200 metres of main railway station. Refurbished business rooms are faultless and staff are very helpful and friendly and all speak English. Refurbishment causes some noise after 08:00 in a morning on week days. If you want a sleep in after 08:00 other than at weekends, then check your room location relative to the work being done.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here until done with reservations! And maybe not even then.”
Reviews.Author: suncountry2112
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 16-20 - WARNING: The hotel is being refurbished until September 2009. The pool and workout room are currently closed, it is very loud during weekdays when they are working on it (was unable to sleep). Also the air conditioning was not working and you can't open the windows!. Would not recommend staying here until they are done with refurbishing, and maybe not even then. Very Overpriced for lots of things.. - Internet -> There is an internet cafÃ© 10m (30 feet away) that only charges 2 euro per hour for internet (have to use their machines there) vs. 6.95 euro (or19.95 per day) at hotel. There is also a single computer that is free to use in the lobby with fast internet. - There are lots of much cheaper breakfast options very close to the hotel. - Do not exchange currency here, there is a western union money exchange with much better rates that 60 feet away from hotel (Western union gave me 74 euro for $100, vs. 66 euro for 100$ at the hotel, thatâ€™s more then 10$!) That said this isn't the worse hotel I've stayed at.. The rooms were clean and fair sized, the staff was fairly friendly, and it is a great location near central train station in center of city..

Reviews.Title: “Good location but in middle of renovations”
Reviews.Author: brenda7Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay at the Crown Plaza on our priority points for an Easter break. First impressions of the hotel were not great, other than the location, which is close to most of the attractions such as Dam Square, Madam Tussads, Canal boats. The hotel is in the middle of renovations and the Healthclub and bar was closed. We started off in one of the unfurbished rooms which had very tired furniture, mould around the bath and an air conditioning unit stuck right in the middle of the room. Overall although it was clean, I did not want to spend 3 nights in there and was willing to move hotels. The next day we complained to the reception of our disappointment and to our surprise they offered us a recently refurbished room, this was really nice and modern with Plasma screen TV, power shower, big pillows, comfy bed. If you are there for more than a night and are put in an old room, let them know at reception that you are not happy. The hotel is also on a tram track so you do get some noise if you are in a room on the front. Once this hotel has been refurnbished it will be much improved and a pleasure to stay in for a short break. Overall after a poor start we thoroughly enjoyed our break in Amsterdam, although it was quite expensive. On a final note book excursions such as Amsterdam Dungeons on the internet beforehand, you will save money..

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL, STAY AWAY, FAR AWAY FROM THIS BUDGET POS”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveller111
Reviews.Content: Front Desk Staff and Management Very Rude They Charge Americand Extra Fees For No Reason and Refuse to Remove Them Staff Will Enter Room With DO NOT DISTURB SIGN on Door Housekeeping Will Go Through Your Luggage Aand Drawers Do Yourself a Favor...Run Away From This Hotel!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best city weekends”
Reviews.Author: namiUk
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Amsterdam, Crown Plaza was very easy to find from train station, very good location, easy access to shops, restaurants and bars. Shame was renevating other side of hotel and taking away the gym and pool, the hotel on main road there was no road noise, very clean rooms and good for the price. Staff very accommodating and friendly. Enjoyed our 3 nights here over the easter bank holiday very relaxing and one of the best city weekends. Recommend you pay for breakfast when booking your room, as food is quite expensive in the hotel and out, 5 euros a pint average. Boat trip is a must and very informative 1 hour 8 euros per adult. Van gogh museum was great, beware of long waiting time, we got there at 9.30 in morning on easter day and was already people waiting. 15 euros each adult. Walking in the Vondel park has 3 lakes. Beautiful buildings in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Prinney
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights over weekend and booked through the Crowne Plaza website paying about 100 euro a night excluding breakfast. Hotel is easy walking distance to station and most of Amsterdam's main attractions. Being near to station area is probably abit questionable after dark. To be fair the hotel is in the middle of renovations though would have been nice to know this when we booked. We were clearly given one of the unrenovated rooms. The size of the room is quite ok though the furnishings and general feeling of the room not what you would expect from a Crowne Plaza. The bathroom in particular could have had more attention to detail when cleaning as bath in particular was badly stained. The bar was closed due to renovation and we did not sample the breakfast at 28 euro a headinstead. I was slightly dispappointed this was not included as it clearly said that breakfast was included on the envelope they provided our room keys in though since the reception staff were the only really great thing about this hotel I couldn't be bothered arguing. Retrospectively I probably shold have asked for another room when we checked in. The best thing about the hotel was the reception staff who were friendly, professional and went out of the way to help you with advice on any occassion we spoke to them. Finally my other pet peeve about booking fancy hotels I really can't be bothered paying 20 euros a day for wireless. it just feels like extaution.

Reviews.Title: “it is ok, not great but not bad”
Reviews.Author: ejh470
Reviews.Content: note: the hotel was just putting up the scaffolding to start rennovation when I left on Feb 15. It was scheduled to start on Feb 16, so I don't know how the noise will be, but it was quiet when I was there. this one is all about location. 5 minute walk from the Centraal train station (go across the bridge by the taxi stand at the east end of the train station... the road you want is a couple blocks to the right of Victoria Hotel as you have your back to the train station) - which makes your transport from Schipol to the hotel a very easy 20 minute train ride for 4 euro. Leidseplein, Ann Frank house, Dam Square, etc. all walkable - 20 minutes or so. Dam Square is less. Rijksmuseum is walkable also but maybe a 30 minute stroll. The room is much larger than you normally get in Europe. I had 2 double beds. the entire hotel is supposedly non-smoking now. Everything was relatively clean, but is defnitely not the fanciest Crowne Plaza I've stayed in. All in all, I would stay there again if I were on business. If I were on leisure, I'd get adventurous and try one of the smaller "no-brand" boutique hotels around the area. There are tons of them. The internet wireless was expensive at 19.95 euros. The pub downstairs had friendly service, but beer and food selection was lacking. The front counter staff was extremely friendly - but I also didn't have issues that I needed them to resolve. the one note I will make about dissatisfaction is with the Porter. I needed a cab that would accept credit cards because I was short on euros (i didn't know at the time that this was rare in Amsterdam). I specifically told him that. The cab he put me in didn't take credit cards, but he assured me that it did. I had quite an issue when I arrived at my destination with not enough money to pay in cash. The workout room and the pool are both tiny. don't expect to swim laps in the pool - its only about 10 meters long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ioanina
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Crowne Plaza in Amsterdam for app. 4 times traveling for business 9my company is headquartered in Amsterdam). The overall experience was above average for Amsterdam. Please bear in mind that most hotels in center of Amsterdam do have small rooms. CP is created by joining several old traditional dutch buildings together so at times it can be very hard to carry your luggage through narrow corridors going up and down. The hotel benefits from all standard CP: soundproof rooms, great pillows, extensive TV channels (including pay tv), very nice breakfast. The location is superb. You can walk from Centraal Station (5 minutes walk) and another 5 minutes will take you to Dam. So no need for taxis here. All in one I will return here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: Elival
Reviews.Content: I like travelling and I have spent a lot of time in hotels due mostly to business and this hotel by far has been the worse of all. The hotel in general was not that bad location wise, rooms were kind of clean, however it does need a bit of renovation, carpets are old... I stayed at this hotel with my partner and a friend and all 3 of us just disliked very much the service of this hotel, the reception lady was rude, unhelpful and made us feel unwelcome. I am member of the priority club and decided to stay at this hotel because i used only book hotel through this chain, but after that experience i decided to look around for other choices.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: LukeKucera
Reviews.Content: I went to the hotel twice in June 2008 and stayed for 1 night each time. I absolutely liked the location of the hotel, which was simply to reach by car when coming after a whole day trip. On the other hand the main trainstation with connection to the Schiphol airport is also just around the corner. Moreover - I was there during the time of EURO 2008 and the games of the Dutch team and I enjoyed the friendly atmosphere of all people in the centre. We loved the style of the hotel and as far I heard all rooms should be refurbished in this year so then it will be definitely even better! Rooms were big enough and the soundproof was good so that nothing was heard however the rooms was towards the main street. Breakfast - simply delicious. I can only recommend this hotel - everything is close and simple.

Reviews.Title: “Had A fantastic Weekend away with The family”
Reviews.Author: BusterBilbo
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fantastic weekend away for my husbands 50th Birthday. I went with my three daughters aged 22,19,17. The eldest daughter goes to Amsterdam quite a lot and she said that the plaza has been the best hotel by far. We had two queen size room on the first floor with connecting doors. The rooms were clean and the bedding looked brand new. We also had bathrobes and slipper to use for our stay. The hotel also left Complementary chocolate. We made use of the gym, swimming pool and Sauna which we near enough had to ourselves. The hotel supplied all towels for use in the sauna and around the pool. I had trouble with the safe on the first night and security came up straight away and sorted it out. I can not comment on the food in the restaurant because we did not eat in the hotel. We knew the hotel food was quiet expensive so we ate out. The staff were very friendly and polite. I can not fault the rooms or staff in anyway. I would definitely use this hotel again and I would most certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JafaAuckland
Reviews.Content: Our booking was part of a Eurostar package, and we spent 3 nights at this Hotel. The room was OK with queen size bed and ensuite. What we liked the most about this hotel was the central location. Moments from Centraal Station, it made navigating our way from tourist venue to tourist venue throughout Amsterdam, very easy. The staff were polite and friendly, the room clean and well appointed. We didn't have any meals at this hotel as we found it rather expensive; the location offers hundreds of small eateries/restaurants within walking distance however. The most off-putting factor about this hotel is the cost. By the time we'd arrived in Amsterdam we'd travelled through part of Europe and collected a pile of dirty laundry. The hotel offers to clean your laundry at a starting rate of 3 Euro for a pair of boxers. Fortunately we found a laundrette where we managed to clean the whole lot for 3 Euro! Breakfast is 22 Euro, but most disappointing was the "city tax" of 15 Euro per night that we discovered on checking out!

Reviews.Title: “An average chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient, the rooms are OKish and so is the bathroom (but both would benefit from a refresh). The queen beds are nice. The breakfast is very average considered that they charge 24EUR for it. Quite pricey and so are the room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Clevland_Potash
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in mid-November. Hotel was fine - very good location, close to bars, restaurants, canal boat tours & centraal station - it was clean and efficient and we had no complaints. We had read previous reviews and knew what to expect - despite the Crowne Plaza brand this is three star/travel inn standard (not the four star advertised) - so find a good deal & only pay three star prices! Amsterdam is a great walking city - just watch out for bicycles!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: JonnySLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from the Central Train Station but tucked away around the corner from the main nightlife streets. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was only passable. Our room had two large single beds instead of a double. It was clean but not in the slightest bit flashy. The window of our room looked out into the centre of the hotel and so was quite dark. This was probably preferable to the others in our party who had a room overlooking the street in front of the hotel and reported that there was quite a large amount of partying noise throughout the night. I did like the Amsterdammer bar but wasn't overly impressed by the food in the Dorrius restaurant. Overall, there wasn't really too much wrong with the hotel, but for the price I would have expected a bit more. It seems that you don't get much for your money in Amsterdam these days. I don't remember that being so much the case last time I stayed there (about 6 years ago).

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but nice!!”
Reviews.Author: charliec6061
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in July 08. We usually hire a boat/ apartment, but because he had a free night, so we decided to go a little up market and book the Crown Plaza. It is in a perfect loction, 5 minutes walk from the train station, right near the shops, but not on the busy main Dam street. The hotel itself is very clean & nicely decorated,with marble floors etc. The downstairs pool is great as you can swim 24hrs a day, if after 12pm you have to get the night staff to open it. (I think they are just checking that you are not too inebriated to swim) We swam every day & had the pool to ourselves every time!! The rooms are very large, view from the windows is down onto the shopping streets. The bar is dark, but very cosy. Dark wood, leather chairs, candles on table that kind of thing. My only complaint was, the room service food was terrible, don;t go there!! Overall lovely hotel, very pricey, but aren't they all in Amsterdam City!?

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: nsander
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here a number of times in the past the hotel is beginning to show wear a bit. Staff were pleasant and helpful throughout which is always as I have found it. The room facilities are as you would expect and the rooms are quite spacious (from a European point of view). I like this hotel because of it's proximity to the Central Rail Station where I can get into and out of the Airport quickly without relying on a taxi (or other transport). Food is of a reasonably good standard for breakfast. The Restaurant is highly regarded for it's Dutch food. The hotel is close to the nightlife centres without being on top of them - Dam Sq being about 5-10 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel--except the rates”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights pre-cruise, fortunately using Priority Club points, since I wouldn't have wanted to pay the $400/night asking price! Perhaps I got a better room than some other reviewers due to being a Platinum member, but our room was roomy for a hotel in a major European city center. It was also surprisingly quiet (both with respect to within the hotel noise and outside noise), modern, and comfortable. I can't imagine that many people would pay the outrageous 20 Euro/day internet fee, but those with access to the Priority Club lounge get to use its computers for free. The breakfasts there are also excellent, as are the views (nicer than the views from any of the rooms). The staff were always very polite and accommodating. The gym was well-kept, although no pool. I really enjoyed my stay, but can't imagine paying the asking price. I would recommend the place if you have enough Priority Club points, or if you can get a good deal on the place.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: mclassic
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at this hotel following the reviews posted on this site. I don't know if it is hotel staff writing reviews of this hotel. But, this hotel is an absolutely terrible hotel. I urge you not to stay here. My initial reservation was for a 4 night stay. I only ended up staying 2 nights, because this hotel is so poor. Check in at the hotel was very smooth. The front desk staff was very courteous. I go to my room. Upon walking in, the room smelled musty and gave me the impression it had not been opened up in some time. Amsterdam is a very humid city. So, the staff should take care to leave the fan on in the room. The hotel room was small. But, many hotel rooms within Amsterdam are. So, this was not a big issue for me. I did notice that the furniture was very old. The bed was low to the ground. The bed comforter was also very old. I knew immediately that I would not be sleeping under that bed comforter. I proceed to plug in my laptop. There is only one available power outlet in the room. Five minutes after plugging in my laptop, the outlet is no longer charging my laptop. I disconnect the plug and reconnect. Still no power. I ended up having to reach behind the TV to use the power strip, which had one available power outlet. I needed to use the Internet to check e-mail. Upon signing on, I was informed by the sign-on page that 24 hours of Internet use would be $19.95 Euro. I immediately go to the front desk and ask for an explanation of this price. The front desk person told me that he does not set the pricing. I told him that I thought the pricing was excessive for Internet usage. He looked at my room info in the system and told me that I'm eligible for a 20% discount because I'm a Priority Club member. That bit of info still didn't make me feel any better. The desk person then said that I can use the Internet cafe around the corner if I wanted to cheaper Internet. I glare at him for a few seconds and walk away. I go to the bathroom within the room. Immediately upon waliking in I see that the bathroom is in need of an update as well. Fine, no problem. I look at the floors. The floor tile is full of black spots. There is brown mildew in the corner nearest the bathtub. The bathtub and shower are no better. The bath tile was not very clean either. I thought to myself "disgusting". I did everything I could to keep my time in the bathroom brief. Once in bed, I could tell the bed was infested with something. My skin kept itching. So, I ended up putting on the included bathrobe and slept in a small corner of the bed for the entire night. The next morning I ask what the hotel's policy is on checking out early. I was told I had to pay them 100 Euro if I did not give them 24 hours advance notice. I went back to my room and did a search for hotels nearby. Once I found one I wasted no time letting the front desk know I would be checking out the next day. That was the worst two nights in a hotel of any hotel I've ever stayed. Do not stay at this hotel. There are much better options nearby for cheaper, that will offer better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Come on Crowne Plaza - spend a little money on your hotel”
Reviews.Author: awoods
Reviews.Content: What a location! just across the road + one block back from the main station... - very central, very easy to get anywhere. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful.... I was upgraded but if this was an upgrade I would not like to see a standard room. The room I got was tired, (that's putting it nicely). It was not large or luxurious, both things I associate with this chain. The windows did not open and the a/c was noisy.... no real reason for the windows not opening that I could see, they were just fitted that way around 20 years ago - I was only on the 3rd floor looking out into a court-yard. The inhouse restaurant was excellent, reception was good.... it just needs loads spent on the bedooms - especially for the rates they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel - Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: AgentW4
Reviews.Content: I first stayed in the hotel about 9 years ago on a business trip and it was great back then. My partner and I were planning a vacation weekend this past holiday weekend. We found the Crowne Plaza City Centre available. The rate was around â‚¬178 per night for a double. On the plus side the reception staff were really helpful. Very attentive. I am sure the rooms have not been refurbished in a long while. The bed was very low and soft and the decor generally quite dark. The bathroom is the real low point. The tiles need re-grouting or least cleaning up so the mould does not show. The bathroom is also very tiny and difficult to squeeze in to use the toilet with your knees pressing against the side of the bath. Cleanliness OK. Location is the real selling point. The rooms need a face lift.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Walking, So-So for Families w/Kids”
Reviews.Author: C.Hendon
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18 month old son and I stayed here for 2 nights in July. We would consider staying here again, if unable to find a better-value property. Given our short time in the city and young child, our priority was to be in a location that allowed us to sightsee on foot/stroller and quickly return if we needed naps. The location was excellent for this. It is a 10 minute walk from the Centraal Station, so we were easily and affordably able to take a train from the Airport. It is also surrounded by restaurants, shops and small grocery markets. We had no problems finding a place to eat or pick up odds and ends. A 15-20 minute walk in any direction allowed us to see tons of attractions. A possible downside on the location for those families with kids is that it is quite close to the Red Light District which wasn't a problem as our son is so young, but might give rise to interesting questions and conversations if he was older... The facility itself proved to be less than we expected. Given the price we paid and the reputation of the Crowne Plaza (and stays in CP's in other locations), we were underwhelmed by the room's dated furniture and decor. The beds were comfortable however and the room appeared clean. One other note about the room--the in-room mini-fridge operates on a system that charges you for each stock item removed (we only found those instructions on the inside of the fridge). So, even though you don't consume a can of Coke, just moving it to squeeze a botte of milk in will add the cost of the Coke to your bill. We were presented with a list of such costs, but folks at the desk were obliging in removing the charges when we explained that we had not consumed any items.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice near station”
Reviews.Author: Conner2dood
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and find it an excellent choice for Amsterdam, especially if you want to stay close to the activities around the station.Staff is very good and No Smoking policy is strictly enforced, you m,ust stand outside to smoke. Rooms are above average, hotel is very clean and ice is available on each floor,,,something not found in many hotels in Amsterdam. Prioce is high but then in this city, anything not expensive is not of very good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: mckaykarenj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amsterdam Crowne Plaza for a couple of nights during mid-July 2008. The hotel is located 5-10 mins walk from Amsterdam Centraal, which is one of the reaons I chose it. The deciding factor was it claimed to have a fitness suite - it has a pool so I was quite disappointed. However, I used my time walking the streets in the blissfully warm evening sun. The hotel doesn't have many amenitied but when you have Amsterdam on your doorstep this isn't a problem. I ate at a quaint Tapas bar a couple of blocks away on one evening, then Soup Kitchen the second evening. Both were good value for money, friendly and welcoming. The hotel lobby is grand, but the corridors are dark and the room wasn't fantastic. There was plenty of space and the bathroom wasn't dated, which is nice. I am in the Netherlands almost weekl and most hotels so far have had manky bathrooms with moulding grouting. Overall, the hotel tariff is expensive, the check in and and out was efficient and friendly, the room was comfortable and the location was great. I wouldn't rush back, but I wouldn't purposefully not return either.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the other reviews, I thought it was quite good!”
Reviews.Author: travelfan199
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three-night stay at the Crowne Plaza hotel in Amsterdam CIty Centre and I was rather surprised to read so many negative reviews of the hotel -you have to speak as you find, and I was pleased, overall, despite there being some shortcomings. Briefly: Postiive Staff -always, without fail, friendly, informed and helpful Food and Beverage -consistantly first class -this is the thing the hotel does best. Location -four minutes from Central station, two minutes from the nearest tram stop. Neutral Pool -it's quite small, but, this is a city centre hotel, so there has to be compromise somewhere. There is also a sauna and a mini gym which are both great, although a jacuzzi or steam room would have been nice! Room -My room was not small based on EU average and I can only assume that either there is another wing of the hotel with tiny rooms, or the previous reviewers have only ever stayed in US hotels -even then, an average NY hotel room is smaller than this room was. The bed was comfortable, and the minibar well stocked. The bathroom was ok and plenty big enough -the shower pressure, whilst not fantastic, was fine. Yet, the room felt a little tired, although it was spotless. There was BBC1 and BBC2 on the TV along with CNN, National Geographic with Dutch subtitles and BBC World Service for English language. Negative I can't really find anything BAD to say about the hotel to be honest. If I was being picky, I would say that the rooms could do with updating and that housekeeping should refill the minibar every day, but, the hotel is a good place to stay in my view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jg24fan
Reviews.Content: I do not know where people you have putted this hotel down stayed at but it surely was not here. It is in a great location downtown 5 minutes from Central Station and the Various Canal Boats and cruises. 10 Minutes walk from the Main square.
