The room was ample in size and clean and the staff was more then helpful and friendly. My only negative comment would be about the costly fee for the internet which I found to be quite high compared to all past experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Cariad05
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break at the Crowne Plaza a birthday surprise for my partner. Finding the hotel is very simple. On leaving Central Station take the bridge to the right and cross the road being very weary of the trams (they stop for no one!!) Walk up the road and keep to the left the hotel is just around a bend. Check in was speedy and staff were plesant but when we got to our room not only was it very small a small double bed, it faced a brick wall and it also wasn't ready for guests. As this was a special occasion I requested to upgrade to a club room unfortunately for us we couldn't get upgraded until the next day. It was well worth the wait and the additional cost, the room was much bigger the bed more comfortable and the club lounge very welcoming. The staff were extremely helpful especially the consierge and the guest relations guy. There's a wide choice for breakfast including champagne, bucks fizz. Dorias restaurant was very pleasant portions were very novelle cuisine especially the portions we paid 15E for 2 bottles of water!!!!. The hotel is very central and everything is within easy walking. Must Do's all the usual tourist attractions and the canal cruise. Don't do D'Vijff Vlieghen restaurant the staff are pleasant enough, the food is awful. Our starter was given to anouther couple we had to wait an hour for another one and our main course had obviously been kept under some kind of heater as it was dry as a bone and when we complained we we're told that we order the veal well done it was burnt and dry!!! They didnt apologise so we asked for our bill and left. We had a fab time in Amsterdam but our experience at this restaurant was upsetting as it was meant to be a special meal to celebrate my partners birthday. However, we still love Amsterdam and

Reviews.Title: “Smokey Smokey Smokey”
Reviews.Author: AUKTourist
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedded non-smoking room and ended up after a two hour wait and lots of conversations with a smoking room. It was unbelievable the room was so bad they sent an air purifier which could not shift the smell. The Hotel claim they never got the e-mail and as it is used by tours and airlines for flight crew they claimed to be full. After two days everything ended up either in the wash or at the cleaners. If you are a smoker head for here, it is a good location but eat out. The restaurant and brasserie are typically hotel standard; use this site to find the best. Expect to pay top prices for a basic experience, there are better hotels in Amsterdam for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. The hotel is a five minute (or less) walk from the Centraal (train) Station and a very close walk to most of the main areas. Although you can take the trams or rent a bike, I walked from the hotel to the Dam, the Anne Frank House, the Waterlooplein market, the Red Light District and more, just to name a few of the more well known sights. The hotel room had a nice bathroom, a convenient workspace and a good view, and the hotel itself had large working elevators, a nice bar and a very friendly staff. I would defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the mice”
Reviews.Author: bowenp79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights during March whilst on Holiday. Check in was ok, huge disappointment when I got to the room as it was so small I couldn't even walk around most of it, this was after paying for an upgrade to a club room. Spoke to a member of staff and explained that I was a Platinum member and should get a decent room. When I said that it was the smallest room I had ever seen she did say that the hotel did have one room smaller. Luckily we eventually got moved to a room that we could stand up in. Room was clean but for some reason you had to climb over a chair to get into the bathroom. Views from the room consisted of other hotel rooms which was fairly entertaining at times. Club Lounge access was worth paying extra for, great continental breakfast in the morning, free tea/coffee and biscuits throughout the day and as much beer (Grolsch) and wine as you want in the evening. The lounge had great views over the city and a fantastic outdoor terrace . Club Lounge also had a family of small mice who seemed to be able to move very quickly when they knew you had food, bit off putting during the day but a few bottles of wine and you don't really care as much. Seemed odd that all the staff new about the mice but didn't do much about them. Hotel bar and restaurant (Dorrius) were great and certainly worth a visit. Restaurant can also be booked on top table if you want to collect some points. Anyway, overall a good hotel in a very good location. Complain until you get a decent room and you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: roaminrobby
Reviews.Content: we stayed just for one night and found the staff very friendly and helpful,the room was spacious and clean and we wanted for nothing.we'd definatly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great base of operations!”
Reviews.Author: AuntieAnne22
Reviews.Content: Called Holiday Inn reservations to make reservation. Got to the hotel and the clerk tried to refuse us a room because we exceeded the max number of people in a room. After we determined that Holiday Inn needed to work on their reservation system and got checked in, we had a very nice stay. Luxury showerhead (at least it seemed like it after a long trip), lots of hot water, firm mattresses, nice pillows, clean room, excellent location. A full breakfast buffet was included in our rate of 191Euros per night for four people. Breakfast was lovely with made to order omlets, waffles and Dutch pancakes. Champagne, all types of juices, breads, fruits, eggs, bacon, sausage, hashbrowns, cheeses, yoghurts, and coldcuts were also on the buffet. Nice, helpful concierge, nice pool area, internet cafe, 5 min walk to central station, and 2 min walk to shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcyNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the bad reviews this hotel has got..they must have stayed in a different place to the one we did. The staff were very welcoming, room was spotlessly clean, bed very comfortable, room looked out onto quiet street. The location was fantastic, less than 10 minutes walk from the Central Station and very close to lots of bars, shops, the old town and canal boats. We never had to get a single taxi anywhere. Th breakfast couldn't be faulted and the buffet offered a wide range of food including freshly cooked omellets, pancakes and waffles. There were sofas in reception and the bar was fine. I really couldn't complain about any of it. So ignore those bad reviews if you want a hotel that is situated ideally for a break in this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away : old and moldy”
Reviews.Author: laila2007
Reviews.Content: Stay away form this hotel. Many of their stuff in their rooms are old and need renovations, also our room smelled moldy. When we got back from vacation I noticed they charged us for our stay of 4 nights and then they had put in another charge for the same thing. They charged us 2x instead of once. Their management sucks and we had to basically call them back and forth for weeks until we got out money back. Bunch of thieves

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For City Break”
Reviews.Author: Hondacrv
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel from 30/12/07until 4/01/08. The location is excellent and is a five minute walk from Central Station. We booked a Club Room which entitled us to Continental Breakfast and included free tea, coffee, soft drinks ,beer, wine and snacks to 11pm each day. The room was very comfy and a good size although the bathroom was small. It had all the usual ameneties and was very clean. The Hotel is excellently situated for travellers and there is plenty of shops ,resturants etc nearby. The tram stop is a short distance away and we found this extremely easy to use and inexpensive. A strip ticket costs euro6.80 and will be good for two people for about 4 or 5 runs. All of the staff were very helpful. The Hotel had a leisure centre which included a pool although we got no time to use it, the facilities offered looked good. I would probably book this Hotel as room only again as it is expensive to include the breakfast and there is numerous resturants/cafes acrosss the street offering full english breakfasts for approximately 7 euros. Overall a good experience and I would definately recommend this Hotel and it is one I would return to on a visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: couturefan
Reviews.Content: This place's one saving grace is its location but as Amsterdam is so small this really shouldn't be a factor. The furniture was very worn and old, the linen was off white and looked dirty and the room we got was freezing as the air con didnn't work properly. We asked (twice) way in advance for a room that was NOT over the front of the hotel. This was confirmed as being not a problem but of course we ended up with a room over the front of the hotel. The staff were on the whole nice but when our Connexxions bus(dont use this crowd you'll be waiting in the cold for your mini-bus) was delayed and we asked the desk staff to contact them we were told "Connexxions is a third party" and basically told to wait. Not service you'd expect for that price, though some of the staff were friendly enough. Which brings me to my last point. Without doubt, this is the WORST VALUE FOR MONEY hotel I have ever stayed in. The cost compared to what you got was abysmal. I only booked here because it was over New Years and literally this was the last hotel available.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, moderate price”
Reviews.Author: marek1978
Reviews.Content: Very good location, close to central train station, trams, bicycle rentals and local attractions

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED: A short walk from the main train station, this property is starting to show it's age. Dimly lit rooms, bathroom fittings showing their age. BUT this is Amsterdam and it's convenient location and relative quiet make this an OK choice for your visit. The restaurant is to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room, polite staff”
Reviews.Author: EuroCityWeekender
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amsterdam Crowne Plaza during early December. Would definitely recommend, based on our experience. At time of booking double room had requested non-smoking, but told that only smoking room available. Took the smoking room, but requested a move to non-smoking if another became available ... didn't hold out much hope, though. On arrival, warmly welcomed, plenty of staff on reception, excellent english and very helpful. Told us that we had automatically been moved to a non-smoking room when one became available, and were allocated rom 201. 201 was right at the end of the corridor - on the plus side, we were only joined to one room, on the minus side the room faced the street. Happy with this, as we tend to find noise comes more from adjoining rooms than outside the hotel. Hotel is situated on a main but not overly busy road - we noticed far more cyclists and trams than cars and this, along with the well insulated room, made getting to sleep at about 11.45 p.m. very easy. Quiet all through the night, too. No-one passes your door to go to their room, so no loud voices and banging doors. Spacious room with two double beds, and plenty of space for clothes, suitcases etc. One long double window, and another in opposite wall, so plenty of light. Small/medium bathroom, fully functional. Room, bathroom, linens etc. spotlessly clean. Hotel is excellently situated for travellers - 5 mins walk from main station in Amsterdam, reachable within 17 mins from Schipol airport. We were in hotel only 35 mins after arriving at schipol railway station. Hotel only a few minutes away from the start of the main shopping lanes, but far enough away from nighttime revellers that there was no noise after midnight. Didn;t try the hotel breakfast - never do, as prefer coffee and rolls in local cafes as part of the experience - but menu was extremely comprehensive and the usual price of 'bit more than you might hope to pay'. In-room tea and coffee making was good. Overall, a really good experience - the staff couldn't do enough to help, providing with maps and directions, keeping our luggage and being unfailingly polite. Would recommend trip to diamond factory in museum area.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and poor”
Reviews.Author: DonegalBhoy
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in this hotel for the past 4 nights. I was supposed to be staying for 12 but moved hotels today as even though I was staying in a Club room it was VERY small and stank of smoke even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room. Every night of my stay when I got back from work at night my card wouldn't open my room door. The rooms apart from being small were badly in need of refurbishment and the overall impression was very dated. For the price of Â£200 a night it was robbery. Definitely won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “ok, good base”
Reviews.Author: Minako
Reviews.Content: Rooms comfortable and fairly decent in terms of furniture and size. Dressing gowns and slippers provided. Our rooms were at the back of the hotel which was very quiet. As none of the windows in the rooms open up and smoking (including the obvious local smoke) seems to be allowed the air can get a little sickly as you go down the halls to your room. Beware of city tax when you book as you are not told about this until you check out. This was an extra 40 euros on top. This hotel is on the main tram line which was a huge bonus for travelling around or getting back when you are lost. If you are getting a taxi from the airport check with the driver first for the cost. There was a group of 10 of us and one taxi cost 65 euros whilst the other paid only 35 euros, it then cost us 58 euros to return and 39 euros for the other car (quess which one I was in, typical!!).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Bubblesdevere
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza City Centre is located about 5 minutes walk from the Central Station. If you get a bit lost (as we did) there are helpful signs pointing in the right direction. Although the front of the hotel faces a busy main road, traffic isn't a problem as there are few cars in Amsterdam, most people travelling by trams and bicycle. Behind the hotel is a pedestrianised shopping street which runs down to Dam Square and the Red Light District. Inside the hotel is very modern and clean but is definitely more of a business hotel than a tourist one, though there was a mixture of business people and holidaymakers when we were there. It also seems to be popular with airline crew. I missed not having a nice lounge area with comfortable chairs to relax in and enjoy a coffee or drink after a hard day sightseeing. Instead there is the choice of a dark and smoky bar or an inside patio area adjacent the bar but neither felt right just. Our room on the 5th floor was clean, bright and fairly spacious but you could have been anywhere in the world, such was the corporate nature of it. But I guess that's what you get when you stay in a chain hotel. We got a room without breakfast included. The first morning we were so tired we did have the hotel breakfast. There was a good choice (including champagne) but at â‚¬22 per person it made an already expensive hotel room even more expensive. The next morning we got a tram to Vondelpark and had breakfast in the sunshine at the Vertigo cafÃ© (â‚¬7.50 per person). The star of our stay though was the concierge who handled every request for information with humour and a smile. He was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this dump”
Reviews.Author: ClintABix
Reviews.Content: I have never paid so much money for such a bad hotel. The room was dark, dingy and dirty. Everything reeked of cigarette smoke (I wasn't given a choice of smoking or non-smoking), including the bedsheets, which made me realise that the sheets hadn't been changed since the last occupant (at least). Everything was old and threadbare, but not in a charming way. Breakfast wasn't included in the extortionate price of 234 Euros, so I paid a 17.50 Euro surcharge to have breakfast included. I shouldn't have wasted my money. I had fried eggs on toast. I thought the chef was going to cook them as I waited, instead, she reached over to a tray of pre-fried eggs and flipped a couple on my plate. They were rubbery and cold. When I left, no one asked me if I had a good stay, they just took my money and shoved the receipt at me. I was very glad to be leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: ECH_MEH
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on the Club level. It's a short walk from the train station and most downtown sights. Room was nice but we were disappointed in the size and comfort of the bed. It was the smallest queen sized bed we'd ever seen. The Club lounge was nice and has a rooftop terrace. Good location in town. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby. Pretty quiet room for being in the middle of town.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain at nearly Â£200 a night”
Reviews.Author: Hairyone
Reviews.Content: A lot of very unfair things have been said about this Hotel and to put the record straight our overall experience could not have been better. Location - This Hotel is convienietnly located near one of the cities entertaining red light districts and is surrounded by those interesting little coffeee houses where you can absorb the pure essence of Amsterdam. An experience not to be missed and the short distance back to the Hotel is an added benefit. Hotel Transport Links - Fortunately a very busy mainroad runs right outside the Hotels front door which makes getting to any part of the city on the numerous Trams or Taxis that travel the road throughout the day and night quick and easy. Hotel clientel - One of the many things that makes staying at a top end luxury Hotel like the Crowns Plaza so interesting and entertaining are the other guests. For instance, when we stayed there were a large group of Brisitsh Hells Angels checking in. What characters they were and despite their fearsome reputation it was a great credit to the staff at the Hotel who laughed and joked with them as if their presence was an everyday occourance, Quite admirable. Hotel Resturant & bar area's - These were fantastic places. Loud, noisy, crowded with a dark, dusky atmosphere that put us right in the mood for a serious evening of clubbing and partying. The restuarants could not have been better with food that was to die for and service was out of this world. In fact we learned that none of the catering staff were locals so 'out of this world' probably explains it. Hotel Staff - What a great bunch of characters, It was so good to see a business establishment providing a chance in life to people from other countries, some of whom did not even understand basic english although they all spoke it to some degree or other. It all added to the foriegn atmosphere. the staff were a great credit to the Management. Hotel Rooms - Contrary to the negative experience of many other guests we had nothing to complain about here although we were probably too bladdered to notice most of the time. But, everything worked & the beds were clean and made each day. Rest in peace we say. Summary - All in all we had a great time and much of that was down to the Crowne Plaza being such a great Hotel. If you want a coupe of rip roaring exciting nights in a Hotel that is open minded and where anything goes then this is the Hotel for you. We give it a five for fun

Reviews.Title: “Grand Central Spot”
Reviews.Author: caitni2000
Reviews.Content: Used priority club points to stay here first weekend in July. We wanted to see and experience Amsterdam and were only in our hotel to sleep at night, and catch 40winks in the afternoon. Very contented with the hotel. Room was large and clean, as was the bathroom with ample toilteries, coffee making facilities, iron, hair dryer etc. all as expected. The buffet breakfast in the lounge was adequate, as was the gym, however the pool was a little cold - but was empty when we went to it. Also very small, not long enough for laps and no jacuzzi. The hotel is tucked in by central station, so very convenient for the airport, but a little quieter that street front locations. Tram is easily accessed at the front door to take you to Liedseplein (sp??), Anne Frank and Van Gough Museum area. Its a short walk to the red light and shopping areas with many little restaurants along the way. Consierge Staff are very helpful in advising tickets and attractions and don't rip you off. Over all a clean convinient hotel we were very happy with.

Reviews.Title: “a total gem”
Reviews.Author: lulumama
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a great place-central location to cruiselines,airport ,city tours and shopping.True, some rooms might be slightly dated,but spacious and the staff so helpful and knowledgeable that makes everyone feel great.We travelled as a family with a special needs child and not only did we feel welcome but the front desk and housekeeping catered to our every need.We have stayed twice this year and would highly recommend the place!!!Not to be missed-the incredible breakfast,the club lounge and....a less known but nice game room for kids and teens.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherbert
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of years ago and have just had a similar experience in a hotel of the same chain elsewhere. We checked in and I had arranged an upgrade, whilst the staff were fine the rooms are disappointing. Our bathroom had the toilet at an angle, as otherwise it would not have fitted in! Bed comfy, but could have been better. When I returned and complained through the priority club programme, I never heard back from them. Not a bad location and a shame that many hotels connected with Priority Club are let down by a lack of TLC and a lack of "newness". So many other hotels which offer great service and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: SBCornwall
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this hotel, though the last was several years ago. It is rather tired now and seems to lack investment. Club Room was not really worth the extra. Little things were missing such as the complimentary newspaper and footstools for the furniture - things which are used to sell these rooms. Breakfast was a rather tired affair with little room to sit and, when the croissants ran out, they stayed run out! Rather a pain, too, not to be able to reach the Club lounge from my room without going down to the lobby and taking another lift. Despite what another reviewer said, the in room bar is not complimentary. I checked! On the plus side, the hotel managed to accommodate me for an early check-in. However, all things considered, I would look around next time for another venue.

Reviews.Title: “Enough said”
Reviews.Author: EXPERIENCED1
Reviews.Content: A personal view We had stayed at this hotel on dozens of occasions in the early 90's. In fact, at that time it was one of our favourite hotels and could easily hold it's own with other 'superior' hotel in Amsterdam - but not any more. What has changed? Well, with two notable exceptions the answer is absolutely nothing whosoever. The whole place is still stuck in an 80's time warp. It is bland, characterless and depressing with a decor that would not look out of place in a brown on beige 80's Colombo movie. The bedrooms are depressing and unimaginative (don't go there for your honeymoon) - did I say depressing again. In the bathrooms, apart from some peculiar space age soap dispensers (a smart salesman at work here) things have not changed in over 20 years, ugh. The public areas look and feel like an 80's shopping mall of the worse kind and the public rooms have the despairing air of the worst kind of UK motorway service station. So what has not changed? The first surprise is the room rate. It's very, very high indeed. For the 5 stars (how do they judge these things) that the place is definitely not you can get better value elsewhere in Amsterdam by paying far less for far more. The second change is the staff. We are very pleased to report that without exception the ordinary workers in the hotel (all immigrants who no doubt needed the work) were unbelievably efficient, outstandingly helpful and very eager to please. Quite wonderful people ! Unfortunately the exact opposite could be said of the junior so called 'Management' who turned out to be extremely unhelpful, rude, supercilious and arrogant. This must be one of the very few commercial establishments in Europe where the â€˜Managementâ€™sâ€™ attitude is 'the customer is always wrong'. In summary, if this 'Crowne Plaza' was downgraded to a Holiday Inn it would not do credit to the Holiday Inn brand. However, you will appreciate that this is just our personal opinion based upon staying in literally hundreds of hotels over the past 30 years in dozens of countries in Europe and the rest of the world. So, why not find out for yourself. Book yourself in for a night. Pay the exorbitantly high tariff. Enjoy the un stimulating decor. Explore the depressing public spaces and when you get back to your room put a pillow over your head to block out the realization that you might, just might have made a very expensive mistake. And one last crucial tip for your enjoyment, don't whatever you do expect anything from at least the junior â€˜managementâ€™ but ingratitude. After all, the customer is always wrong â€“ at least in this establishment !!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok..”
Reviews.Author: rooc
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel is in a very good location, it is not of 5 star standard. In addition, the attitude of at least half of the staff we dealt with was that they were doing us a favour letting us stay there. We booked a Club room which was slightly dingy, damaged wallpaper, mould in shower area - on one day our room hadn't been serviced when we returned back at about 4pm. The Club Lounge was pleasant - comfy chairs, internet access, terrace to sit outside - we found this particularly useful as the hotel didn't have a lounge as such where you could sit. What is actually included in the Club room price is - a supposedly better room (I don't believe they are any different, just have a dressing gown, better toiletries etc), continental breakfast until 11a.m - very average and on one day no seating available, drinks throughout the day - Heinekin lager, red and white wine, diet coke, Fanta, water and tea and coffee. However, the hotel website says the Club Lounge is open 'til 12pm when in fact the bar closes at 11pm and tea / coffee is not available after 10:30 because staff start to clean the machine. Also, very off putting was the fact that one evening when the Lounge was quiet we saw a mouse - worrying since the Lounge is on the 6th floor (and there are lots of floors beneath it!) and also because food is served in there. We told Reception but they didn't seem overly bothered. Pool - smallish and a bit cold but clean as were the changing facilities. Would I use it again? Probably not - for the price paid there must be better central hotels. Its also put us off Holiday Inn as there seems to be no consistency across hotels so you can't be sure what you're getting (e.g. we have stayed in the Crowne Plaza in Helsinki which was in a totally different league)

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: alebrighton123
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I ever stayed and it wasn't cheap. I've been to 4 and 5 stars hotels and this one is definetely not a 4 star. Our room was dark and when we asked to change rooms we got another one that stink tobacco! It was just impossible to breathe. It wasn't very clean either. I don't recomend it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel......but upgrade your room !!”
Reviews.Author: Coggie
Reviews.Content: I emailed the hotel to upgrade my room to a "superior club room" and got a huge2 room suite with 3 big velux opening windows 2 tv's desk, and use of the club lounge and free mini bar, and free WiFi internet acess ( had to be renewed every 24 hours) I had to call a couple of times to get the mini bar re stocked. I found the staff friendly and helpfull at all times..... One of the best hotels i have used in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location....”
Reviews.Author: ste1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City from 3-6th May, 2007. This hotel has a great location and is less than 5 minutes walk from Central Station. Decided to cash in on priority club points and stayed in a two bedded queen room. As a platinum member of priority club this hotel allows access to the club lounge. The club lounge offers a selection of soft drinks, beer, wine and snacks throughout the day and is open from 07:00-24:00 daily. The lounge also has 2 PCs with free internet connection. A continental breakfast is served from 07:00 until 11:00 during the week and is extended until 11:30 at weekends. Had a meal at the resaurant Dorrius within the hotel which was an excellent experience, typical dutch food and very good service. Staff at this hotel were all polite, informative and helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second to none!!!”
Reviews.Author: LarryN1
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam for a weekend while mixing some pleasure with a business trip... The service and friendliness offered in this hotel from the door man. check-in service, concierge etc. was second to none. Being a Platinum / Ambassador of the Intercontinental Priority Club in most cases upon check-in will get you a pleasant greeting and maybe a slight room upgrade however, at this Hotel we were treated as if we were dignitaries!! (Room upgrade, concierge lounge, fruit basket and wine!!!) Our room was clean, comfortable, well appointed, and really quite spacious for European Hotel Standards. The location of this hotel is great a 5 min walk from the Central Station, but was in a very safe area, 500 meters from the Tram Stops. I must admit that we had lots of fun with other guests on the rooftop patio of the concierge lounge watching the sunset on an unusually warm evening in late April. I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: MintTea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location, less than 5 mins fro Centraal Station. Just get the train from the airport to the station, it's very quick and easy about 20-25 mins from hotel to airport. I stayed in Rm 251, a twin with double beds. This is a great room as it's at the end of the corridor so no one ever passes your door! We didn't have breakfast included in our rate (98E/night) but there is a supermarket about 10 mins down the road and lots of little bakeries nearby. Loads of sights are within walking distance, along with shops, restaurants, Dam Square etc etc. The hotel has a small gym (with temperamental machinery!) however it was pretty good to get up in the morning and do a workout then go for a dip in the pool (quite small and a little chilly but this just encouraged you to swim faster!) and then relax in the sauna (these are situated in the changing rooms so are single sex only). There was the usual variable room service - sometimes you got your water refreshed, sometimes not, sometimes they gave you more toiletries, sometimes not but as usual in hotels if you ask one of the chamber maids for something they are more than happy to get it for you. Overall a brilliant hotel for sight seeing and a very quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: rumtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from a three night stay which we enjoyed. We cannot fault the hotel in any way. We upgraded to a club room which was average size and very clean, with all the extra things you would expect from a club room. The breakfast that was provided in the club lounge was good. We also could have free drinks, snacks and computer acess in the club lounge. The staff were very helpful and polite. We had dinner in a steak house opposite the hotel one night and it was excellent. The hotel is very near the central station and is in a good location for sight seeing. We took the train from the airport to central station.Get an open return, it saves you time on your way back. The train from the airport is very straight forward to use and is a lot cheaper than getting the shuttle bus or taxi. We did not use the tram but we did use the canal bus to get around. If we were to return to Amsterdam we would use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Plumstead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Easter weekend as a family of 3 with a 10 year old. I was on crutches so had to be as near to transport as possible. The nearby tram. bus and canal bus stops took us to all the major attractions with ease. Central Station is only a short walk away too. We booked a club room and to be honest it just seemed like a standard roon to us. It was a bit small - everytime I sat in one of the armchairs I hit my head on the lamp. It was comfortable and fairly clean (bathroom needs a refurb as a bit grubby here and there). We loved the Club Lounge and went there every evening to relax and play chess or scrabble. The free mini-bar was never replenished unless we asked. The staff were friendly and fulfilled our requests, but really this should be done automatically - or why bother booking a club room. My son and husband used the pool, but said it was very small and got too busy to use at times. As a 4 star hotel it is not the best we have stayed in, but for friendliness and location it is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SushiPrincess
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 2 weeks in April. The hotel is standard at best, but does have a good location. The desk staff is continually bewildered when asked about the surrounding area (i.e. - "Where is a good place to go for lunch?" Enter a blank stare here....). Breakfast was included, and is pretty good. Besides the standard fare, there is a chef who prepares pancakes, waffles, omelets, etc. The rooms are predictably small, and stuffy. I stayed in a standard room, with no view or windows that opened. The decor and bathroom are in need of an update. The lighting is poor; even with all of the lights on it still seems like you are lighting the room with one 40 watt bulb. The location is a short walk from the train station, and close to many good restaurants and attractions. Overall, would probably look for another hotel in the same area if I return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: richard9999
Reviews.Content: Our accommodation was excellent. We had a club room which was on special internet offer rate on the website. With a club room you get free breakfast, free minibar, extra free stuff in the room, your own dedication check-in desk, free wifi, reduced rate on the valet parking, free bar, free easter eggs for the kids etc. The service was top quality. Everyone really nice and friendly. The place was spotless - obviously just been done up. Not cheap, but one of the best business class hotels I've ever stayed in. Thoroughly recommended. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: FrenchDub
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights as a family of four, with the children (aged 4 and 6) sharing for free in a room with two double beds. The room was clean and functional. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. We did not eat at the hotel and so cannot say anything about the food quality (there is an abundance of restaurants within a short stroll that are fun to explore and mostly child-friendly) . The pool (if a little small) was a great attraction for the children and a great way to relax after a days touring in amsterdam. The location was fantastic being adjacent to major roads, the central station, tram lines and major shopping and other key attractions. Amsterdam is quit compact and easy to find you way around. We contempated staying outside and travelling in each day but our stay at the Crowne Plaza convinced us that staying in the heart of the city was the right option! The pool was the cherry on the cake. If you have young children, you will be glad to know that the hotel is sufficiently distant from the red light district and there are no overt shopfronts etc. nearby which would lead you to having to answer awkward questions! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful vacation, Great location and Attentive service”
Reviews.Author: psymn
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel using Priority club points, so we did not have to pay much for 4 nights in Amsterdam. Even if we had paid full price, it would be worth it! The hotel is very close to the Central train station. There are shops, cafes, bars, and dining all nearby. The staff was very friendly and even moved our bags to a new room due to a booking mixup. The room was much larger other hotel rooms i've seen in Amsterdam. If you are used to standard rooms in the US with soap & shampoo in the bath, and enough room to sit somewhere other than the bed, THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU. The bar was cozy, and the service was good. The restaurant looked nice, but we didn't come to AMS to spend the weekend in our hotel. I did not use the pool or sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: frost21
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my hen party weekend as even though we wanted to do the bars and clubs we also wanted somewhere to chill and relax and have a swim and sauna! Firstly location wise this hotel is great, very close to central station and near the shops. All in all that is very handy. The pool inside the hotel is tiny! I would say it was only twelve by twelve and the sauna is also miniscule-We managed to squeeze only 4 n at a time! However all that I could live with, the hotel staff were another matter! At one stage I thought there must have been a stage in the interviewing process for cowne plaza where they tested the snotty looks and condescending attitudes of their staff because here at Amsterdam city centre, they have these qualities down to a tee! We had arranged our booking through a friends and family discount of which we hadn't been gievn a white card. We arranged for the hotel in the UK to fax through TWO statements saying we were entitled to the discount which 'apparently' were never received dispite the UK hotel having accepted receipts and confirming the number with the amsterdam reception. In the midst of this the staff were rude, laughed when we were clearly upset with the situation and not once offered any assistance in receiving the confirmation! A simple call to the UK was too much for them. Finally on the second to last stay we were granted an audience with the duty manager who was also exceptionally off hand sharp with us and finally agreed to call the UK. Fianlly the fax was received and we were able to relax that we would only have to pay the rates we had initially agreed to when making the booking. I could almost understand the attitude if we were a huge group of loud and brash girls but in no way were we. We were considerate of other visitors and polite to everyone. Maybe that was the problem for the staff here at the crowne plaza amsterdam-they thought polite behaviour was just too abnormal. Worse still, I paid in cash for the rooms at the end of the stay and when I returned home, I found I had been charged on my debit card for all three rooms (my card was used for only one room) for the full rate! Has taken a week to organise the refund and am exceptionally grateful i kept the receipt. So after this rant about the staff I would say to other people staying at this hotel to take ALL documentation of the rates you agreed when making the booking and keep receipts of EVERYTHING as I ahve yet to receive an apology from this hotel for our stay and have moved my complaint to the head office here in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: OrlaDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: We are a group of 20 people who holiday at this time every year and this was our first trip to Amsterdam. This was by far the worst hotel we have stayed in. The receptionists were totally unprepared for our arrival and extremely rude when checking all of us in. The night staff were very unhelpful as well. We must have confirmed our booking with the hotel directly about 5 times before our actual arrival but yet they wanted to charge us for an extra night which we had pre-paid beforehand. This hotel in no way merits a 4* rating. Two to three star is the most it would merit. The rooms are small and outdated. If you hate your job and it shows then don't work on a front desk of a hotel reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Central Station”
Reviews.Author: LeighBCD
Reviews.Content: The biggest plus for this hotel is its convenient location to Central Station. Otherwise it is a standard chain hotel, the rooms felt a little tired decor wise. The breakfast was excellent. The other point to note is that the hotel will charge you a penalty if you have to do not stay the full total of nights of your original booking. In my view this is acceptable if you are on a pre-paid package but I was not, I was on a nightly rate and had to leave early for business reasons. Be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Good Reliable hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Antoine10
Reviews.Content: We always stay here when in Amsterdam. We book directly with the hotel and make all special requests with them directly. Good location, casual bar, good room service, clean rooms. Staff have always been very helpful, especially with more specialized dinning requests. has a pool but we never seem to use it. House keeping does a great job. All in all a good hotel. We will be staying there again in July 2007. Book a club room. Well worth the extra and use of the club room upstairs with a great view over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lawrencekvr
Reviews.Content: I booked the Crowne Plaza to celebrate a friends 40th birthday, i contacted the hotel directly to arrange a birthday cake and to request the best rooms available. I booked a club room which give a free minibar and access to club room with free bar, breakfast and internet access along with a nice terrace overlooking the city. Rooms were of a good size and beds very comfortable, and the cake was very tastey. a word of warning the free mini bar does not include hard liquor, we had some vodka and bacardi and were charged accordingly. at checkout i refused to pay for this as it was not made clear free only applied to beer wine, this resulted in me complaining about some mould on the shower wall, spoke with manager and they were then able to provide the hard liquor free and in addition reduce the room rate by 50 euros per night. All in all a good hotel and great location, will definitely return and pay extra for club room. nearly all staff very helpful and polite great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Still got a lot going for it..”
Reviews.Author: Musclebearnz
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights over Christmas 2006. Arrived and was upgraded to a Club Room courtesy of Priority Privilege. The room was large, but initially I thought it didnt have any windows, the room was long and narrow like a shoe box. Then realised there was a small window almost disguised at the side at the end of the room, there wasnt a lot of natural light so had to have the lights on all day. The room had some big comfy arm chairs and a table. The bathroom had seen better days and the tiles in the shower had stained grouting or holes where other fittings had been removed and the holes had not been sealed up. Other than that the room was comfortable and large enough for the two of us. There were lovely toileteries and plentiful supplies. We paid extra to use the club lounge so we could have internet access. The lounge itself was nice enough with plenty of tea/coffee/juice/wine/nibbles always on hand, however some guests have now got wise to the idea that if they pay the 30 Euro charge, they can invade the Club Lounge with all their kids, who hog the computer terminals and have the TV sets on loud when you are trying to have some quiet time or work.. This hotel though has LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION.. 5 minutes walk from the Centraal Station, 5 mins from Damrak, we never had to use a tram the whole time we were there. There is a self service laundry across s the road, so things could not be better.. Would I stay at the Crowne Plaza again.. Hell yeah !! The plus points far outweigh the negatives and the location just tops it off.. we booked via the Crowne Plaza website and the prices seemed to go up and down by the day, so keep an eye on the prices. we were lucky to get a bargain at 94 Euro, but the prices sky rocketed a few days later..

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Decent”
Reviews.Author: rsawh78298
Reviews.Content: Located close to Amsterdam Central Station- 5 minute walk. Good clean non-smoking room. Luggage storage facility was handy. Walking distance to Damrak and tram station. Little pricey as breakfast is additional and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Quality service...”
Reviews.Author: beck_uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights with a group of friends. It was ideally placed for sightseeing around the city, whether it was the museums you were interested in or the red light district (but it was far away enough if you didn't want to venture near the red light district!) The hotel staff were superb and could not be faulted for their friendliness and helpfulness. We found everything clean and met our needs, however the decor etc did need a slight facelift. Security also seemed good, when returning after hours they requested you to show your door card to cctv camera. Although the method seems quite easy to get round if unwanted people did try to enter, it is more than most hotels do to try and prevent unwanted guests. All in all, value for money and well located, well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: HaylingIslander
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in the Crowne Plaza in the centre of Amsterdam over the New Year period. The hotel is very central - a 5 minute walk from Central Station and also Dam Square. Everyone was very friendly and our room was clean and warm! Great place for Amsterdam sights but rather expensive :-(

Reviews.Title: “club rooms not worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: Harvestmouse
Reviews.Content: stayed at the holiday inn crowne plaza Amsterdam near to the centraal station over the christmas weekend and booked a club room however we got a rather small room (331) with two beds. two chairs and table. To get into the mini bar you had to move one of the chairs and two people couldn't move around the room at the same time. We had already booked again for the following new year weekend and asked that when we returned could we have a larger room as again we had booked the club room. The following weekend we had a much larger room (501) again with two beds. however I would question the use of club room. You do get access to the 6th floor lounge with wine and beer, But I have stayed at this hotel many times before in standard rooms, and once.. yes you may have guessed one of the standard rooms I stayed in was room 501. So it seems to me that the term for club room is meaningless and any room can be designated as "club" and the extra benefit is access to the club lounge with wine and beer. So my advise is to book a standard room save yourself a fortune and go to the supermarket over the road and buy yourself a 6 pack and a bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work”
Reviews.Author: highfly
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay here in a year and it wasn't as good as previous stays. Hotel now really needs a facelift. Carpets fraying, furnishings a bit tatty. The first room we went to hadn't been serviced, the second - an "upgrade" to a suite had a tiny bedroom in the eaves with the bed against the outside wall and no room for a bedside table on that side - in fact whoever slept on that side would have to get into bed first or climb over the other person to get in! The type of set up you would be happy enough with as a student, but come on - not in a 4* hotel club room!! Third room ok but a smoking room and we had booked non smoking. Too tired changing rooms to trek back again and move for a 4th time. Staff were very nice and helpful and enthusiastic. Free minibar and club lounge still good value. As posted before the location is fab. If you get a good rate and you are prepared for it not to be stylish and pristine, its ok . We were moving to the Marriott anyway after 2 days because we wanted to be around the Museum/Leidesplain area for a couple of days. Even though the Marriott has just started a refurb programme, their old style rooms were miles better than Crowne Plaza rooms. A couple of general tips about Amsterdam -which I love as a city. Shops don't take credit cards without ID. Shop assistants are very snotty and delight in asking for ID, which if you have any sense is usually safely locked up in the hotel safe. Make sure if you go shopping with cc you have ID. Also the ticket machines for trains at the airport and Central Station don't take Visa credit cards and very few take notes (weird system and not conducive to tourists) Make sure you have change. Big queues were usually tourists who then couldn't get tickets. However - public transport is fantastic overall, once you manage to get your tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: AandPM
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in Amsterdam with some old friends - we wanted somewhere very central but not right in the red light district. CP is ideal for that - in fact it's location is it's biggest asset. It is a comfortable hotel, reasonably priced and well maintained. But it wont win any awards for creativity or hospitality. It's a standard, "much what you would expect" kind of place - but it did the job!

Reviews.Title: “Time for a spruce-up”
Reviews.Author: transatlantica
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental really need to dig deep into their pockets to ensure this Crowne Plaza's interior matches the quality and enthusiasm of their staff. The public areas are in fairly good repair, but the rooms? If ours was typical, it's probably a good two years past being due a decoration. We had ordered a non-smoking room, but didn't get one - we asked at reception and were given the impression that guests didn't overmuch pay any attention to the non-smoking rules anyway; the bathroom had a fairly strong smell of dried urine about it and the windows didn't open, all of which added up to a room that could have done with a bit of an airing. The Club Level Lounge was pretty good - free cold breakfast, free drinks. The view wasn't quite as astonishing as the hotel's publicity might lead you to believe - more worth a curious glance than the sort of balcony you might choose to spend hours on, watching the slightly drunken youths down below make their way into the chinese restaurant across the road - and it should be noted that the lounge is only accessible through a climb up a spiral staircase, so might not be an option for people with mobility problems. The main breakfast buffet is good - although, to be honest, probably more on a par with what you'd expect at a Marriott Courtyard in the US than a Crowne Plaza in Europe, and as such only just about qualifying as value for money. The staff are what make the hotel, though, and here they went out their way to be helpful. The other great plus is the proximity to trams and the central station (the hotel recommends a ten Euro cab ride from the station, but it's really just a step or two across the road.) There is a small gift shop selling newspapers, novelty clog-related items and so on, although it keeps slightly odd hours. There's a pool (seemed very clean) and a traditional Dutch restaurant (didn't try, but, again, seemed to do the job). Wouldn't feel it was demanding a return trip, but wouldn't rule out a second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Ayrshirelinz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while I was on a work course in Amsterdam and really enjoyed it. Staff were helpful, room was spacious and clean and breakfast was fantastic! Good location, very close to the shops and lots of bars. Can't comment on price because it was company paying for it. Would definately return!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: markhomer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the crowne plaza after 2 nights at the Amstel and 1 at the holiday inn RAI. The location of this hotel is central, ideal for exploring the seedier side of Amsterdam. My room was good and I was upgraded to the executive suite with club access which was great. My only critiscism is that the rooms and the reception area do need to be updated very 1980's. The staff were helpful and the free breakfast, drinks etc. were fantastic. If you are looking for an extremely central good quality hotel then I would recommend this hotel 100%

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price and location.”
Reviews.Author: akitas22
Reviews.Content: We were hesistant to book at the Crowne Plaza because of past reviews about noise but we never heard a thing at night. The location was very convenient - within walking distance of all of the sights and restaurants. The concierge was very helpful in making reservations. After living and traveling in Europe for the hottest summer on record - the air conditioning was pure bliss. Our only problem was being placed in a smoking room - but the smell was not too strong. All in all - the hotel looks a little worn but it is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestLinnTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed in this hotel. It is not a 4 star hotel, maybe a 3. The rooms are small and outdated but adequate. If you can get a room facing an alley, they are relatively quiet. The rooms this visit were not exceptionally clean, with dirty grout, and I had to change from my first room as the bathroom toilet had not been cleaned well. The second room was fine. The breakfast is not worth the price. I would look for a better hotel next time. Unfortunately, my company keeps booking travelers here because it is central and cheaper prices can be booked on the internet. The lobby is dark, tired looking and outdated. The staff is pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “looking tired”
Reviews.Author: bongoblog
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night on the club floor. I booked through ichotels web site and asked for a king bed. Check in was a bit slow but i was upgraded to a kind of suite. This had a hall, bedroom and tiny living room with gravel balcony. The decor was early 80's and not that well maintained,stained walls from water seepage, battered paintwork and the tiles around the bath had holes for old fittings drilled and just left making it look a bit dirty. A nice touch is the senseo coffe maker in place of the usualinstant sachets. The club lounge is pleasant enough for a drink but didn't eat anything there. For the 180 euro i paid i guess it is ok for this city but i would pay the usually higher prices

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: heidiwitheford
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is located near the Central Station. Valet parking is available. The facility is very nice with pool, fitness, sauna and restaurant. I recommend a Club room which offers free minibar, use of terrace lounge and free breakfast. If you have a Priority Club card, you can receive a discount on Valet parking. For a city hotel it was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “central and handy”
Reviews.Author: threetenors
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a short walk from Centraal station and provides a very comfortable accomodation with an excellent restaurant. I was upgraded on both of my visits to this hotel which made my stay even more comfortable. Rooms are above average for space and are well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Enjoyed Our Stay - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: DarrenWhitehead
Reviews.Content: We came to Amsterdam for our first anniversary. The Crowne Plaza was a lovely relaxing hotel with excellent room service, a nice quiet bar and restaurant and a buffet breakfast second to none. The breakfast is "all you can eat" and has a large variety of fruits, cerials, yoghurts, pastries and breads plus the cooked section. Wonderful, and breakfast is open from 06:30 to 11:00 hours so there is plenty of scope for those early risers and those lazy snoozers, such as ourselves. The pool in the hotel is cool and relaxing and there are saunas in the changing rooms. With internet access also, the hotel truly was a fantastic place to stay. The hotel is placed in an excellent location within easy walking distance from Dam Square, the red light district and Centraal Station We thought that we would try a kinky location and with the legalised red light district, we decided that Amsterdam would be more kinky than most. In truth, commercialised sex is actually very dull. We went on an organised Red Light tour which is well worth the Euros. Not only did it give us a flavour and an interesting perspective on "the oldest trade" but it also gave us a good grounding for finding our bearings in the maze of streets, alleys and canals. Personally I think that the oldest trade must be farming but I am wrong apparently. If, however, farming is your bag, there are plenty of organised tours of cheese farms etc. Many people recommend the sex show, Cassa Rosso but I really wouldn't bother. It seemed like a stale show full of stag parties and they bring customers in and out at such a constant rate that it does detract from the "show". Not worth it, in my opinion. Spend your 45 Euros each on a nice meal instead. The drugs scene is alive and well in Amsterdam and it is tourism that the locals would rather not have. As well as the legalised "coffee shops" there is no shortage of sellers on the street offering harder drugs than cannabis. We have never been into hard or soft drugs and the proliferation of what appeared to be zombies was quite disconcerting. So many people were spaced out it was unreal. Many of these were riding around carelessly on bicycles. With the combination of cannabis, bicycles, trams, canals and the distraction of "window brothels" I am suprised that there are not more serious accidents. Rembrant Square seems to be a much rougher part of the city and we were approached by beggars on 3 occasions. I personally witnessed 2 crimes take place in this area and we did not feel safe in this location, despite hoards of other tourists. The red light area was safer. I would avoid Rembrant Square. Many people recommend trams and river taxis to get about but we went more or less everywhere on foot and nothing was too far away. If you are going to visit Anne Frank's house, get there early to avoid the queues. Madamme Tussauds is also a very good attraction to visit and we would recommend this too. In short we highly enjoyed our Amsterdam visit but it was made all the more special by The Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely central location”
Reviews.Author: prcwood
Reviews.Content: Location is great, right by Central Station and 2 mins walk to Dam Square. Rooms are a bit pokey so this year we decided to go for a club room. Little bit more space and access to the lovely roof terrace. The rooms are OK but very overpriced for what you get, but i suppose you're paying for the location!

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza -Couldn't Provide”
Reviews.Author: SE-Explorer
Reviews.Content: Paid 290 dollars (including taxes) for a club level room expected something more than a dumpy Howard Johnsons. The location is within 5 minutes walk from the Centraal rail station, which is its best feature. The rooms are really worn; we changed rooms 3 times and finally realized that there are no "club" rooms. The only added value, that you pay for, is internet access (available cheaply down the street at a cyber cafe),''unlimited' mini bar (2 beers, 2 sodas, 2 waters, etc - refilled once a day) and breakfast. I have just traveled and stayed in Salzburg, Vienna, & Prague at the Sheraton, Intercontenental, Radisson SAS & Marriott respectively: the Crowne Plaza in Amsterdam was the most expensive AND the worst hotel by far. I don't mind a small room, but the bedding, mattress and towels & amenities at the other hotels were of the highest quality. In addition the Crowne Plaza had only one functioning elevator. We were upgraded, but sadly the room while larger, was just the same mediocre quality as all the other rooms. The staff tried their best, but given the physical state of the hotel, there's not much they can do. When I return to Amsterdam, I will definitely NOT return to the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but grossly overpriced for quality of accomodations”
Reviews.Author: edleo13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent (1) night at the Crowne Plaza City Centre while on a 2 week European trip. The biggest positive of this hotel is the proximity to Centraal Station and Amsterdam's main attractions (i.e. Dam Square, shopping, Red Light District, Anne Frank House). Everything is within walking distance. From the train station, exit to the southwest (right hand side of the station if you're facing the city), and walk up N.Z. Voorburgwal. Roughly 2 blocks - very easy. Unfortunately, when you get to the Hotel, you will soon discover what so many other reviewers have already: this place is worth about half of what it charges. My wife and I paid 249 euros (plus another 5% tax not included in this rate) for a room that was about the equivalent of an older Best Western or Holiday Inn in the US. Although well maintained by housekeeping, the decor was clearly from the 1980s and is in bad need of an upgrade. For 249 euros, I expect a certain wow factor and this place just doesn't deliver. In summary, if this place went for 159-179 euros per night, I'd highly recommend it. The hotel is fine in many respects: helpful front desk, in room iron/ironing board, wash clothes, & nice indoor pool. Nice touches that are important to me as a traveler. However - just not worth 249 euros per night. A couple of final thoughts on Amsterdam... tickets for the trolley/tram system can be purchased at the Hotel front desk. They aren't available at any of the stops other than those at Centraal Station. This thing isn't nearly as user friendly as the public transport in Paris/London/Munich/etc. and having these strips will make your life much easier. Secondly, the hotel offers self-service laundry in the basement. Cost is 5 euros per machine and includes soap for the washer. There's also a laundromat just up the street from the hotel (towards Dam Square) if you are looking for something a little more economical and don't mind walking a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: thirty3
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 10-13th in a club room which was well worth the extra cost - breakfast included, free minibar, free beer, wine, soft drinks and nibbles in the air conditioned 'club lounge' on the rooftop which also has a pleasant terace with reasonable views. Location is excellently central, staff were helpful, hotel was clean and tidy. Our room was inward facing on the fifth floor and was very quiet. Very happy with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: hattiepops
Reviews.Content: The Crownw Plaza in Amsterdam is wonderfully situated very close to the main station, shopping and to Dam Square. Canal Trips and the tram service are minutes away so it is an excellent base for a short break in the city when time may be at a premium. We found the hotel to be good but not exceptional. The breakfast was excellent with a wide choice of hot and cold food with a reasonable range of fresh fruit. Service was good with helpful and considerate staff. The room was a bit on the small side but fairly normal for a hotel in the centre of a European city. Despite the central city location we found the hotel to be fairly quiet but an insomniac may be troubled by the trams which seem to run all night....they certainly operate late at night and start early in the morning and may even operate all night. One tip for future travellers : avoid Queens Day ( April 29 in 2006) if you want to explore the city or worse still, leave the city on that day. It is a national holiday when approximately 1 million people (all wearing orange) flood into the city from other parts of the Netherlands. No doubt it is fine if you want to take part but awful if you plan some final sightseeing on day of departure.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: BillMackem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superbly placed adjacent to the Central Station, the staff were very friendly and helpful however when all was taken into account Â£175 per night without breakfast is very expensive for what was no better in facilities terms than a Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darlolad
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Crowne Plaza, Amsterdam City Centre immensely. The hotel was clean & comfortable and in a great location. The leisure facilites were hardly used by other guests so we had a virtually private pool/gym/sauna most days. The staff were friendly and helpful, the food was very good. We also got a good deal on the room rate by booking through Supabreak. (Even the gift shop in the hotel foyer was reasonably priced and well stocked!!). I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: ashday
Reviews.Content: We stayed March 22 thru 26. The hotel is average I would rate this a 3 star hotel nothing better. The room is large for 3 people. The beds were not that comfortable and there was mildew in the shower. They advertise free internet not so. The gym has very old equipment only 1/2 working. Special note if even moving things in mini bar they will charge you and it will be on your bill. No problem though resolving this issue. The location of this hotel is in easy walking distance of train station, Dam square, Anne Franks Hse, Red Light District, shopping. The tram is very close and safe way to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “More than impressed with Crowne Plaza, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TomPea
Reviews.Content: Just had a 3 night stay in the Crowne Plaza with our 2 year old daughter. Staff were generally very friendly, and we felt welcomed. The room was pretty spacious with 2 good sized beds, plenty of toiletries etc and clean bathroom. V powerful, hot shower; enjoyed having robes and free ice from machine in corridor. Mini-bar is a stupid price - Â£4 for a can of beer and for same price, at supermarket at the end of the road, you can get 12 bottles of Grolsch!!! Pool was great and generally very empty - loads of clean towels in changing room. Found the location excellent - really close to train station which made train transfer from the airport cheap and very easy even with loads of bags and a toddler. Didn't try breakfast at hotel, but lots of places close-by offering good, authentic coffee/ bagel experience. Also ate in 2 restuarants close by - both pizzerias! - and both were good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Auston
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3-night stay at the Crowne Plaza and was extremely pleased. Staff was always friendly and helpful. Room cleaning was efficient and well done (they indicate theyâ€™re installing and testing some sort of new cleaning system this month). Double beds were very comfortable. And the pool and sauna were a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. Yes, I wish the rooms' windows opened, but all together, Iâ€™d definitely stay here again. Certainly canâ€™t beat the location, either.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not worth 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: ash0512
Reviews.Content: Just had a 3 night stay there, staff very helpful, but the rooms a little old and we had a scum mark all around the bath in our 'cleaned room'. breakfast was 22 euros so went to the mcdonald's round the corner 9 euro for 2 people. Mini-bar!!! just had a can of sprite and was 3.70 euro's not cheap. The hotel was clean and tidy overall but not worth the 5 star or the cost, it is worth shopping around and checking all other hotel's there si a new ibis right round the corner next to the station and i may stay there and pocket the money i save and go and eat out somewhere nice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: NickyfromNotts
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the crown plaza after a terrible night in another hotel and must say my husband and I had a very plesent stay. The room was large and very clean and had all the usual trimmings you would expect. We would with out a doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Matildas!”
Reviews.Author: VesperGirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great area and very central and clean. I am sure the front rooms are a bit noisey, but we had a back room, away from the passing trams. The food/drink in the hotel is very expensive. The breakfast is 22 euros, but because i'm a gold member, i got it for 11. The food was great though. ONLY complaint - THE RUDE STAFF. Well particualarly, two women there, one being the boss and her subordinate. They were both rude and crass and disrespectful. I tried to complain, but the guess what, it's the boss who's rude to me, so who am i going to complain to!? I had to end up writing ic hotels themselves. Other than that, great hotel. Oh, one more thing, there are rats around... i was using the internet and one ran right behind the computer across the table! EEEEEWWWWKKKKK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms could do with refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterWoman
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location - moments from Central Station, and easily walkable to all main tourist sites. Plenty of restaurants and shops around, and tram stop just outside. Rooms ok - but not 4 star (certainly not 5 star). 2 double beds for our family of 4 were fine - room not too cramped. Clean, but old furnishings - beds beginning to sag, and bathroom in need of refurbishment (eg peeling paint on radiator). Bath robes provided - but had seen better days, and towels very thin and worn. Windows did not open - but air conditioning fine - and no smells! Communal areas (lobby, restaurants) pleasant - breakfast good but not cheap (Euros 22 - but helped that children eat free) - ate out for other meals. Gym adequate - small, but functional - but pool very small (ok for kids, but not for exercise!). Overall, fine - given the location, may stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel very central. Reception desk helpful. However, guests should be aware that once the mini-fridge is opened and bottles and cans, etc. are shifted around (to make space for one's personal water, or canned drinks), even though the guest does not use a single item from this fridge, on check-out you are automatically billed for just moving these items. Therefore, one should check their accounts very carefully on check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City - Much improved!!”
Reviews.Author: Soundbytes
Reviews.Content: We stayed the Crowne Plaza Amsterdam City for 2 nights 03rd - 5th September. We booked two rooms as we took my parents over for a short break. Prior to booking in February, we looked at Tripadvisor and saw some very mixed reviews. Some were good, but most found fault with the staff and general standard of decor / bathrooms within the hotel. Being Priority Club members and regular contributors to sites such as this, we wrote to the hotel and asked for their comments in response to the previous negative reviews. We received an immediate response from the reservations manager who addressed each of the issues in turn and explained that by the time we arrived in September most (if not all) problems would be resolved. We got the opportunity to book our room at a discount rate on the IC web site so thought we would take a chance. Upon arrival, we were greeted by an efficient concierge who took all our luggage and escorted us through to check in. The desk staff were friendly and helpful. Once I had introduced myself, I was reffered to by name (as all priority club members should be) and the whole check in procedure was seemless and simple. We arrived at our rooms to find the luggage inside and waiting. We booked superior club rooms and found both rooms to be clean, well presented and spacious (by Amsterdam standards). Both rooms had windows that opened and we had no smoke related problems that others seem to have experienced. Our deal included free minibar (less spirits) and access / use of the club lounge facilities. We had a super breakfast out on the club lounge terrace on the 6th floor overlooking the city and found the continental breakfast selection to be more than adequate. We did order a sandwich and fries for lunch on room service. The service was prompt but the sandwich was a little bland and not really the sort of thing you expect for the money. We did look at the pool and Gym but were too busy to use them on this visit. I did note that the pool was available for use 24 hours a day which is a big plus I noted for future visits. All in all, we were more than a little worried before coming over. From what we saw, there is clear evidence that a large amount of effort has been given into improving the hotel and staff. It is not the best hotel in Amsterdam (You cannot really look past the Amstel) but it did represent very good value for money and it has a super location if you want to drop out of your room straight into the heart of the city. Well worth a visit especially if you can get a good deal. Key plus's Location Helpful and efficient staff Pool Lounge terrace on roof Key Negatives Room service food quality You have to pay extra for late check out Still occassional signs of wear to carpets and walls

Reviews.Title: “Great - No smell of smoke and has air conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel before I read the reviews for my boyfriend's birthday. I got quite a fright when I read up on them and read all the stories of the smell of some and no air. I don't know what all the fuss was about because it was lovely. It's only a short walk from Central Train Station, around the corner from all the shops and a short walking distance to Dam Sq. The staff were really nice. The rooms have air conditioning so there is lots of air! The pool was really nice and warm too. The bar was also really nice and relaxing. I would really recommend this hotel and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: ruizjudy
Reviews.Content: Very good location; Satff are very helpful and knowledgeable; You will not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kathi06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a total of four nights in this hotel. We were there two nights before a cruise and two nights after. The staff is excellent and very accomodating. We were given a late check out and an early check in with our Priority membership ( which is a matter of filling out their membership form on the internet). The rooms were both clean and fresh smelling (both smoking rooms) absolutely no smell of smoke in the hallway or room. The bathroom was clean and fresh ...no mold as reported in previous reviews. Excellent location..easy walking distance to Centrall Station. We did not eat there but visited the bar which is very attractive and great service. We would definetly return to this hotel and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location, spa facilities on site, and a very nice club room (not sure if it is worth the extra fee, but it certainly came in handy). We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A smoke filled disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: ellenb2008
Reviews.Content: After traveling through Europe, the Crowne Plaza was supposed to be the highlight of our trip (At least it was the most expensive hotel!). We checked in to find out that the hotel was oversold, as it turned out to be the busiest weekend of the year. As the front desk scrambled to find a room for us, they asked us if we would take a smoking room. I agreed to it only if we were in a room with windows that opened because my son has asthma. After much searching, the gentleman found us a nonsmoking room, but it wouldn't be ready for an hour. We went to have a late lunch and then came back and checked in. The first thing I noticed when I opened the door was a the overpowering smell of cigarette smoke. I double checked that the door does say "nonsmoking" on it. I called down to the front desk, but as they were overbooked, they couldn't move me. However, they did offer to either come up with a machine that removes the smoke from fabric or to spray air freshener. I decided that I didn't want to hang out in the room waiting, so I refused. I never got used to the smell, though, and regretting not taking them up on it. Coming out of the shower and putting a smokey towel up to my face turned my stomach. The room was okay, like any other American chain hotel. I did find the beds to be extremely comfortable, though. The location is great and the staff was always helpful. I tried the buffet breakfast on the last day and, while it was very good, it was very, VERY, expensive! There are other hotels that I would stay at before "splurging" on the Crowne Plaza again. It was definitely a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Amsterdam!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarcMarinaPENN01
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Husband stayed here in Sept 2004 for two nights the staff were lovely the hotel was lovely although the rooms a bit small, we had a very enjoyabel stay at the Crowne Plaza. It was very handy for Centraal Station, and althogether near most things

Reviews.Title: “This is not what I expect booking a Crown Plaza”
Reviews.Author: stevenBrussels
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small and noisy. Well equiped but standard room. I stay a lot at crown plaza hotels but this one is below average. breakfast was excellent and location is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: SRocks
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the best hotel we have ever stayed in, I have stayed in 4 star hotels all over the world and this hotel stands out on its own. The staff are very friendly and helpful creating a great athmosphere at all times, the bedrooms are excellent with all facilities at hand and cleanliness is exquisite!
