Location is perfect for the business traveller or the tourist. The restaurants are excellent delicous food in particular their dutch menu and finally the Breakfast wow! Buffet style breakfast with plenty of choice always served hot and again the service is of a very high standard... Definitely highly recommended if you are staying in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Crowne Plaza Hotel, City Centre, Amsterdam for 4 nights. Opted for a club room, which gave you complimentary use of the minibar (wine, beer and soft drinks only excluded spirits and snacks), and free in room films. Also included full access to the club lounge located on the top floor, with great views over Amsterdam and great sunsets on a clear day. Again snacks and drinks are free, open 7am through to midnight. You also have your complimentary continental breakfast in the lounge. There is also a very sweet little guest who lives in the lounge, you'll recognise him if you see him! I booked this through Hotels as the rate was much better than the hotel was offering if you booked direct. The hotel is set right in the heart of the city 10mins gentle walk from Central Station, so don't bother with a cab. The concierge was very good, really new his stuff and gave us a few good tips. Some entrance tickets are cheaper if you buy them from the hotel than the venue itself. Only thing I didn't like was that the hotel room was really warm, even with the thermostat turned right down and you couldn't open the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Service”
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on January 22 for three nights. I paid 125 Euros per night, which is a fair price. The hotel staff at the front desk were indifferent and seemed to be bothered by customer interruptions. I stay in Amsterdam regularly but this was the first time I had to wait until 3pm to get my room. Even though I am a Platinum member of the Priority Club, I was not offered an upgrade on my room. I moved out after three nights since the room rate doubled. I spend the rest of my stay at the Golden Tulip and was very pleased with their service and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, not too expensive and friendly”
Reviews.Author: mrfargo2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights here in late December. We were offered an upgrade to a club room for "just" 70 euro per night. What the heck -- we were in Amsterdam on holidays, we went for it. And what a deal it was. Unlimited use of the minibar (really!), pay movies at no extra charge, use of the very nice (but usually messy) club room, free wireless internet and more. Well worth the US$100 or so per night. Room was at the back of the hotel facing another building (i.e lousy view), but that was fine since we had probably the quietest room in the hotel. I'd ask for the same room again! Hotel is centrally located with a tram stop just down the block about 100 meters. Concierge staff was incredible. Very informative, spent lots of time with us and were able to sell us tickets for just about anything worthwhile to see in AMS. The Amsterdammer Bar at the hotel was great. Friendly bartender (thanks for that 15-year old Geneveer shot -- it hit the spot!) and entertaining people watching along one of the main shopping streets in the city. Room was small, but certainly large enough for the two of us. I'd read the previous reviews about mold and mildew in the bathroom tiles and didn't really believe it until I saw it! But it wasn't a huge deal when compared to the friendly staff, good location and decent Internet rate that we received. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A strong 4-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Amsterdam at the Crowne Plaza City Centre, and have to give a really big thumbs up. The room was spacious with an interesting, but not spectacular, view of the street below. Good for people watching but not awe-inspiring. The room was cleaned daily very well. The water was hot and the pressure strong, and with plenty of soap, shampoo, etc. The staff was by and large friendly and helpful. The buffet, though expensive, is delicious and plentiful. I've seen rankings of it as a "Five Star Hotel" -- be aware that it is not a U.S. 5 star hotel, but I would give it a U.S. 4 star ranking. As far as Amsterdam hotels go, I believe it is a 5 star. The lobby is beautiful and well maintained. The restaurant and bar are good. All in all, a great hotel with no complaints whatsoever. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: headache
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a club room, Bathroom tiles looked like they had been put up about 100 years ago, Even the grouting between the tiles was dirty. ugh! Our club room window was op a wall great views for the price! Otherwise the room was ok, Breakfast was excellent lots of choice very good, Bar staff and bar food excellent, Hotel is close to all shopping, restaurants, and other stuff!! No problems walking at night.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crown Plaza hotel several weeks ago having left another hotel (Prinzhendrik) due to their refusal to move us to a quiet room and total indifference...its along story. As we were already in Amsterdam we were able to see several hotels first hand. Most that seemed reasonable were full....others were very high in price. We knew that we wanted to stay around the area where the CP was. We were looking for 2 adjacent rooms and were able to get a reasonable price - not much more than the previous. Another review commented on the breakfast price. If you order in advance you can get at 16euros and also...kids are free. So what did we get?? Everything we wanted. A quiet night sleep, good location, robes, good b'fast. etc.

HotelInfo.Address: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, Amsterdam 1012 RC, The Netherlands
